original: At the first God made the heaven and the earth.
translation: In die begin het God die hemel en die aarde geskep.

original: And the earth was waste and without form; and it was dark on the face of the deep: and the Spirit of God was moving on the face of the waters.
translation: Die aarde was leeg en sonder vorm; dit was donker oor die diepte; en God se Gees het op die waters beweeg.

original: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
translation: En God het gesê, Laat daar lig wees: en daar was lig.

original: And God, looking on the light, saw that it was good: and God made a division between the light and the dark,
translation: En God het na die lig gekyk en gesien dit is goed: en God het 'n skeiding gemaak tussen die lig en die donker.

original: Naming the light, Day, and the dark, Night. And there was evening and there was morning, the first day.
translation: God het die lig Dag genoem, en die donker Nag. En daar was aand en daar was oggend, die eerste dag.

original: And God said, Let there be a solid arch stretching over the waters, parting the waters from the waters.
translation: En God het gesê: Laat daar 'n stevige boog wees wat oor die waters strek en die waters van mekaar skei.

original: And God made the arch for a division between the waters which were under the arch and those which were over it: and it was so.
translation: En God het die reënboog gemaak om 'n scheiding te wees tussen die water wat onder die reënboog was en die water wat daarbo was: en dit was so.

original: And God gave the arch the name of Heaven. And there was evening and there was morning, the second day.
translation: God het die boog Hemel genoem. En daar was aand en daar was oggend, dit was die tweede dag.

original: And God said, Let the waters under the heaven come together in one place, and let the dry land be seen: and it was so.
translation: En God het gesê: Laat die waters onder die hemel bymekaar kom op een plek, en laat die droë grond sigbaar wees: en dit het gebeur.

original: And God gave the dry land the name of Earth; and the waters together in their place were named Seas: and God saw that it was good.
translation: En God het die droë land Aarde genoem; en die waters het Hy in hul plek Sees genoem: en God het gesien dit was goed.

original: And God said, Let grass come up on the earth, and plants producing seed, and fruit-trees giving fruit, in which is their seed, after their sort: and it was so.
translation: En God het gesê, Laat gras op die aarde groei, en plante wat sade maak, en vrugtebome wat vrugte dra met hulle saadjies daarin, soos hulle soort is: en dit het gebeur.

original: And grass came up on the earth, and every plant producing seed of its sort, and every tree producing fruit, in which is its seed, of its sort: and God saw that it was good.
translation: En gras het op die aarde gegroei, en elke plant wat sy eie sade maak, en elke boom wat vrugte dra met sy sade daarin: en God het gesien dat dit goed was.

original: And there was evening and there was morning, the third day.
translation: En daar was aand en oggend, die derde dag.

original: And God said, Let there be lights in the arch of heaven, for a division between the day and the night, and let them be for signs, and for marking the changes of the year, and for days and for years:
translation: En God het gesê: Laat daar ligte wees in die hemel om die dag van die nag af te skei, en hulle moet ook gebruik word as tekens om die seisoene, dae en jare aan te dui.

original: And let them be for lights in the arch of heaven to give light on the earth: and it was so.
translation: Laat hulle ligte wees in die lug om die aarde te verlig: en dit het gebeur.

original: And God made the two great lights: the greater light to be the ruler of the day, and the smaller light to be the ruler of the night: and he made the stars.
translation: En God het die twee groot ligte gemaak: die een lig om oor die dag te regeer, en die ander lig om oor die nag te regeer: en Hy het die sterre gemaak.

original: And God put them in the arch of heaven, to give light on the earth;
translation: En God het hulle in die lug gesit om lig op die aarde te gee;

original: To have rule over the day and the night, and for a division between the light and the dark: and God saw that it was good.
translation: Om oor die dag en die nag te heers, en om 'n skeiding tussen die lig en die donker te hê: en God het gesien dit is goed.

original: And there was evening and there was morning, the fourth day.
translation: Daar was aand en daar was oggend, die vierde dag.

original: And God said, Let the waters be full of living things, and let birds be in flight over the earth under the arch of heaven.
translation: Toe het God gesê: Laat die waters vol wees van lewende dinge, en laat voëls oor die aarde vlieg onder die hemel.

original: And God made great sea-beasts, and every sort of living and moving thing with which the waters were full, and every sort of winged bird: and God saw that it was good.
translation: En God het groot see-diere gemaak, en elke soort lewende en bewegende ding waarvan die waters vol was, en elke soort gevleugelde voël; en God het gesien dit is goed.

original: And God gave them his blessing, saying, Be fertile and have increase, making all the waters of the seas full, and let the birds be increased in the earth.
translation: En God het hulle sy seën gegee en gesê: "Wees vrugbaar en vermeerder, vul al die waters van die see, en laat die voëls meer word op die aarde."

original: And there was evening and there was morning, the fifth day.
translation: Dit was aand en dit was oggend, die vyfde dag.

original: And God said, Let the earth give birth to all sorts of living things, cattle and all things moving on the earth, and beasts of the earth after their sort: and it was so.
translation: En God het gesê, laat die aarde vol wees van al die lewensvorme, van diere en alles wat op die aarde beweeg, en wilde diere van die aarde volgens hul soort: en dit was so.

original: And God made the beast of the earth after its sort, and the cattle after their sort, and everything moving on the face of the earth after its sort: and God saw that it was good.
translation: En God het die diere op die aarde geskep volgens hul soort, en die vee volgens hul soort, en alles wat op die aarde beweeg volgens sy soort: en God het gesien dit was goed.

original: And God said, Let us make man in our image, like us: and let him have rule over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the air and over the cattle and over all the earth and over every living thing which goes flat on the earth.
translation: En God het gesê, Kom ons maak die mens soos ons, in ons beeld: en laat hom regeer oor die vissies in die see, die voëls in die lug, die diere, oor die hele aarde en oor elke lewende ding wat op die aarde rondbeweeg.

original: And God made man in his image, in the image of God he made him: male and female he made them.
translation: En God het die mens in sy beeld gemaak; man en vrou het Hy gemaak.

original: And God gave them his blessing and said to them, Be fertile and have increase, and make the earth full and be masters of it; be rulers over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the air and over every living thing moving on the earth.
translation: En God het vir hulle sy seën gegee en gesê: 'Wees vrugbaar en vermeerder, maak die aarde vol en wees in beheer daarvan; wees die heersers oor die visse in die see, oor die voëls in die lug en oor alles wat op die aarde beweeg.'

original: And God said, See, I have given you every plant producing seed, on the face of all the earth, and every tree which has fruit producing seed: they will be for your food:
translation: En God het gesê, Kyk, ek het vir julle elke plant wat saad maak gegee reg oor die aarde, en elke boom wat vrugte het wat saad het: hulle sal vir julle kos wees.

original: And to every beast of the earth and to every bird of the air and every living thing moving on the face of the earth I have given every green plant for food: and it was so.
translation: Ek het vir elke dier op die aarde, elke voël in die lug, en elke lewende ding wat op die grond beweeg, elke groen plant as kos gegee: en dit was so.

original: And God saw everything which he had made and it was very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.
translation: En God het alles gesien wat Hy gemaak het en dit was baie goed. En daar was aand en daar was oggend, die sesde dag.

original: And the heaven and the earth and all things in them were complete.
translation: En die hemel en die aarde en al die dinge daarin was voltooi.

original: And on the seventh day God came to the end of all his work; and on the seventh day he took his rest from all the work which he had done.
translation: Op die sewende dag het God sy werk afgehandel; en op die sewende dag het Hy gerus van al die werk wat Hy gedoen het.

original: And God gave his blessing to the seventh day and made it holy: because on that day he took his rest from all the work which he had made and done.
translation: En God het sy seën gegee aan die sewende dag en dit heilig gemaak, omdat Hy op daardie dag van al die werk wat Hy gedoen het, rus geneem het.

original: These are the generations of the heaven and the earth when they were made.
translation: Dit is die geslagte van die hemel en die aarde toe hulle gemaak is.

original: In the day when the Lord God made earth and heaven there were no plants of the field on the earth, and no grass had come up: for the Lord God had not sent rain on the earth and there was no man to do work on the land.
translation: In die dag toe die Here God die aarde en die hemel gemaak het, was daar geen plante op die aarde nie, en geen gras het gegroei nie, want die Here God het nie reën op die aarde gestuur nie, en daar was niemand om op die grond te werk nie.

original: But a mist went up from the earth, watering all the face of the land.
translation: Maar 'n mis het uit die grond gestyg en die hele aarde natgemaak.

original: And the Lord God made man from the dust of the earth, breathing into him the breath of life: and man became a living soul.
translation: Die Here God het die mens uit die stof van die aarde gemaak en vir hom die asem van die lewe gegee: en die mens het 'n lewende siel geword.

original: And the Lord God made a garden in the east, in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had made.
translation: En die Here God het 'n tuin in die ooste gemaak, in Eden; en daar het Hy die man wat Hy gemaak het, geplaas.

original: And out of the earth the Lord made every tree to come, delighting the eye and good for food; and in the middle of the garden, the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
translation: En uit die grond het die Here elke boom gemaakt wat mooi is om na te kyk en lekker om te eet; en in die middel van die tuin was die boom van die lewe en die boom van die kennis van goed en sleg.

original: And a river went out of Eden giving water to the garden; and from there it was parted and became four streams.
translation: En 'n rivier het uit Eden uitgekom om die tuin van water te gee; en van daar het dit in vier strome verdeel.

original: The name of the first is Pishon, which goes round about all the land of Havilah where there is gold.
translation: Die naam van die eerste is Pishon, wat rondom die hele land van Havilah loop waar daar goud is.

original: And the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
translation: En die goud van daardie land is goed: daar is bdellium en oniks.

original: And the name of the second river is Gihon: this river goes round all the land of Cush.
translation: Die naam van die tweede rivier is Gihon: hierdie rivier draai om al die land van Kus.

original: And the name of the third river is Tigris, which goes to the east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.
translation: Die naam van die derde rivier is Tigris, wat na die ooste van Assirië vloei. Die vierde rivier is die Eufraat.

original: And the Lord God took the man and put him in the garden of Eden to do work in it and take care of it.
translation: En die Here God het die man geneem en in die tuin van Eden gesit om daarin te werk en dit te versorg.

original: And the Lord God gave the man orders, saying, You may freely take of the fruit of every tree of the garden:
translation: Die Here God het vir die man gesê dat hy gratis vrugte van elke boom in die tuin mag pluk.

original: But of the fruit of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you may not take; for on the day when you take of it, death will certainly come to you.
translation: Maar jy mag nie die vrug van die boom van die kennis van goed en kwaad neem nie; want op die dag wanneer jy dit neem, sal jy beslis doodgaan.

original: And the Lord God said, It is not good for the man to be by himself: I will make one like himself as a help to him
translation: En die Here God het gesê, Dit is nie goed dat die man alleen is nie: Ek sal iemand maak wat soos hy is om hom te help.

original: And from the earth the Lord God made every beast of the field and every bird of the air, and took them to the man to see what names he would give them: and whatever name he gave to any living thing, that was its name.
translation: En die Here God het uit die aarde elke dier van die veld en elke voël van die lug gemaak en dit na die man gebring om te kyk watter name hy vir hulle sou gee: en enige naam wat hy aan enige lewende ding gegee het, dit was sy naam.

original: And the man gave names to all cattle and to the birds of the air and to every beast of the field; but Adam had no one like himself as a help.
translation: En die man het name gegee aan al die diere en aan al die voëls in die lug; maar Adam het niemand gehad soos hy om hom te help nie.

original: And the Lord God sent a deep sleep on the man, and took one of the bones from his side while he was sleeping, joining up the flesh again in its place:
translation: En die Here God het 'n diep slaap oor die man gestuur, en terwyl hy geslaap het, het Hy een van sy ribbes geneem en die vleis weer op sy plek gesit.

original: And the bone which the Lord God had taken from the man he made into a woman, and took her to the man.
translation: En die been wat die Here God van die man gehaal het, het Hy in 'n vrou verander en haar na die man gebring.

original: And the man said, This is now bone of my bone and flesh of my flesh: let her name be Woman because she was taken out of Man.
translation: Die man het gesê, "Dit is nou been van my been en vlees van my vlees: laat haar naam Vrou wees omdat sy uit die Man geneem is."

original: For this cause will a man go away from his father and his mother and be joined to his wife; and they will be one flesh.
translation: Daarom sal 'n man sy ma en pa verlaat en by sy vrou wees; en hulle sal een wees.

original: And the man and his wife were without clothing, and they had no sense of shame.
translation: Die man en sy vrou was kaal, en hulle het nie skaam gevoel nie.

original: Now the snake was wiser than any beast of the field which the Lord God had made. And he said to the woman, Has God truly said that you may not take of the fruit of any tree in the garden?
translation: Die slang was slimmer as enige ander dier wat die Here God gemaak het. En hy het vir die vrou gesê: Het God regtig gesê dat julle nie van die vrug van enige boom in die tuin mag eet nie?

original: And the woman said, We may take of the fruit of the trees in the garden:
translation: En die vrou het gesê, Ons mag van die vrugte van die bome in die tuin eet.

original: But of the fruit of the tree in the middle of the garden, God has said, If you take of it or put your hands on it, death will come to you.
translation: maar van die vrug van die boom in die middel van die tuin, het God gesê, as julle daarvan neem of julle hande daarop sit, sal die dood julle oorkom.

original: And the snake said, Death will not certainly come to you:
translation: En die slang het gesê, Dood sal nie beslis na jou toe kom nie:

original: For God sees that on the day when you take of its fruit, your eyes will be open, and you will be as gods, having knowledge of good and evil.
translation: Want God sien dat op die dag wanneer jy van die vrugte eet, jou oë sal oopgaan, en jy sal soos gode wees, met kennis van goed en kwaad.

original: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and a delight to the eyes, and to be desired to make one wise, she took of its fruit, and gave it to her husband.
translation: Toe die vrou gesien het dat die boom goed was om te eet, mooi was om na te kyk, en dat jy slim kon word van dit, het sy van die vrug gevat en dit aan haar man gegee.

original: And their eyes were open and they were conscious that they had no clothing and they made themselves coats of leaves stitched together.
translation: Hulle se oë was oop en hulle het besef dat hulle nie klere gehad het nie, en hulle het vir hulself jasse van blare gemaak wat aanmekaar gestik is.

original: And there came to them the sound of the Lord God walking in the garden in the evening wind: and the man and his wife went to a secret place among the trees of the garden, away from the eyes of the Lord God.
translation: En daar het hulle die geluid van die Here God gehoor wat in die tuin stap in die aandwind, en die man en sy vrou het na 'n geheim plek tussen die bome van die tuin gegaan, weg van God se oog.

original: And the voice of the Lord God came to the man, saying, Where are you?
translation: En die stem van God het vir die man gesê, Waar is jy?

original: And he said, Hearing your voice in the garden I was full of fear, because I was without clothing: and I kept myself from your eyes.
translation: En hy het gesê, Toe ek jou stem in die tuin hoor, was ek vol vrees, omdat ek glad nie klere aan gehad het nie: en ek het myself van jou afgekeer.

original: And he said, Who gave you the knowledge that you were without clothing? Have you taken of the fruit of the tree which I said you were not to take?
translation: Hy het gesê, Wie het jou laat weet dat jy sonder klere was? Het jy van die vrug van die boom geëet waarvan ek gesê het jy moet nie eet nie?

original: And the man said, The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me the fruit of the tree and I took it.
translation: En die man het gesê, Die vrou wat U vir my gegee het om saam met my te wees, het my die vrug van die boom gegee en ek het dit geneem.

original: And the Lord God said to the woman, What have you done? And the woman said, I was tricked by the deceit of the snake and I took it.
translation: Toe het die Here God vir die vrou gesê: Wat het jy gedoen? En die vrou het geantwoord: Ek is bedrieg deur die slang en ek het dit geneem.

original: And the Lord God said to the snake, Because you have done this you are cursed more than all cattle and every beast of the field; you will go flat on the earth, and dust will be your food all the days of your life:
translation: Toe het die Here God vir die slang gesê: "Omdat jy dit gedoen het, is jy meer vervloek as al die diere en al die wilde diere; jy sal op die grond kruip en stof sal jou kos wees al die dae van jou lewe."

original: And there will be war between you and the woman and between your seed and her seed: by him will your head be crushed and by you his foot will be wounded.
translation: Daar sal oorlog wees tussen jou en die vrou en tussen jou kinders en haar kinders: hy sal jou kop verpletter en jy sal sy voet seergemaak.

original: To the woman he said, Great will be your pain in childbirth; in sorrow will your children come to birth; still your desire will be for your husband, but he will be your master.
translation: Aan die vrou het Hy gesê, jy sal baie pyn hê wanneer jy jou kind kry; in hartseer sal jou kinders gebore word; maar jy sal steeds vir jou man wil hê, en hy sal jou baas wees.

original: And to Adam he said, Because you gave ear to the voice of your wife and took of the fruit of the tree which I said you were not to take, the earth is cursed on your account; in pain you will get your food from it all your life.
translation: En vir Adam het Hy gesê, Omdat jy na jou vrou se stem geluister het en van die vrug van die boom geneem het wat ek gesê het jy nie mag neem nie, is die aarde vervloek weens jou; in pyn sal jy jou kos uit dit kry vir al jou lewe.

original: Thorns and waste plants will come up, and the plants of the field will be your food;
translation: Doringdraad en onkruid sal groei, en die plante van die veld sal jou kos wees.

original: With the hard work of your hands you will get your bread till you go back to the earth from which you were taken: for dust you are and to the dust you will go back.
translation: Met die harde werk van jou hande, sal jy jou brood kry totdat jy teruggaan na die aarde waarvan jy gemaak is: want jy is stof en na die stof sal jy weer teruggaan.

original: And the man gave his wife the name of Eve because she was the mother of all who have life.
translation: Die man het sy vrou Eva genoem omdat sy die moeder van almal is wat lewe het.

original: And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife coats of skins for their clothing.
translation: En die Here God het vir Adam en sy vrou klere van dierehuid gemaak om hulle aan te trek.

original: And the Lord God said, Now the man has become like one of us, having knowledge of good and evil; and now if he puts out his hand and takes of the fruit of the tree of life, he will go on living for ever.
translation: En die Here God het gesê, nou het die mens soos een van ons geword, met kennis van goed en kwaad; en nou, as hy sy hand uitsteek en die vrug van die boom van die lewe neem, sal hy vir altyd bly lewe.

original: So the Lord God sent him out of the garden of Eden to be a worker on the earth from which he was taken.
translation: Die Here God het hom uit die tuin van Eden gestuur om op die aarde te werk, waaruit hy gemaak is.

original: So he sent the man out; and at the east of the garden of Eden he put winged ones and a flaming sword turning every way to keep the way to the tree of life.
translation: So het hy die man weggestuur; en aan die ooskant van die tuin van Eden het hy geeste met vlerke en 'n vlamende swaard geplaas wat in elke rigting draai om die pad na die boom van die lewe te beskerm.

original: And the man had connection with Eve his wife, and she became with child and gave birth to Cain, and said, I have got a man from the Lord.
translation: Die man het sy vrou Eva ontmoet, en sy het swanger geword en vir Kain gebaar, en gesê, Ek het 'n man van die Here gekry.

original: Then again she became with child and gave birth to Abel, his brother. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a farmer.
translation: Toe raak sy weer swanger en het Abel, sy broer, gebore. Abel was 'n skaapwagter, maar Kain was 'n boer.

original: And after a time, Cain gave to the Lord an offering of the fruits of the earth.
translation: En na 'n tyd het Kain vir God 'n aanbod van die vrugte van die aarde gegee.

original: And Abel gave an offering of the young lambs of his flock and of their fat. And the Lord was pleased with Abel's offering;
translation: En Abel het 'n aanbod van die jonglammetjies van sy kudde en hulle vet gegee. En die Here was gelukkig met Abel se aanbod.

original: But in Cain and his offering he had no pleasure. And Cain was angry and his face became sad.
translation: Maar God het nie gehou van Kain en sy aanbieding nie. En Kain was kwaad en sy gesig het hartseer gelyk.

original: And the Lord said to Cain, Why are you angry? and why is your face sad?
translation: En God het vir Kain gesê, Waarom is jy kwaad? en waarom lyk jy so hartseer?

original: If you do well, will you not have honour? and if you do wrong, sin is waiting at the door, desiring to have you, but do not let it be your master.
translation: As jy goed doen, gaan jy nie eer kry nie? Maar as jy verkeerd doen, is sonde daar by die deur en wil jou hê. Moet nie toelaat dat dit jou baas is nie.

original: And Cain said to his brother, Let us go into the field: and when they were in the field, Cain made an attack on his brother Abel and put him to death.
translation: En Kain het vir sy broer gesê: "Kom ons gaan in die veld." En toe hulle in die veld was, het Kain sy broer Abel aangeval en hom doodgemaak.

original: And the Lord said to Cain, Where is your brother Abel? And he said, I have no idea: am I my brother's keeper?
translation: Die Here het vir Kain gesê, Waar is jou broer Abel? En hy het gesê, Ek weet nie: is ek my broer se oppasser?

original: And he said, What have you done? the voice of your brother's blood is crying to me from the earth.
translation: Hy het gesê: Wat het jy gedoen? Jou broer se bloed roep na my vanaf die grond.

original: And now you are cursed from the earth, whose mouth is open to take your brother's blood from your hand;
translation: En nou is jy vervloek van die aarde, waarvan die mond oop is om jou broer se bloed uit jou hand te neem;

original: No longer will the earth give you her fruit as the reward of your work; you will be a wanderer in flight over the earth.
translation: Die aarde sal nie meer vir jou haar vrugte as beloning vir jou werk gee nie; jy sal 'n rondloper op die aarde wees.

original: And Cain said, My punishment is greater than my strength.
translation: En Kain het gesê, my straf is groter as wat ek kan dra.

original: You have sent me out this day from the face of the earth and from before your face; I will be a wanderer in flight over the earth, and whoever sees me will put me to death.
translation: Jy het my vandag van die aarde en van jou gesig gestuur; ek sal 'n rondtrekkende mens op die aarde wees, en enige iemand wat my sien, sal my doodmaak.

original: And the Lord said, Truly, if Cain is put to death, seven lives will be taken for his. And the Lord put a mark on Cain so that no one might put him to death.
translation: En die Here het gesê, Dit is waar, as Kain doodgemaak word, sal sewe lewens vir hom geneem word. En die Here het 'n teken op Kain gesit sodat niemand hom doodmaak nie.

original: And Cain went away from before the face of the Lord, and made his living-place in the land of Nod on the east of Eden.
translation: En Kain het weggegaan van God se teenwoordigheid en het 'n plek om te woon gemaak in die land van Nod, oos van Eden.

original: And Cain had connection with his wife and she became with child and gave birth to Enoch: and he made a town, and gave the town the name of Enoch after his son.
translation: En Kain het 'n verhouding met sy vrou gehad en sy het swanger geword en 'n seun, Enoch, gehad. Hy het 'n stad gebou en die stad na sy seun, Enoch, genoem.

original: And Enoch had a son Irad: and Irad became the father of Mehujael: and Mehujael became the father of Methushael: and Methushael became the father of Lamech.
translation: Enoch het 'n seun gehad, Irad, en Irad het die vader van Mehujael geword. Mehujael het die vader van Methushael geword en Methushael het die vader van Lamech geword.

original: And Lamech had two wives; the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
translation: En Lamech het twee vroue gehad; die een se naam was Adah, en die ander se naam was Zillah.

original: And Adah gave birth to Jabal: he was the father of such as are living in tents and keep cattle.
translation: En Adah het Jabal gebaar: hy was die pa van die mense wat in tente woon en bees hou.

original: And his brother's name was Jubal: he was the father of all players on instruments of music.
translation: En sy broer se naam was Jubal: hy was die pa van almal wat musiek speel.

original: And Zillah gave birth to Tubal-cain, who is the father of every maker of cutting instruments of brass and iron: and the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.
translation: En Zillah het Tubal-kain gebaar, die vader van elke maker van gereedskap van brons en yster. Tubal-kain se suster was Naamah.

original: And Lamech said to his wives, Adah and Zillah, give ear to my voice; you wives of Lamech, give attention to my words, for I would put a man to death for a wound, and a young man for a blow;
translation: Toe het Lamech vir sy vroue, Adah en Zillah, gesê: "Luister na my; julle vroue van Lamech, let op wat ek sê, want ek sal 'n man doodmaak vir 'n wond, en 'n jong man vir 'n klap."

original: If seven lives are to be taken as punishment for Cain's death, seventy-seven will be taken for Lamech's.
translation: As sewe lewens as straf vir Kain se dood geneem gaan word, sal sewetig-en-sewe vir Lamech s'n geneem word.

original: And Adam had connection with his wife again, and she gave birth to a son to whom she gave the name of Seth: for she said, God has given me another seed in place of Abel, whom Cain put to death.
translation: En Adam het weer met sy vrou gekom, en sy het 'n seun gehad aan wie sy die naam Seth gegee het, omdat sy gesê het, God het vir my 'n ander seun gegee in plaas van Abel, wat Kain doodgemaak het.

original: And Seth had a son, and he gave him the name of Enosh: at this time men first made use of the name of the Lord in worship.
translation: En Seth het 'n seun gehad, en hy het hom Enosh genoem: in daardie tyd het mense vir die eerste keer die naam van God in aanbidding gebruik.

original: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day when God made man, he made him in the image of God;
translation: Dit is die boek van Adam se geslagte. In die dag toe God die mens geskep het, het Hy hom in God se beeld gemaak;

original: Male and female he made them, naming them Man, and giving them his blessing on the day when they were made.
translation: Hy het hulle man en vrou gemaak, hulle Man genoem, en hulle op die dag wat hulle geskep is, geseën.

original: Adam had been living for a hundred and thirty years when he had a son like himself, after his image, and gave him the name of Seth:
translation: Adam was honder dertig jaar oud toe hy 'n seun gehad het wat soos hy was, en hy het hom Seth genoem.

original: And after the birth of Seth, Adam went on living for eight hundred years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En nadat Seth gebore is, het Adam nog agthonderd jaar geleef en seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And all the years of Adam's life were nine hundred and thirty: and he came to his end.
translation: Adam het nege honderd en dertig jaar geleef en toe het hy gesterf.

original: And Seth was a hundred and five years old when he became the father of Enosh:
translation: En Seth was honderd vyf jaar oud toe hy die pa van Enosh geword het.

original: And he went on living after the birth of Enosh for eight hundred and seven years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En hy het nog agt honderd en sewe jaar geleef nadat Enosh gebore is, en hy het seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And all the years of Seth's life were nine hundred and twelve: and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Seth se lewe was nege honderd en twaalf: en hy het sy laaste dag gesien.

original: And Enosh was ninety years old when he became the father of Kenan:
translation: Enosh was negentig jaar oud toe hy die pa van Kenan geword het.

original: And after the birth of Kenan, Enosh went on living for eight hundred and fifteen years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En nadat Kenan gebore is, het Enosh nog agthonderd en vyftien jaar geleef en seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And all the years of Enosh were nine hundred and five: and he came to his end.
translation: Enosh se jare was negehonderd en vyf, en toe het hy gesterf.

original: And Kenan was seventy years old when he became the father of Mahalalel:
translation: En Kenan was sewentig jaar oud toe hy die pa van Mahalalel geword het.

original: And after the birth of Mahalalel, Kenan went on living for eight hundred and forty years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En na Mahalalel se geboorte het Kenan nog acht honderd veertig jaar geleef en het seuns en dogters gehad:

original: And all the years of Kenan's life were nine hundred and ten; and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Kenan se lewe was negehonderd en tien; en hy het sy einde gekom.

original: And Mahalalel was sixty-five years old when he became the father of Jared:
translation: en Mahalalel was vyf-en-sestig jaar oud toe hy die pa van Jared geword het:

original: And after the birth of Jared, Mahalalel went on living for eight hundred and thirty years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En nadat Jared gebore is, het Mahalalel nog agt honderd en dertig jaar geleef en seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And all the years of Mahalalel's life were eight hundred and ninety-five: and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Mahalalel se lewe was agthonderd vyf-en-negentig: en hy het sy lewe beëindig.

original: And Jared was a hundred and sixty-two years old when he became the father of Enoch:
translation: Jared was 162 jaar oud toe hy Enoch se pa geword het.

original: And Jared went on living after the birth of Enoch for eight hundred years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En Jared het nog agthonderd jaar geleef nadat Enoch gebore is, en hy het seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And all the years of Jared's life were nine hundred and sixty-two: and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Jared se lewe was negehonderd en twee-en-sestig: en hy het gesterf.

original: And Enoch was sixty-five years old when he became the father of Methuselah:
translation: Enoch was vyf-en-sestig jaar oud toe hy die pa van Metusalag geword het.

original: And after the birth of Methuselah, Enoch went on in God's ways for three hundred years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En nadat Metusalag gebore is, het Henog vir driehonderd jaar in God se paaie voortgegaan en seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And all the years of Enoch's life were three hundred and sixty-five:
translation: En al die jare van Enoch se lewe was driehonderd vyf en sestig.

original: And Enoch went on in God's ways: and he was not seen again, for God took him.
translation: En Enoch het aanhou om in God se pad te loop: en hy is nie weer gesien nie, want God het hom geneem.

original: And Methuselah was a hundred and eighty-seven years old when he became the father of Lamech:
translation: En Metusela was 187 jaar oud toe hy die pa van Lamech geword het.

original: And after the birth of Lamech, Methuselah went on living for seven hundred and eighty-two years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En nadat Lamech gebore is, het Metusala nog vir sewe honderd twee-en-agtig jaar geleef en seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And all the years of Methuselah's life were nine hundred and sixty-nine: and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Metusela se lewe was negentienhonderd nege en sestig: en hy het gesterwe.

original: And Lamech was a hundred and eighty-two years old when he had a son:
translation: En Lamech was honderdtwee jaar oud toe hy 'n seun gehad het.

original: And he gave him the name of Noah, saying, Truly, he will give us rest from our trouble and the hard work of our hands, because of the earth which was cursed by God.
translation: En hy het vir hom die naam Noag gegee en gesê: Regtig, hy sal vir ons rus bring van ons probleme en die harde werk van ons hande, omdat die aarde deur God vervloek is.

original: And after the birth of Noah, Lamech went on living for five hundred and ninety-five years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En na Noag se geboorte het Lamech nog vyfhonderd vyf-en-negentig jaar gelewe en seuns en dogters gehad:

original: And all the years of Lamech's life were seven hundred and seventy-seven: and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Lamech se lewe was sewe honderd en sewe-en-sewentig, en hy het sy einde bereik.

original: And when Noah was five hundred years old, he became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
translation: Toe Noag vyfhonderd jaar oud was, het hy die pa van Sem, Gam en Jafet geword.

original: And after a time, when men were increasing on the earth, and had daughters,
translation: En na 'n tyd, toe daar al hoe meer mense op die aarde was en hulle dogters gehad het,

original: The sons of God saw that the daughters of men were fair; and they took wives for themselves from those who were pleasing to them.
translation: Die seuns van God het gesien dat die dogters van mense mooi was; en hulle het vrouens vir hulleself gekoop uit die een wat vir hulle goed lyk.

original: And the Lord said, My spirit will not be in man for ever, for he is only flesh; so the days of his life will be a hundred and twenty years.
translation: Die Here het gesê: My gees sal nie vir altyd in mense wees nie, want hulle is net vlees; daarom sal hulle vir honderd en twintig jaar leef.

original: There were men of great strength and size on the earth in those days; and after that, when the sons of God had connection with the daughters of men, they gave birth to children: these were the great men of old days, the men of great name.
translation: Daar was mense van grootsterkte en grootte op die aarde in daardie dae; en daarna, toe die seuns van God met die dogters van mense in aanraking gekom het, het hulle kinders gehad: dit was die groot mense van ou dae, die mense met groot name.

original: And the Lord saw that the sin of man was great on the earth, and that all the thoughts of his heart were evil.
translation: En die Here het gesien dat die mens se sonde groot was op die aarde, en dat al sy gedagtes sleg was.

original: And the Lord had sorrow because he had made man on the earth, and grief was in his heart.
translation: En God was hartseer omdat Hy die mens op die aarde gemaak het, en daar was pyn in sy hart.

original: And the Lord said, I will take away man, whom I have made, from the face of the earth, even man and beast and that which goes on the earth and every bird of the air; for I have sorrow for having made them.
translation: En die Here het gesê, Ek sal die mens wat Ek gemaak het, van die aarde afneem, sowel as die diere en alles wat op die aarde beweeg en elke voël in die lug; want Ek is hartseer dat Ek hulle gemaak het.

original: But Noah had grace in the eyes of God.
translation: Maar Noag het genade in God se oë gehad.

original: These are the generations of Noah. Noah was an upright man and without sin in his generation: he went in the ways of God.
translation: Dit is die geslagte van Noag. Noag was 'n regte man en het nie gesondig in sy tyd nie. Hy het in God se paaie geleef.

original: And Noah had three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
translation: Noah het drie seuns gehad: Shem, Ham en Japheth.

original: And the earth was evil in God's eyes and full of violent ways.
translation: En die aarde was sleg in God se oë en vol geweld.

original: And God, looking on the earth, saw that it was evil: for the way of all flesh had become evil on the earth.
translation: En God het na die aarde gekyk en gesien dat dit sleg was, want die manier waarop mense lewe het sleg geword op die aarde.

original: And God said to Noah, The end of all flesh has come; the earth is full of their violent doings, and now I will put an end to them with the earth.
translation: En God het vir Noag gesê, die einde van almal se lewe het gekom; die aarde is vol van hulle gewelddadige dade, en nou gaan ek dit alles saam met die aarde stop.

original: Make for yourself an ark of gopher wood with rooms in it, and make it safe from the water inside and out.
translation: Bou vir jouself 'n ark van gopher-hout met kamers in, en maak dit veilig teen die water, binne en buite.

original: And this is the way you are to make it: it is to be three hundred cubits long, fifty cubits wide, and thirty cubits high.
translation: En so moet jy dit maak: dit moet driehonderd el lank wees, vyftig el breed, en dertig el hoog.

original: You are to put a window in the ark, a cubit from the roof, and a door in the side of it, and you are to make it with a lower and second and third floors.
translation: Jy moet 'n venster in die ark sit, 'n elle van die dak af, en 'n deur aan die kant daarvan, en jy moet dit met 'n onder-, tweede en derde verdieping maak.

original: For truly, I will send a great flow of waters over the earth, for the destruction from under the heaven of all flesh in which is the breath of life; everything on the earth will come to an end.
translation: Want ek sê, ek gaan 'n groot vloed water oor die aarde stuur om al die lewende dinge wat asemhaal te vernietig; alles op die aarde sal vergaan.

original: But with you I will make an agreement; and you will come into the ark, you and your sons and your wife and your sons' wives with you.
translation: Maar ek sal 'n ooreenkoms met jou maak; julle sal in die ark kom, jy en jou seuns, jou vrou en jou seuns se vroue saam met jou.

original: And you will take with you into the ark two of every sort of living thing, and keep them safe with you; they will be male and female.
translation: En julle sal twee van elke soort lewende ding saam met julle in die ark neem en hulle veilig hou; hulle sal manlike en vroulike wees.

original: Two of every sort of bird and cattle and of every sort of living thing which goes on the earth will you take with you to keep them from destruction.
translation: Neem twee van elke soort voël en bees, en van elke soort lewende ding wat op die aarde rondbeweeg, saam met jou om hulle te red van vernietiging.

original: And make a store of every sort of food for yourself and them.
translation: Maak 'n voorraad van al die verskillende kosse vir jouself en hulle.

original: And all these things Noah did; as God said, so he did.
translation: En al hierdie dinge het Noag gedoen; soos God gesê het, so het hy gemaak.

original: And the Lord said to Noah, Take all your family and go into the ark, for you only in this generation have I seen to be upright.
translation: En die Here het vir Noag gesê: Neem jou hele familie en gaan in die ark, want ek het net jou in hierdie geslag gesien as regverdig.

original: Of every clean beast you will take seven males and seven females, and of the beasts which are not clean, two, the male and his female;
translation: Van elke skoon dier moet jy sewe manne en sewe vroue neem, en van die onskone diere twee, die man en sy vrou.

original: And of the birds of the air, seven males and seven females, so that their seed may still be living on the face of the earth.
translation: En van die voëls in die lug, sewe manlike en sewe vroulike, sodat hulle saad steeds op die aarde kan leef.

original: For after seven days I will send rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights, for the destruction of every living thing which I have made on the face of the earth.
translation: Na sewe dae sal ek reën oor die aarde stuur vir veertig dae en veertig nagte, om elke lewende ding wat ek gemaak het op die aarde te vernietig.

original: And Noah did everything which the Lord said he was to do.
translation: En Noag het alles gedoen wat die Here vir hom gesê het om te doen.

original: And Noah was six hundred years old when the waters came flowing over all the earth.
translation: En Noag was seshonderd jaar oud toe die waters oor die hele aarde begin stroom het.

original: And Noah, with his sons and his wife and his sons' wives, went into the ark because of the flowing of the waters.
translation: Noag, saam met sy seuns, sy vrou en sy seuns se vroue, het in die ark gegaan omdat die waters vloei.

original: Of clean beasts, and of beasts which are not clean, and of birds, and of everything which goes on the earth,
translation: Van skoon diere, van onrein diere, van voëls, en van alles wat op die aarde rondbeweeg.

original: In twos, male and female, they went into the ark with Noah, as God had said.
translation: In paar, man en vrou, het hulle in die ark saam met Noag gegaan, soos God gesê het.

original: And after the seven days, the waters came over all the earth.
translation: En na sewe dae het die waters oor die hele aarde gekom.

original: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, all the fountains of the great deep came bursting through, and the windows of heaven were open;
translation: In die seshonderdste jaar van Noag se lewe, in die tweede maand, op die sewentiende dag van die maand, het al die fonteine van die groot diep gebars en die vensters van die hemel was oop.

original: And rain came down on the earth for forty days and forty nights.
translation: En reën het vir veertig dae en veertig nagte op die aarde geval.

original: On the same day Noah, with Shem, Ham, and Japheth, his sons, and his wife and his sons' wives, went into the ark;
translation: Op dieselfde dag het Noag, saam met sy seuns Sem, Ham en Jafet, sy vrou en sy seuns se vroue, in die ark gegaan;

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy aanbieding was 'n silwer skottel wat honderdtwintig shekels geweeg het, en 'n silwer basin wat sewentig shekels geweeg het, volgens die maatstaf van die heilige plek; albei was vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n graanaanbieding.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien shekels, vol speserye;

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, een ram, een lam van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok as 'n sondeoffer.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai.
translation: En vir die vrede-offers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke en vyf lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Shelumiel, die seun van Zurishaddai.

original: On the sixth day Eliasaph, the son of Reuel, chief of the children of Gad:
translation: Op die sesde dag het Eliasaph, die seun van Reuel, die hoof van die kinders van Gad, gesê:

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy aanbieding was een silwer skottel, eenhonderd en dertig shekels gewig, een silwer bak van sewentig shekels, volgens die maat van die heilige plek; hulle was albei vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n aanbiedingsmaal.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien shekels, vol speserye;

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, een volwasse ram, een ram van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok as 'n sondeoffer.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Eliasaph, the son of Reuel
translation: En vir die vrede-offers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Eliasaph, die seun van Reuel.

original: On the seventh day Elishama, the son of Ammihud, chief of the children of Ephraim:
translation: Op die sewende dag het Elishama, die seun van Ammihud, die hoof van die Efraimietes:

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy offer was een silwer plaat wat honderd en dertig sekels geweeg het, en 'n silwer kom van sewentig sekels, volgens die skaal van die Heilige plek; hulle was albei vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n ete aanbied.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien skekels, vol speserye.

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, 'n manlike skaap, 'n ram van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok vir 'n sondoffer;

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Elishama, the son of Ammihud.
translation: En vir die vrede-offers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammers wat nog nie een jaar oud was nie: dit was die aanbod van Elishama, die seun van Ammihud.

original: On the eighth day Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur, chief of the children of Manasseh:
translation: Op die agtste dag het Gamaliel, die seun van Pedahzur, die hoof van die Manassiete, gesê:

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy offer was 'n silwer bord wat honderddertig shekels geweeg het, en 'n silwer bak wat sewentig shekels geweeg het, volgens die maat van die heilige plek; die twee was vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n voedseloffer.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien sikkels, vol speserye;

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, een ram, 'n ram van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok vir 'n sonde-offering;

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur.
translation: En vir die vrede-offers was daar twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf manlike lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Gamaliel, die seun van Pedahzur.

original: On the ninth day Abidan, the son of Gideoni, chief of the children of Benjamin:
translation: Op die negende dag het Abidan, die seun van Gideoni, die leier van die Benjamin kinders:

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy aanbieding was 'n silwer plaat wat honderd en dertig shekels geweeg het, en 'n silwer bakkie van sewentig shekels volgens die maatstaf van die heilige plek; albei was vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n graan aanbieding.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien sekels, vol speserye;

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, een ram, een speenlam van die eerste jaar vir 'n brandoffer.

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok as 'n sonde offer;

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Abidan, the son of Gideoni.
translation: En vir die vrede-offergawes, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Abidan, die seun van Gideoni.

original: On the tenth day Ahiezer; the son of Ammishaddai, chief of the children of Dan:
translation: Op die tiende dag het Ahiezer, die seun van Ammishaddai, die hoof van die Dan-stam, begin.

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy aanbod was 'n silwer skinkbord wat honderd en dertig sikkels gewig was, 'n silwer bak van sewentig sikkels, volgens die skaal van die heilige plek; die twee was vol van die lekkerste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n graanoffer.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien shekel, vol speserye;

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, 'n manlike skaap, 'n manlike lammertjie van die eerste jaar, vir 'n vuuroffer;

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok vir 'n sonde-offer;

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Ahiezer, the son of Ammishaddai.
translation: En vir die vrede-offers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Ahiezer, die seun van Ammishaddai.

original: On the eleventh day Pagiel, the son of Ochran, chief of the children of Asher:
translation: Op die elfde dag het Pagiel, die seun van Ochran, die hoof van die kinders van Aser:

original: His offering was one silver plate; a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy offer was 'n silwer skottel van honderddertig sikels, en 'n silwer bak van sewentig sikels, volgens die maat van die heilige plek; albei was vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n graanoffer.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien sikkels, vol speserye;

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, 'n ram, 'n lammetjie van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: 'n Manlike bok vir 'n sonde-offering;

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Pagiel, the son of Ochran.
translation: En vir die vrede-offers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammetjies wat een jaar oud is: dit was die offer van Pagiel, die seun van Ochran.

original: On the twelfth day Ahira, the son of Enan, chief of the children of Naphtali:
translation: Op die twaalfde dag het Ahira, Enan se seun, die hoof van die Naphtali-kinders, gebring:

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy offer was 'n silwer skottel wat honderd en dertig shekels weeg, 'n silwer bak van sewentig shekels, volgens die maat van die heilige plek; hulle was albei vol met die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n graanoffer.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien sikels, vol speserye;

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, een ram, een manlike lam van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok as 'n sonde-offer.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Ahira, the son of Enan.
translation: En vir die vredesoffers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Ahira, die seun van Enan.

original: These were the offerings given for the altar by the chiefs of Israel, when the holy oil was put on it: twelve silver plates, twelve silver basins, twelve gold spoons;
translation: Dit was die aanbiedinge wat die leiers van Israel vir die altaar gegee het, toe die heilige olie daarop gesit is: twaalf silwerplate, twaalf silwerbakke, twaalf goue lepels;

original: The weight of every silver plate was a hundred and thirty shekels, and of every basin seventy; the weight of all the silver of the vessels was two thousand and four hundred shekels, by the scale of the holy place;
translation: Die gewig van elke silwer plaat was dertienhonderd shekels en van elke bak sewentig; die gewig van al die silwer van die houers was twee duisend en vierhonderd shekels, volgens die skaal van die heilige plek.

original: The weight of the twelve gold spoons of spice for burning was ten shekels for every one, by the scale of the holy place; all the gold of the spoons was a hundred and twenty shekels;
translation: Die gewig van die twaalf goue lepels speserye om te brand was tien shekels elkeen, volgens die skaal van die heilige plek; al die goud van die lepels was honderd en twintig shekels.

original: All the oxen, for the burned offering were twelve, the male sheep twelve, the he-lambs of the first year twelve, with their meal offering; and the males of the goats for sin-offering twelve;
translation: Al die osse vir die brandoffer was twaalf, die ramme twaalf, die manlike lammetjies van die eerste jaar twaalf, saam met hul graanoffer; en die manlike bokke vir die sondeoffer was ook twaalf.

original: And all the oxen for the peace-offerings, twenty-four oxen, the male sheep sixty, and the he-goats sixty, the he-lambs of the first year sixty. This was given for the altar after the holy oil was put on it.
translation: En al die osse vir die vredesoffers, vier-en-twintig osse, sestig manlike skape, sestig bokke en sestig rammetjies van die eerste jaar. Dit is gegee vir die altaar nadat die heilige olie daarop gesit is.

original: And when Moses went into the Tent of meeting to have talk with him, then the Voice came to his ears from over the cover which was on the ark of witness, from between the two winged ones. And he had talk with him.
translation: En toe Moses in die Tent van ontmoeting gaan om met Hom te praat, het die Stem in sy ore geklink van oor die bedekking van die ark van getuienis, van tussen die twee gevleuelde skepsele. Hy het met Hom gepraat.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê,

original: Say to Aaron, When you put the lights in their places, the seven lights will give light in front of the support.
translation: Sê vir Aaron, wanneer jy die ligte op hul plekke sit, sal die sewe ligte helder skyn voor die steun.

original: And Aaron did so; he put the lights in their places so that they gave light in front of the support, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.
translation: En Aäron het dit so gedoen; hy het die ligte op hulle plekke gesit sodat hulle lig gegee het voor die steun, soos die Here aan Moses gesê het.

original: The support for the lights was of hammered gold work, from its base to its flowers it was of hammered work; from the design which the Lord had given to Moses, he made the support for the lights.
translation: Die steun vir die ligte was van gesmeed goud, van die onderkant tot by die blomme was dit van gesmeed werk; volgens die ontwerp wat God aan Moses gegee het, het hy die steun vir die ligte gemaak.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê,

original: Take the Levites out from among the children of Israel and make them clean.
translation: Haal die Leviete uit die Israeliete en maak hulle skoon.

original: And this is how you are to make them clean: let the holy water which takes away sin be put on them, and let the hair all over their bodies be cut off with a sharp blade, and let their clothing be washed and their bodies made clean.
translation: En so maak jy hulle skoon: laat die heilige water wat sonde wegneem, op hulle gesit word, sny al die hare oor hul liggame met 'n skerp mes af, was hulle klere en maak hulle liggame skoon.

original: Then let them take a young ox and its meal offering, crushed grain mixed with oil, and take another ox for a sin-offering.
translation: Laat hulle dan 'n jong os en sy maaltyd aanbieding neem, wat gemaalde graan gemeng met olie is, en neem nog 'n os vir 'n sonde-offer.

original: And make the Levites come forward in front of the Tent of meeting, and let all the children of Israel come together:
translation: Laat die Leviete vorentoe kom voor die Tent waar ons God ontmoet, en laat al die kinders van Israel bymekaar kom.

original: And you are to take the Levites before the Lord: and the children of Israel are to put their hands on them:
translation: En julle moet die Leviete voor God bring, en die kinders van Israel moet hulle hande op hulle lê.

original: And Aaron is to give the Levites to the Lord as a wave offering from the children of Israel, so that they may do the Lord's work.
translation: En Aäron moet die Leviete aan die Here gee as 'n golfoffer van die kinders van Israel, sodat hulle die Here se werk kan doen.

original: And the Levites are to put their hands on the heads of the oxen, and one of the oxen is to be offered for a sin-offering and the other for a burned offering to the Lord to take away the sin of the Levites.
translation: En die Lewiete moet hulle hande op die koppe van die bulle sit, en een van die bulle moet geoffer word as 'n sondeoffer, en die ander as 'n brandoffer vir God om die sonde van die Lewiete weg te neem.

original: Then the Levites are to be put before Aaron and his sons, to be offered as a wave offering to the Lord.
translation: Die Leviete moet voor Aaron en sy seuns gestel word om as 'n golfoffer aan die Here aangebied te word.

original: So you are to make the Levites separate from the children of Israel, and the Levites will be mine.
translation: Julle moet die Leviete van die ander Israeliete afsonder, en die Leviete sal vir My wees.

original: After that, the Levites will go in to do whatever has to be done in the Tent of meeting; you are to make them clean and give them as a wave offering.
translation: Daarna sal die Leviete inkom om al die werk in die Tent van ontmoeting te doen; julle moet hulle skoonmaak en as 'n skudoffer aanbied.

original: For they have been given to me from among the children of Israel; in place of every mother's first son, the first to come to birth in Israel, I have taken them for myself.
translation: Hulle is vir my gegee uit die kinders van Israel; in die plek van elke ma se eerste seun, die eerste wat in Israel gebore is, het ek hulle vir myself geneem.

original: For every mother's first son among the children of Israel is mine, the first male birth of man or beast: on the day when I sent death on all the first sons in the land of Egypt, I made them mine.
translation: Elkeen se eerste seun onder die kinders van Israel behoort aan My, die eerste seun wat gebore is, of dit nou 'n mens of 'n dier is: op die dag toe ek dood oor al die eerste seuns in die land Egipte gestuur het, het ek hulle vir My geneem.

original: And in place of the first sons among the children of Israel, I have taken the Levites.
translation: En in plaas van die eerstesone van die kinders van Israel, het ek die Leviete gekies.

original: And I have given them to Aaron and to his sons, from among the children of Israel, to undertake for them all the work of the Tent of meeting, and to take away sin from the children of Israel so that no evil may come on them when they come near the holy place.
translation: Ek het hulle aan Aaron en sy seuns gegee uit die kinders van Israel, om al die werk van die ontmoetings tent vir hulle te doen en om sonde van die kinders van Israel weg te neem, sodat daar geen kwaad op hulle kan kom wanneer hulle na die heilige plek kom.

original: All these things Moses and Aaron and the children of Israel did to the Levites; as the Lord gave orders to Moses about the Levites, so the children of Israel did.
translation: Al hierdie dinge het Moses en Aäron en die kinders van Israel aan die Leviete gedoen; soos God aan Moses gesê het oor die Leviete, so het die kinders van Israel dit ook gedoen.

original: And the Levites were made clean from sin, and their clothing was washed, and Aaron gave them for a wave offering before the Lord; and Aaron took away their sin and made them clean.
translation: Die Leviete is van sonde skoongemaak, hulle klere is gewas, en Aaron het hulle as 'n aanbodgolwe voor die Here gegee; en Aaron het hulle sonde weggeneem en hulle skoon gemaak.

original: And then the Levites went in to do their work in the Tent of meeting before Aaron and his sons: all the orders which the Lord had given Moses about the Levites were put into effect.
translation: Toe het die Leviete ingegaan om hul werk in die ontmoetings tent voor Aaron en sy seuns te doen: al die opdragte wat die Here aan Moses gegee het oor die Leviete, is uitgevoer.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê,

original: This is the rule for the Levites: those of twenty-five years old and over are to go in and do the work of the Tent of meeting;
translation: Dit is die reël vir die Leviete: diegene wat vyf-en-twintig jaar en ouer is, moet binne gaan en die werk van die ontmoetingsplek doen;

original: But after they are fifty years old, they are to give up their work and do no more;
translation: Maar nadat hulle vyftig jaar oud is, moet hulle hul werk laat staan en nie meer werk nie.

original: But be with their brothers in the Tent of meeting, taking care of it but doing no work. This is what you are to do in connection with the Levites and their work.
translation: Wees saam met hul broers in die Tent van ontmoeting, sorg vir dit, maar doen geen werk nie. Dit is wat julle moet doen in verband met die Leviete en wat hulle doen.

original: And the Lord said to Moses, in the waste land of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt,
translation: Toe het die Here vir Moses gesê, in die woestyn van Sinai, in die eerste maand van die tweede jaar nadat hulle uit Egipte gekom het.

original: Let the children of Israel keep the Passover at its regular time.
translation: Laat die kinders van Israel die Paasfees op die tyd hou soos gewoonlik.

original: In the fourteenth day of this month, at evening, you are to keep it at the regular time, and in the way ordered in the law.
translation: Op die veertiende dag van hierdie maand, in die aand, moet julle dit op die gewone tyd hou, op die manier wat die wet sê.

original: And Moses gave orders to the children of Israel to keep the Passover.
translation: Moses het vir die kinders van Israel gesê hulle moet die Pasga hou.

original: So they kept the Passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at evening, in the waste land of Sinai: as the Lord gave orders to Moses, so the children of Israel did.
translation: Hulle het die Paasfees gevier in die eerste maand, op die veertiende dag van die maand, in die aand, in die woestyn van Sinai: soos wat die Here Moses gesê het, het die Israeliete dit gedoen.

original: And there were certain men who were unclean because of a dead body, so that they were not able to keep the Passover on that day; and they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day:
translation: Daar was sekere mense wat nie skoon was nie omdat hulle 'n dood liggaam aangeraak het, en hulle kon nie die Pasga op daardie dag hou nie; en hulle het daardie dag voor Moses en Aaron gekom.

original: And these men said to him, We have been made unclean by the dead body of a man; why may we not make the offering of the Lord at the regular time among the children of Israel?
translation: En hierdie mans het vir hom gesê, Ons is nie skoon nie omdat ons 'n dooie liggaam aangeraak het; hoekom kan ons nie die offering aan die Here op die gewone tyd by die Israeliete bring nie?

original: And Moses said to them, Do nothing till the Lord gives me directions about you.
translation: En Mooses het vir hulle gesê: Moet niks doen totdat die Here vir my sê wat om te doen met julle.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê,

original: Say to the children of Israel, If any one of you or of your families is unclean because of a dead body, or is on a journey far away, still he is to keep the Passover to the Lord:
translation: Sê vir die kinders van Israel, as een van julle of julle gesinne onrein is weens 'n dooie liggaam, of as julle op 'n lang reis is, moet hy steeds die Pasga vir die Here hou.

original: In the second month, on the fourteenth day, in the evening, they are to keep it, taking it with unleavened bread and bitter-tasting plants;
translation: In die tweede maand, op die veertiende dag, in die aand, moet hulle dit hou, saam met ongesuurde brood en plante wat bitter smaak.

original: Nothing of it is to be kept till the morning, and no bone of it is to be broken: they are to keep it by the rules of the Passover.
translation: Niks daarvan mag tot môre gehou word nie, en geen been mag gebroke word nie: hulle moet dit volgens die reëls van die Paasfees hou.

original: But the man who, not being unclean or on a journey, does not keep the Passover, will be cut off from his people: because he did not make the offering of the Lord at the regular time, his sin will be on him.
translation: Maar die man wat nie onrein is of op 'n reis is nie, en nie die Paasfees hou nie, sal van sy mense afgesny word: omdat hy nie die offer aan die Here op die regte tyd gemaak het nie, sal sy sonde op hom wees.

original: And if a man from another country is among you and has a desire to keep the Passover to the Lord, let him do as is ordered in the law of the Passover: there is to be the same rule for the man from another nation and for him who had his birth in the land.
translation: As 'n man van 'n ander land by julle is en hy wil die Pasga vir God hou, laat hom dan doen soos dit in die Pasga wet gesê word: daar moet dieselfde reël wees vir die man van 'n ander nasie as vir hom wat in die land gebore is.

original: And on the day when the House was put up, the cloud came down on it, on the Tent of witness; and in the evening there was a light like fire over the House till the morning.
translation: En op die dag toe die huis opgerig is, het die wolk daaroor neergedaal, op die tent van getuienis; en in die aand was daar 'n lig soos vuur oor die huis tot die oggend.

original: And so it was at all times: it was covered by the cloud, and by a light as of fire by night.
translation: En so was dit altyd: dit was bedek met die wolk, en met 'n lig soos vuur in die nag.

original: And whenever the cloud was taken up from over the House, then the children of Israel went journeying on; and in the place where the cloud came to rest, there the children of Israel put up their tents.
translation: En wanneer die wolk van bo die huis opgetel is, het die Israeliete verder gereis; en op die plek waar die wolk gaan stilhou het, het die Israeliete hulle tente opgeslaan.

original: At the order of the Lord the children of Israel went forward, and at the order of the Lord they put up their tents: as long as the cloud was resting on the House, they did not go away from that place.
translation: Op die opdrag van die Here het die kinders van Israel vorentoe gegaan, en op die opdrag van die Here het hulle hul tente opgeslaan. So lank as wat die wolk oor die Huis gebly het, het hulle nie van daardie plek weggegaan nie.

original: When the cloud was resting on the House for a long time the children of Israel, waiting for the order of the Lord, did not go on.
translation: Toe die wolk vir 'n lang tyd op die Huis gebly het, het die kinders van Israel, wat gewag het op die opdrag van die Here, nie verder gegaan nie.

original: Sometimes the cloud was resting on the House for two or three days; then, by the order of the Lord, they kept their tents in that place, and when the Lord gave the order they went on.
translation: Soms het die wolk vir twee of drie dae oor die Huis gebly; toe, op die opdrag van die Here, het hulle hulle tente daar gehou, en wanneer die Here die opdrag gegee het, het hulle verder gegaan.

original: And sometimes the cloud was there only from evening to morning; and when the cloud was taken up in the morning they went on their journey again: or if it was resting there by day and by night, whenever the cloud was taken up they went forward.
translation: En soms was die wolk net daar van aand tot oggend; en wanneer die wolk in die oggend opgetel is, het hulle weer op pad gegaan: of as dit dag en nag daar gebly het, het hulle elke keer wanneer die wolk opgetel is, vorentoe gegaan.

original: Or if the cloud came to rest on the House for two days or a month or a year without moving, the children of Israel went on waiting there and did not go on; but whenever it was taken up they went forward on their journey.
translation: As die wolk vir twee dae of 'n maand of 'n jaar by die Huis stilstaan sonder om te beweeg, het die kinders van Israel daar gewag en nie verder gegaan nie; maar wanneer dit wegbeweeg, het hulle voortgegaan met hulle reis.

original: At the word of the Lord they put up their tents, and at the word of the Lord they went forward on their journey: they kept the orders of the Lord as he gave them by Moses.
translation: Volgens God se woord het hulle hul tente opgeslaan, en volgens God se woord het hulle vorentoe gegaan op hul reis. Hulle het God se opdragte gehou soos Hy dit aan Moses gegee het.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het aan Moses gesê,

original: Make two silver horns of hammered work, to be used for getting the people together and to give the sign for the moving of the tents.
translation: Maak twee silwer horings van gesmede werk, om die mense bymekaar te kry en om die teken te gee wanneer die tente verskuif.

original: When they are sounded, all the people are to come together to you at the door of the Tent of meeting.
translation: Wanneer hulle gebel word, moet al die mense by die deur van die tent van ontmoeting saamkom.

original: If only one of them is sounded, then the chiefs, the heads of the thousands of Israel, are to come to you.
translation: As een van hulle geklink word, moet die leiers, die hoofde van die duisende van Israel, na jou toe kom.

original: When a loud note is sounded, the tents placed on the east side are to go forward.
translation: Wanneer 'n harde klank gehoor word, moet die tente aan die ooskant voortgaan.

original: At the sound of a second loud note, the tents on the south side are to go forward: the loud note will be the sign to go forward.
translation: Wanneer die tweede harde geluid klink, moet die tent aan die suidkant vorentoe beweeg: die harde geluid sal die teken wees om vorentoe te gaan.

original: But when all the people are to come together, the horn is to be sounded but not loudly.
translation: Maar wanneer al die mense bymekaar kom, moet die horing geblaas word, maar nie te hard nie.

original: The horns are to be sounded by the sons of Aaron, the priests; this is to be a law for you for ever, from generation to generation.
translation: Die horings moet deur die seuns van Aäron, die priesters, geblaas word; dit moet vir julle altyd 'n reël wees, van een geslag na die volgende.

original: And if you go to war in your land against any who do you wrong, then let the loud note of the horn be sounded; and the Lord your God will keep you in mind and give you salvation from those who are against you.
translation: As jy oorlog voer in jou land teen iemand wat jou kwaad doen, laat dan die groot horing blaas; en die Here jou God sal aan jou dink en jou red van dié wat teen jou is.

original: And on days of joy and on your regular feasts and on the first day of every month, let the horns be sounded over your burned offerings and your peace-offerings; and they will put the Lord in mind of you: I am the Lord your God.
translation: En op tye van vreugde, op julle gewone feeste en op die eerste dag van elke maand, moet julle die horings blaas oor julle brandoffers en vreedsames; en dit sal die Here aan julle herinner: Ek is die Here julle God.

original: Now in the second year, on the twentieth day of the second month, the cloud was taken up from over the Tent of witness.
translation: Nou, in die tweede jaar, op die twintigste dag van die tweede maand, is die wolk van die Tent van getuienis afgeneem.

original: And the children of Israel went on their journey out of the waste land of Sinai; and the cloud came to rest in the waste land of Paran.
translation: Die kinders van Israel het hul reis voortgegaan uit die woestyn van Sinai; en die wolk het gaan rus in die woestyn van Paran.

original: They went forward for the first time on their journey as the Lord had given orders by the hand of Moses.
translation: Hulle het vir die eerste keer op hul reis gegaan soos wat God aan Moses gesê het om te doen.

original: First the flag of the children of Judah went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Nahshon, the son of Amminadab.
translation: Eerst het die vlag van die kinders van Juda vorentoe gegaan met hulle leërs, en aan die hoof van sy leër was Nahshon, die seun van Amminadab.

original: And at the head of the army of the children of Issachar was Nethanel, the son of Zuar.
translation: En die hoof van die leër van die kinders van Issachar was Nethanel, die seun van Zuar.

original: And at the head of the army of the children of Zebulun was Eliab, the son of Helon.
translation: En aan die hoof van die leër van die kinders van Sebulon was Eliab, die seun van Helon.

original: Then the House was taken down; and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, who were responsible for moving the House, went forward.
translation: Toe is die Huis afgebreek; en die seuns van Gershon en die seuns van Merari, wat verantwoordelik was om die Huis te beweeg, het vorentoe gegaan.

original: Then the flag of the children of Reuben went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Elizur, the son of Shedeur.
translation: Toe het die vlag van die kinders van Ruben vorentoe gegaan met hulle leër: en aan die voorpunt van sy leër was Elizur, die seun van Shedeur.

original: And at the head of the army of the children of Simeon was Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai.
translation: En by die voorhoede van die kinders van Simeon was Shelumiel, die seun van Zurishaddai.

original: At the head of the army of the children of Gad was Eliasaph, the son of Reuel.
translation: Die leër van die kinders van Gad is gelei deur Eliasaph, die seun van Reuel.

original: Then the Kohathites went forward with the holy place; the others put up the House ready for their coming.
translation: Toe het die Kohathiete vorentoe gegaan met die heilige plek; die ander het die huis reg gemaak vir hulle aankoms.

original: Then the flag of the children of Ephraim went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Elishama, the son of Ammihud.
translation: Dan het die vlag van Efraim vorentoe gegaan met hulle leërs, en aan die voorpunt van sy leër was Elishama, die seun van Ammihud.

original: At the head of the army of the children of Manasseh was Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur.
translation: Aan die voorpunt van die leër van die kinders van Manasse was Gamaliel, die seun van Pedahzur.

original: At the head of the army of the children of Benjamin was Abidan, the son of Gideoni.
translation: Aan die hoof van die leër van die kinders van Benjamin was Abidan, die seun van Gideoni.

original: And the flag of the children of Dan, whose tents were moved last of all, went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Ahiezer, the son of Ammishaddai.
