translation: En die vlag van die kinders van Dan, waarvan die tente laaste verskuif is, het vorentoe gegaan met hul leërs: en aan die hoof van sy leër was Ahiezer, die seun van Ammishaddai.

original: At the head of the army of the children of Asher was Pagiel, the son of Ochran.
translation: Pagiel, die seun van Ochran, was die hoof van die leër van die kinders van Aser.

original: And at the head of the army of the children of Naphtali was Ahira, the son of Enan.
translation: En die leier van die groep van die kinders van Naftali was Ahira, die seun van Enan.

original: This was the order in which the children of Israel were journeying by armies; so they went forward.
translation: Dit was die manier hoe die kinders van Israel in groepe gereis het; so het hulle aangestap.

original: Then Moses said to Hobab, the son of his father-in-law Reuel the Midianite, We are journeying to that place of which the Lord has said, I will give it to you: so come with us, and it will be for your profit: for the Lord has good things in store for Israel.
translation: Toe sê Moses vir Hobab, die seun van sy skoonpa Reuel die Midianiet, "Ons is op pad na die plek waarvan die Here gesê het, Ek sal dit aan julle gee. Kom saam met ons, dit sal vir jou goed wees, want die Here het goeie dinge in store vir Israel."

original: But he said, I will not go with you, I will go back to the land of my birth and to my relations.
translation: Maar hy het gesê, ek gaan nie saam met julle nie, ek gaan terug na die plek waar ek gebore is en na my familie.

original: And he said, Do not go from us; for you will be eyes for us, guiding us to the right places in the waste land to put up our tents.
translation: En hy het gesê, Moet nie van ons weggaan nie; want jy sal vir ons help om die regte plekke in die woestyn te vind om ons tente op te slaan.

original: And if you come with us, we will give you a part in whatever good the Lord does for us.
translation: As jy saam met ons kom, sal ons jou 'n deel gee in alles wat goed is wat die Here vir ons doen.

original: So they went forward three days' journey from the mountain of the Lord; and the ark of the Lord's agreement went three days' journey before them, looking for a resting-place for them;
translation: So hulle het drie dae se reis van God se berg af gevorder; en God se verbond se ark het drie dae se reis voor hulle gegaan, op soek na 'n plek om te rus.

original: And by day the cloud of the Lord went over them, when they went forward from the place where they had put up their tents.
translation: En gedurende die dag het God se wolk oor hulle beweeg toe hulle vorentoe gegaan het vanwaar hulle hulle tente opgeslaan het.

original: And when the ark went forward Moses said, Come up, O Lord, and let the armies of those who are against you be broken, and let your haters go in flight before you.
translation: Toe die ark vorentoe beweeg, het Moses gesê: Kom op, O Here, en laat die leërs van diegene wat teen U is, gebroke word, en laat U vyande voor U vlug.

original: And when it came to rest, he said, Take rest, O Lord, and give a blessing to the families of Israel.
translation: Toe dit stil geword het, het hy gesê, Neem 'n breek, O Here, en gee 'n seën aan die families van Israel.

original: Now the people were saying evil against the Lord; and the Lord, hearing it, was angry and sent fire on them, burning the outer parts of the tent-circle.
translation: Die mense het slegte dinge oor die Here gesê; en die Here het dit gehoor en was kwaad, en het vuur na hulle gestuur wat die buitekant van die tent verbrand het.

original: And the people made an outcry to Moses, and Moses made prayer to the Lord, and the fire was stopped.
translation: En die mense het uitgeroep na Moses, en Moses het gebid tot die Here, en die vuur het gestop.

original: So that place was named Taberah, because of the fire of the Lord which had been burning among them.
translation: Die plek is Taberah genoem omdat God se vuur onder hulle gebrand het.

original: And the mixed band of people who went with them were overcome by desire: and the children of Israel, weeping again, said, Who will give us flesh for our food?
translation: Die gemengde groep mense wat saam met hulle gegaan het, was oorweldig deur begeerte, en die Israeliete, wat weer huil, sê: "Wie gaan vir ons vleis gee om te eet?"

original: Sweet is the memory of the fish we had in Egypt for nothing, and the fruit and green plants of every sort, sharp and pleasing to the taste:
translation: Die herinnering aan die vis wat ons in Egipte gehad het, is lekker, en die vrugte en groen plante van elke soort, lekker en smaaklik.

original: But now our soul is wasted away; there is nothing at all: we have nothing but this manna before our eyes.
translation: Maar nou is ons siel uitgeput; daar is glad niks nie: ons het net hierdie manna voor ons oë.

original: Now the manna was like a seed of grain, like small clear drops.
translation: Die manna was soos 'n graankorrel, soos klein deurspoekte druppels.

original: The people went about taking it up from the earth, crushing it between stones or hammering it to powder, and boiling it in pots, and they made cakes of it: its taste was like the taste of cakes cooked with oil.
translation: Die mense het dit van die grond af opgetel, dit tussen klippe verpletter of dit tot poeier geklop, en dit in potte gekook. Hulle het koekies daarvan gemaak: dit het geproe soos koekies wat in olie gaar gemaak is.

original: When the dew came down on the tents at night, the manna came down with it.
translation: Wanneer die dou in die nag op die tente geval het, het die manna saam met dit geval.

original: And at the sound of the people weeping, every man at his tent-door, the wrath of the Lord was great, and Moses was very angry.
translation: Toe die mense huil, het elke man by sy tent staan, God se woede was groot, en Moses was baie kwaad.

original: And Moses said to the Lord, Why have you done me this evil? and why have I not grace in your eyes, that you have put on me the care of all this people?
translation: Toe sê Moses vir die Here, Waarom het U my hierdie slegte ding aangedoen? En waarom het ek nie genade in U oë nie, dat U my die sorg van al hierdie mense gegee het?

original: Am I the father of all this people? have I given them birth, that you say to me, Take them in your arms, like a child at the breast, to the land which you gave by an oath to their fathers?
translation: Is ek die pa van al hierdie mense? Het ek hulle gebaar? Waarom sê jy vir my, Neem hulle in jou arms soos 'n kind? Na die land wat jy met 'n belofte aan hulle vaders gegee het?

original: Where am I to get flesh to give to all this people? For they are weeping to me and saying, Give us flesh for our food.
translation: Waar moet ek vleis kry om aan al hierdie mense te gee? Hulle huil vir my en sê, Gee vir ons vleis om te eet.

original: I am not able by myself to take the weight of all this people, for it is more than my strength.
translation: Ek kan nie alleen die laste van al hierdie mense dra nie, want dit is te veel vir my om te hanteer.

original: If this is to be my fate, put me to death now in answer to my prayer, if I have grace in your eyes; and let me not see my shame.
translation: As dit my lot is, laat my dan nou sterf as dit is wat jy wil, want ek het genade in jou oë; en laat my nie my skande sien nie.

original: And the Lord said to Moses, Send for seventy of the responsible men of Israel, who are in your opinion men of weight and authority over the people; make them come to the Tent of meeting and be there with you.
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê: "Stuur vir sewentig van die verantwoordelike manne van Israel, wat volgens jou belangrike en invloedryke mense oor die volk is; laat hulle na die ontmoetingsplek kom en daar by jou wees."

original: And I will come down and have talk with you there: and I will take some of the spirit which is on you and put it on them, and they will take part of the weight of the people off you, so that you do not have to take it by yourself.
translation: Ek sal afkom en daar met jou praat: ek sal 'n deel van die Gees wat op jou is neem en dit op hulle plaas, sodat hulle jou kan help om die gewig van die mense van jou af te neem, sodat jy dit nie alleen hoef te dra nie.

original: And say to the people, Make yourselves clean before tomorrow and you will have flesh for your food: for in the ears of the Lord you have been weeping and saying, Who will give us flesh for food? for we were well off in Egypt: and so the Lord will give you flesh, and it will be your food;
translation: Sê vir die mense, maak julle skoon voor môre en julle sal vleis hê om te eet; want julle het in God se oë gehuil en gesê, Wie sal vir ons vleis gee om te eet? ons het goed gegaan in Egipte; daarom sal God julle vleis gee, en dit sal julle kos wees.

original: Not for one day only, or even for five or ten or twenty days;
translation: nie net vir een dag nie, of selfs vir vyf, tien of twintig dae nie;

original: But every day for a month, till you are tired of it, turning from it in disgust: because you have gone against the Lord who is with you, and have been weeping before him saying, Why did we come out of Egypt?
translation: Maar elke dag vir 'n maand, totdat jy moeg is daarvan, draai jy daarvandaan weg met afsku, omdat jy teen die Here wat by jou is, gesondig het, en voor Hom gehuil het en gesê het, Hoekom het ons uit Egipte gekom?

original: Then Moses said, The people, among whom I am, are six hundred thousand men on foot; and you have said, I will give them flesh to be their food for a month.
translation: Toe het Moses gesê: Die mense hier, waaronder ek, is ses honderd duisend mans wat te voet is; en jy het gesê: Ek sal hulle vleis gee om vir 'n maand te eet.

original: Are flocks and herds to be put to death for them? or are all the fish in the sea to be got together so that they may be full?
translation: Moet jy skape en bees doodmaak vir hulle? Of moet al die visse in die see bymekaarmaak sodat hulle vol kan wees?

original: And the Lord said to Moses, Has the Lord's hand become short? Now you will see if my word comes true for you or not.
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê: Het die Here se hand te kort geword? Nou gaan jy sien of my woord vir jou waar is of nie.

original: And Moses went out and gave the people the words of the Lord: and he took seventy of the responsible men of the people, placing them round the Tent.
translation: En Moses het uitgegaan en vir die mense God se woorde gegee: en hy het sewentig van die verantwoordelike mans gekies en hulle rondom die tent geplaas.

original: Then the Lord came down in the cloud and had talk with him, and put on the seventy men some of the spirit which was on him: now when the spirit came to rest on them, they were like prophets, but only at that time.
translation: Toe kom die Here af in die wolk en het met hom gepraat. Hy het die sewentig manne 'n deel van die gees gegee wat op hom was. Toe die gees op hulle rus, was hulle soos profete, maar dit was net vir daardie tyd.

original: But two men were still in the tent-circle one of them named Eldad and the other Medad: and the spirit came to rest on them; they were among those who had been sent for, but they had not gone out to the Tent: and the prophet's power came on them in the tent-circle.
translation: Maar daar was nog steeds twee mans in die tent, een was Eldad en die ander Medad; en die Gees het op hulle neergedaal; hulle was een van diegene wat geroep is, maar hulle het nie na die tent gegaan nie; en die profeet se krag het op hulle in die tent gekom.

original: And a young man went running to Moses and said, Eldad and Medad are acting as prophets in the tent-circle.
translation: En 'n jong man het na Moses toe gehardloop en gesê: Eldad en Medad is profete in die tent.

original: Then Joshua, the son of Nun, who had been Moses' servant from the time when he was a child, said, My lord Moses, let them be stopped.
translation: Toe het Josua, die seun van Nun, wat Moses se dienaar was toe hy 'n kind was, gesê: My heer Moses, laat hulle stop.

original: And Moses said to him, Are you moved by envy on my account? If only all the Lord's people were prophets, and the Lord might put his spirit on them!
translation: Toe sê Moses vir hom: “Is jy jaloers op my? As net al die Here se mense profete kon wees, en die Here sy Gees op hulle kon gee!”

original: Then Moses, with the responsible men of Israel, went back to the tent-circle.
translation: Toe het Moses, saam met die verantwoordelike mense van Israel, teruggegaan na die tent.

original: Then the Lord sent a wind, driving little birds from the sea, so that they came down on the tents, and all round the tent-circle, about a day's journey on this side and on that, in masses about two cubits high over the face of the earth.
translation: Toe het God 'n wind gestuur wat klein voëls van die see af gebring het, sodat hulle op die tente gaan sit het, en reg rondom die tente, oor 'n afstand van 'n dag se reis aan beide kante, in groot klompjies van ongeveer twee el hoog oor die grond.

original: And David said to Ahimelech the priest, The king has given me orders and has said to me, Say nothing to anyone about the business on which I am sending you and the orders I have given you: and a certain place has been fixed to which the young men are to go.
translation: En David het vir Ahimelech die priester gesê: Die koning het vir my opdragte gegee en gesê: Moet met niemand praat oor wat ek jou stuur om te doen en die opdragte wat ek jou gegee het nie; daar is 'n spesifieke plek waarheen die jong mense moet gaan.

original: So now, if you have here five cakes of bread, give them into my hand, or whatever you have.
translation: As jy vyf brode hier het, gee dit in my hand of enigiets anders wat jy het.

original: And the priest, answering David, said, I have no common bread here but there is holy bread; if only the young men have kept themselves from women.
translation: En die priester het vir David gesê, Ek het nie gewone brood hier nie, maar daar is heilig brood; as net die jong manne hulle van vroue afsonder.

original: And David in answer said to the priest, Certainly women have been kept from us; and as has been done before when I have gone out the arms of the young men were made holy, even though it was a common journey; how much more today will their arms be made holy.
translation: En David het geantwoord en vir die priester gesê, Dis seker waar dat vroue van ons af gehou is; soos wat al voorheen gebeur het toe ek uitgegaan het, was die jongmense se arms heilig gemaak, al was dit 'n gewone reis; hoeveel meer sal hulle se arms vandag heilig gemaak word.

original: So the priest gave him the holy bread: there was no other, only the holy bread which had been taken from before the Lord, so that new bread might be put in its place on the day when it was taken away.
translation: So het die priester vir hom die heilige brood gegee: daar was geen ander nie, net die heilige brood wat voor God weggehaal is, sodat nuwe brood op die dag wanneer dit weggehaal is, in sy plek gesit kan word.

original: Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, kept back before the Lord; his name was Doeg, an Edomite, the strongest of Saul's runners.
translation: Daar was 'n sekere man van Saul se dienaars daardie dag, wat voor die Here gehou is; sy naam was Doeg, 'n Edomiet, die sterkste van Saul se hardlopers.

original: And David said to Ahimelech, Have you no sword or spear with you here? for I have come without my sword and other arms, because the king's business had to be done quickly.
translation: En David het vir Ahimelech gesê: Het jy nie 'n swaard of spies hier nie? Want ek het sonder my swaard en ander wapens gekom, omdat ek vinnig die koning se werk moes doen.

original: And the priest said, The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom you put to death in the valley of Elah, is here folded in a cloth at the back of the ephod: take that, if you will, for there is no other sword here. And David said, there is no other sword like that; give it to me.
translation: En die priester het gesê, die swaard van Goliat die Filistyner, wat jy in die vallei van Elah doodgemaak het, is hier op 'n lap agter die efod gevou: neem dit, as jy wil, want daar is nie 'n ander swaard hier nie. En Dawid het gesê, daar is geen ander swaard soos dit nie; gee dit vir my.

original: Then David got up and went in flight that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish, the king of Gath.
translation: David het toe opgestaan en daardie dag gevlug omdat hy vir Saul bang was, en hy het na Achish, die koning van Gath, gegaan.

original: And the servants of Achish said to him, Is not this David, the king of the land? did they not make songs about him in their dances, saying, Saul has put to death thousands, and David tens of thousands?
translation: Die dienaars van Achish het vir hom gesê: Is dit nie David nie, die koning van die land? Het hulle nie in hulle danse liedjies oor hom gesing en gesê: Saul het duisende doodgemaak, maar David tienduisende?

original: And David took these words to heart, fearing Achish, the king of Gath.
translation: En David het hierdie woorde ter harte geneem, bang vir Achis, die koning van Gath.

original: So changing his behaviour before them, he made it seem as if he was off his head, hammering on the doors of the town, and letting the water from his mouth go down his chin.
translation: So het hy sy gedrag voor hulle verander en dit het gelyk of hy mal was, terwyl hy op die deure van die stad geklop het en die water uit sy mond oor sy ken afgekom het.

original: Then Achish said to his servants, Look! the man is clearly off his head; why have you let him come before me?
translation: Toe het Achis vir sy dienaars gesê: "Kyk! Die man is duidelik nie reg nie; hoekom het julle hom voor my gebring?"

original: Are there not enough unbalanced men about me, that you have let this person come and do such tricks before me? is such a man to come into my house?
translation: Is daar nie genoeg ongebalanseerde mans om my nie, dat jy hierdie persoon laat kom het om sulke truuks voor my te doen? Moet so 'n man in my huis kom?

original: So David went away from there and took cover in a strong place at Adullam; and his brothers and all his father's people, hearing of it, went down to him there.
translation: So het David van daar af gegaan en 'n skuilplek gevind in 'n sterk plek by Adullam; en sy broers en al sy pa se mense het na hom daar gegaan toe hulle daarvan hoor.

original: And everyone who was in trouble, and everyone who was in debt, and everyone who was bitter in soul, came together to him, and he became captain over them: about four hundred men were joined to him.
translation: En almal wat in moeilikheid was, almal wat skuld gehad het, en almal wat seergemaak was, het saamgekom en na hom gegaan, en hy het hulle leier geword: daar het sowat vierhonderd manne by hom aangesluit.

original: And from there David went to Mizpeh in the land of Moab: and he said to the king of Moab, Let my father and mother come and make their living-place with you till it is clear to me what God will do for me.
translation: En van daar het David na Mizpeh in die land van Moab gegaan en hy het vir die koning van Moab gesê: Laat my pa en ma kom en vir 'n tyd by julle bly totdat ek weet wat God vir my gaan doen.

original: And he took them to the king of Moab and they went on living with him while David was in his safe place.
translation: Hy het hulle na die koning van Moab geneem en hulle het saam met hom gebly terwyl David veilig was.

original: And the prophet Gad said to David, Do not go on living in this place but go into the land of Judah. Then David went away and came to the woodland of Hereth.
translation: Die profeet Gad het vir Dawid gesê: “Moet nie hier bly nie, maar gaan na die land van Juda.” Toe het Dawid weggegaan en by die bos van Hereth gekom.

original: And news was given to Saul that David had been seen, and the men who were with him: now Saul was in Gibeah, seated under the tree in the high place, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants were in their places before him.
translation: Die nuus het vir Saul gekom dat David gesien is, saam met die mense wat met hom was. Saul was in Gibeah, en hy het onder die boom op die hoë plek gesit, met sy spies in sy hand, terwyl al sy dienaars voor hom gestaan het.

original: Then Saul said to his servants who were there about him, Give ear now, you Benjamites; will the son of Jesse give to every one of you fields and vine-gardens, will he make you all captains of hundreds and captains of thousands;
translation: Toe het Saul vir sy dienaars gesê wat daar om hom was, Luister nou, julle van Benjamin; sal die seun van Jesse vir elkeen van julle grond en wingerde gee, sal hy julle almal hoofde van honderde en hoofde van duisende maak?

original: That all of you have made designs against me, and not one of you gave me word when my son made an agreement with the son of Jesse, and not one of you has pity for me or has made my eyes open to the fact that my servant has been moved by my son against me, as at this day?
translation: Julle het almal teen my saamgewerk, en niemand van julle het my iets gesê toe my seun 'n ooreenkoms met die seun van Jesse gemaak het nie. Niemand het jammer vir my gevoel of my oë geopen dat my dienaar deur my seun teen my gedoen is, soos vandag nie?

original: Then Doeg, the Edomite, who was by the side of the servants of Saul, in answer said, I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub.
translation: Toe het Doeg, die Edomiet, wat by Saul se dienaars was, geantwoord: Ek het die seun van Jesse gesien wat na Nob kom, by Ahimelech, die seun van Ahitub.

original: And he got directions from the Lord for him, and gave him food, and put in his hand the sword of Goliath the Philistine.
translation: En hy het instruksies van die Here gekry, en hom kos gegee, en die swaard van Goliat, die Filistyn, in sy hand gesit.

original: Then the king sent for Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and for all the men of his father's family who were priests in Nob: and they all came to the king.
translation: Toe het die koning vir Ahimelech die priester gestuur, die seun van Ahitub, en vir al die mans van sy pa se familie wat priesters in Nob was: en hulle het almal na die koning gekom.

original: And Saul said, Give ear now, O son of Ahitub. And answering he said, Here I am, my lord.
translation: En Saul het gesê, Luister nou, O seun van Ahitub. En hy het geantwoord, Hier is ek, my heer.

original: And Saul said to him, Why have you made designs against me with the son of Jesse, giving him food and a sword and getting directions from the Lord for him, and helping him to take up arms against me, and to be on the watch to make a secret attack on me as he is doing now?
translation: En Saul het vir hom gesê, hoekom het jy planne teen my gemaak saam met die seun van Isai? Jy het vir hom kos en 'n swaard gegee, en die Here se leiding vir hom gekry, en hom gehelp om teen my te veg, en om op die uitkyk te wees om 'n geheime aanval op my te maak soos hy nou doen?

original: Then Ahimelech answering said to the king, Who among all your servants is so true to you as David, who is the king's son-in-law, and is a captain of your armed men, and has a place of honour in your house?
translation: Toe het Ahimelech geantwoord en vir die koning gesê: Wie onder al jou dienaars is so getrou aan jou soos David, wat jou skoonseun is, en 'n leier van jou soldate is, en 'n plek van eer in jou huis het?

original: Is this the first time I have got directions from God for him? Far be the thought! let the king make no such statement against his servant or my father's family, for your servant has no knowledge, great or small, of this thing.
translation: Is dit die eerste keer dat ek God se rigting vir hom ontvang? Niks van die gedagte! Laat die koning nie so iets teen sy dienaar of my pa se familie sê nie, want ek weet glad nie hiervan nie, groot of klein.

original: And the king said, You will certainly be put to death, Ahimelech, you and all your father's family.
translation: Die koning het gesê: "Jy gaan beslis doodgemaak word, Ahimelech, jy en jou hele pa se gesin."

original: Then the king said to the runners who were waiting near him, Put the priests of the Lord to death; because they are on David's side, and having knowledge of his flight, did not give me word of it. But the king's servants would not put out their hands to make an attack on the Lord's priests.
translation: Toe sê die koning vir die boodskappers wat naby hom gewag het, 'Maak die priesters van die Here dood; omdat hulle aan David se kant is en geweet het van sy vlug, maar nie vir my gesê het nie.' Maar die koning se dienaars wou nie hulle hande uitsteke om die Here se priesters aan te val nie.

original: Then the king said to Doeg, You are to put the priests to death. And Doeg the Edomite, turning on the priests and attacking them, put to death that day eighty-five men who took up the ephod.
translation: Toe sê die koning vir Doeg, jy moet die priesters doodmaak. En Doeg die Edomiet het die priesters aangeval en daardie dag het hy vyf-en-tagtig mense doodgemaak wat die efod gedra het.

original: And Nob, the town of the priests, he put to the sword, all the men and women, children and babies at the breast, and oxen and asses and sheep.
translation: En Nob, die dorpie van die priesters, het hy met die swaard doodgemaak, al die mans en vroue, kinders en babas, sowel as osse, esels en skape.

original: And Abiathar, one of the sons of Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub, got away and went in flight after David;
translation: En Abiathar, een van Ahimelech se seuns, het ontsnap en na David gevlug.

original: And gave him the news of how Saul had put to death the Lord's priests.
translation: Hy het vir hom vertel hoe Saul die Here se priesters doodgemaak het.

original: And David said to Abiathar, I was certain that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would take the news to Saul: I am responsible for the lives of all your father's family.
translation: En David het vir Abiathar gesê: "Ek was daardie dag seker, toe Doeg die Edomiet daar was, dat hy die nuus na Saul sou neem: Ek is verantwoordelik vir die lewens van julle pa se hele familie."

original: Keep here with me and have no fear; for he who has designs on my life has designs on yours: but with me you will be safe.
translation: Bly hier by my en moenie bang wees nie; want hy wat vir my lewe beplan, beplan ook vir jou. Maar saam met my sal jy veilig wees.

original: And they sent word to David, saying, The Philistines are fighting against Keilah and taking the grain from the grain-floors.
translation: Hulle het vir David gestuur om te sê dat die Filisteine teen Keilah veg en die graan van die graanvloere neem.

original: So David, questioning the Lord, said, Am I to go and make an attack on these Philistines? And the Lord said to David, Go and make an attack on the Philistines so that Keilah may be kept from falling into their hands.
translation: Toe David die Here vra, het hy gesê: "Moet ek hierdie Filistyne aanval?" En die Here het vir David gesê: "Gaan en aanval die Filistyne sodat Keilah nie in hulle hande val nie."

original: And David's men said to him, Even here in Judah we are full of fear: how much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?
translation: David se manne het vir hom gesê: hier in Juda is ons al vol vrees. Hoeveel meer sal ons wees as ons na Keilah gaan om teen die leër van die Filistyne te veg?

original: Then David put the question to the Lord again, and the Lord answering said, Up! go down to Keilah; for I will give the Philistines into your hands.
translation: Toe het David weer vir die Here gevra, en die Here het geantwoord, "Staan op! Gaan na Keilah toe; want ek sal die Filistyne in jou hande gee."

original: So David and his men went to Keilah, and had a fight with the Philistines, and took away their cattle, and put them to the sword with great destruction. So David was the saviour of the people of Keilah.
translation: So het David en sy manne na Keilah gegaan, en hulle het met die Filistyne geveg, hulle se diere weggevat en baie vernietiging veroorsaak. So was David die redder van die mense van Keilah.

original: Now when Abiathar, the son of Ahimelech, went in flight to David, he came down to Keilah with the ephod in his hand.
translation: Toe Abiathar, die seun van Ahimelech, na David gevlug het, het hy na Keilah gegaan met die efod in sy hand.

original: And news was given to Saul that David had come to Keilah. And Saul said, Now God has given him into my hands; for by going into a walled town with locked doors, he has let himself be shut in.
translation: Saul het gehoor dat David na Keilah gekom het. Saul het gesê: "Nou het God hom in my hande gegee; want deur in 'n stad met mure en geslote deure in te gaan, het hy homself vasgevang."

original: And Saul sent for all the people to come to the fight, and go down to Keilah to make an attack on David and his men.
translation: En Saul het vir almal gestuur om by die geveg te kom en om na Keilah te gaan om David en sy manne aan te val.

original: And it was clear to David that Saul had evil designs against him, and he said to Abiathar the priest, Come here with the ephod.
translation: David het gesien dat Saul slegte planne teen hom gehad het, en hy het vir Abiathar die priester gesê: “Kom hier met die efod.”

original: Then David said, O Lord, the God of Israel, news has been given to your servant that it is Saul's purpose to come to Keilah and send destruction on the town because of me.
translation: Toe het David gesê, O Here, God van Israel, ek het gehoor dat Saul van plan is om na Keilah te kom en die stad te verwoes omdat ek daar is.

original: And now, is it true, as they have said to me, that Saul is coming? O Lord, the God of Israel, give ear to your servant, and say if these things are so. And the Lord said, He is coming down.
translation: En nou, is dit waar, soos hulle vir my gesê het, dat Saul kom? O Heer, God van Israel, luister na U dienaar, en sê of dit so is. En die Heer het gesê, Hy kom af.

original: Then David said, Will the men of Keilah give me and my men up to Saul? and the Lord said, They will give you up.
translation: Toe het David gesê: Sal die mense van Keilah my en my mense aan Saul oorgee? En die Here het gesê: Hulle sal jou oorgee.

original: Then David and his men, about six hundred of them, went out of Keilah, and got away wherever they were able to go. And Saul, hearing that David had got away from Keilah, did not go there.
translation: Toe het David en sy manne, omtrent ses honderd van hulle, uit Keilah gegaan en weggesper waar hulle kon. En Saul, toe hy hoor dat David weg is van Keilah, het nie daarheen gegaan nie.

original: And David kept in the waste land, in safe places, waiting in the hill-country in the waste land of Ziph. And Saul was searching for him every day, but God did not give him up into his hands.
translation: En David het in die woestyn gebly, in veilige plekke, en gewag in die heuwels van die woestyn by Zif. En Saul het elke dag na hom gesoek, maar God het hom nie in sy hande gegee nie.

original: And David was full of fear, in the knowledge that Saul had come out to take his life; and David was in the waste land of Ziph, in Horesh.
translation: En David was baie bang, omdat hy geweet het dat Saul hom wou doodmaak; en David was in die woestyn van Zif, in Horesh.

original: And Saul's son Jonathan went to David in Horesh, and made his hands strong in God;
translation: En Saul se seun Jonathan het na David in Horesh gegaan en hom in God bemoedig.

original: And said to him, Have no fear, for Saul my father will not get you into his power; and you will be king of Israel, and I will be by your side, and my father Saul is certain of this.
translation: En het vir hom gesê, Moet nie bang wees nie, want my pa Saul sal jou nie in sy mag kry nie; en jy sal die koning van Israel wees, en ek sal by jou wees, en my pa Saul is seker hiervan.

original: And the two of them made an agreement before the Lord: and David went on living in Horesh, and Jonathan went back to his house.
translation: En hulle het 'n afspraak gemaak voor God: en David het in Horesh gebly, en Jonathan het huis toe teruggegaan.

original: Then the Ziphites came up to Gibeah to see Saul, and said, Is not David living secretly among us in the strong places in Horesh, in the hill of Hachilah to the south of the waste land?
translation: Toe het die Zifiete na Gibea gegaan om Saul te sien en gesê: "Is David nie stil tussen ons nie, in die veilige plekke in Horesh, op die heuwel van Hachilah suid van die verlate grond?"

original: So now, O king, have your soul's desire and come down, and we, for our part, will give him up into the king's hands.
translation: Nou, koning, kry wat jy wil hê en kom hierheen, dan sal ons hom aan jou oorhandig.

original: And Saul said, The Lord's blessing will be yours, for you have had pity on me.
translation: En Saul het gesê: God se seën sal joune wees, want jy het medelye met my gehad.

original: Go now, and take more steps, and see where he is living: for they say that he is expert in deceit.
translation: Gaan nou, en neem meer stappe, en kyk waar hy woon: want hulle sê hy is baie goed om ander te mislei.

original: So take care to get knowledge of all the secret places where he is taking cover, and be certain to come back to me, and I will go with you: and without doubt, if he is anywhere in the land, I will get him, among all the families of Judah.
translation: Ken al die geheime plekke waar hy wegkruip, en kom terug na my toe, dan sal ek saam met jou gaan. Ek is seker, as hy enige plek in die land is, sal ek hom tussen al die families van Juda vind.

original: And they went back and came to Ziph before Saul: but David and his men were in the waste land of Maon, in the dry land south of the waste land.
translation: En hulle het teruggegaan en na Ziph gegaan om met Saul te praat, maar David en sy mense was in die woestyn van Maon, in die droë land suid van die woestyn.

original: And Saul and his men went in search of him. And David had word of it, so he came down to the rock in the waste land of Maon. And Saul, hearing of this, went after David into the waste land of Maon.
translation: Saul en sy manne het vir hom gesoek. David het daarvan gehoor, so hy het na die klip in die woesterny van Maon gekom. En Saul, wat hiervan gehoor het, het na David in die woesterny van Maon gegaan.

original: And Saul and his men went on one side of the mountain, and David and his men went on the other: and David's purpose was to get away as quickly as possible, for fear of Saul; for Saul and his men were making a circle round David and his men in order to take them.
translation: Saul en sy mense het aan die een kant van die berg gegaan, en David en sy mense aan die ander kant. David het probeer om so vinnig as moontlik weg te kom, omdat hy bang was vir Saul; Saul en sy mense het 'n sirkel om David en sy mense gemaak om hulle te vang.

original: But a man came to Saul saying, Be quick and come; for the Philistines have made an attack on the land.
translation: Maar 'n man het na Saul gekom en gesê, 'Wees gou en kom; want die Filistyne het die land aangeval.'

original: So turning back from going after David, Saul went against the Philistines: so that place was named Sela-hammah-lekoth.
translation: Toe Saul dus van sy soektog na David omdraai, het hy teen die Filistyne gegaan: daarom het hulle daardie plek Sela-hammah-lekoth genoem.

original: And from there, David went up and took cover in the safe place of En-gedi.
translation: En van daar het David opgevaar en in die veilige plek van En-gedi ingegaan.

original: Now when Saul came back from fighting the Philistines, news was given him that David was in the waste land of En-gedi.
translation: Toe Saul terugkom van die geveg teen die Filistyne, het hulle vir hom gesê dat David in die woesteny van En-gedi is.

original: Then Saul took three thousand of the best men out of all Israel, and went in search of David and his men on the rocks of the mountain goats.
translation: Toe het Saul drie duisend van die beste mans uit die hele Israel geneem en het hy David en sy manne op die rotse van die bergbokke gesoek.

original: And on the way he came to a place where sheep were kept, where there was a hollow in the rock; and Saul went in for a private purpose. Now David and his men were in the deepest part of the hollow.
translation: En op die pad het hy by 'n plek gekom waar skape gebly het, daar was 'n holte in die rots; en Saul het ingegaan vir 'n private rede. David en sy manne was toe in die diepste deel van die holte.

original: And David's men said to him, Now is the time when the Lord says to you, I will give up your hater into your hands to do with him whatever seems good to you. Then David, getting up, took the skirt of Saul's robe in his hand, cutting off the end of it without his knowledge.
translation: En David se mense het vir hom gesê, nou is dit die tyd wanneer die Here vir jou sê, Ek gaan jou vyand in jou hande gee om met hom te doen wat goed vir jou is. Toe het David opgestaan, die punt van Saul se rok in sy hand geneem en dit afgesny sonder dat Saul dit geweet het.

original: And later, David was full of regret for cutting off Saul's skirt.
translation: Later het David baie spyt gehad oor dit hy Saul se rok afgesny het.

original: And David said to his men, Before the Lord, never let it be said that my hand was lifted up against my lord, the man of the Lord's selection, for the Lord's holy oil has been put on him.
translation: En David het vir sy mense gesê, Voor God, moenie ooit sê dat ek my hand teen my Meester opgehef het nie, die man wat God gekies het, want God se heilige olie is op hom gesit.

original: So with these words David kept his servants back, and did not let them make an attack on Saul. And Saul got up and went on his way.
translation: Met hierdie woorde het David sy dienaars weerhou en hulle nie toegelaat om Saul aan te val nie. En Saul het opgestaan en verder gegaan.

original: And after that David came out of the hollow rock, and crying after Saul said, My lord the king. And when Saul gave a look back, David went down on his face and gave him honour.
translation: En toe het David uit die holle klip uitgekom en vir Saul geskreeu, my meneer, die koning. Toe Saul omkyk, het David sy gesig op die grond neergelê en hom geëer.

original: And David said to Saul, Why do you give any attention to those who say that it is my desire to do you wrong?
translation: en David het vir Saul gesê, waarom gee jy aandag aan hulle wat sê dat ek jou wil seergmaak?

original: Look! you have seen today how the Lord gave you up into my hands even now in the hollow of the rocks: and some would have had me put you to death, but I had pity on you: for I said, Never will my hand be lifted up against my lord, who has been marked with the holy oil.
translation: Kyk! Jy het vandag gesien hoe die Here jou in my hande gegee het, selfs in die holtes van die rotse. Party het vir my gesê ek moet jou doodmaak, maar ek het jammer vir jou gevoel. Ek het gesê, ek sal nooit my hand teen my heer ophef nie, hy wat met heilige olie as koning gekies is.

original: And see, my father, see the skirt of your robe in my hand: for the fact that I took off the skirt of your robe and did not put you to death is witness that I have no evil purpose, and I have done you no wrong, though you are waiting for my life to take it.
translation: Kyk, my pa, kyk na die rand van jou rok in my hande: want die feit dat ek die rand van jou rok afgehaal het en jou nie doodgemaak het nie, wys dat ek geen slegte bedoelings het nie, en ek het jou geen kwaad aangedoen nie, al wag jy vir my lewe om dit te neem.

original: May the Lord be judge between me and you, and may the Lord give me my rights against you, but my hand will never be lifted up against you.
translation: Mag die Here tussen my en jou oordeel, en mag die Here my regte teen jou gee, maar ek sal nooit my hand teen jou oplig nie.

original: There is an old saying, From the evil-doer comes evil: but my hand will never be lifted up against you.
translation: Daar is 'n ou spreekwoord: slegte mense bring slegte dinge, maar ek sal jou nooit seergemaak nie.

original: After whom has the king of Israel come out? for whom are you searching? for a dead dog, an insect.
translation: Na wie het die koning van Israel uitgekom? Vir wie soek jy? Vir 'n dooie hond, 'n insekt.

original: So let the Lord be judge, and give a decision between me and you, and see and give support to my cause, and keep me from falling into your hands.
translation: Laat die Here oordeel en besluit tussen my en jou, kyk en help my met my saak, en verhoed dat ek in jou hande val.

original: Now when David had said these words to Saul, Saul said, Is this your voice, David, my son? And Saul was overcome with weeping.
translation: Toe David hierdie woorde vir Saul gesê het, het Saul geantwoord: "Is dit regtig jou stem, David, my seun?" En Saul het begin huil.

original: And he said to David, You are right and I am wrong: for you have given me back good, but I have given you evil.
translation: Hy het vir David gesê, jy is reg en ek is verkeerd: jy het vir my goed gegee, maar ek het vir jou sleg gegee.

original: And you have made clear to me how good you have been to me today: because, when the Lord gave me up into your hands, you did not put me to death.
translation: En jy het vir my gewys hoe goed jy vandag vir my was: want toe die Here my aan jou oorhandig het, het jy my nie doodgemaak nie.

original: If a man comes across his hater, will he let him get away safe? so may you be rewarded by the Lord for what you have done for me today.
translation: As 'n man sy vyand raakloop, sal hy hom dan laat gaan? Julle kan so deur die Here beloon word vir wat julle vandag vir my gedoen het.

original: And now I am certain that you will be king, and that the kingdom of Israel will be made strong under your authority.
translation: En nou is ek seker dat jy koning gaan wees, en dat die koninkryk van Israel sterk gaan wees onder jou leiding.

original: So give me your oath by the Lord, that you will not put an end to my seed after me or let my name be cut off from my father's family.
translation: Gee my asseblief jou belofte aan die Here, dat jy nie my nageslag na my nie sal uitskakel nie, of my naam uit my pa se familie sal wegneem nie.

original: And David gave Saul his oath. And Saul went back to his house; but David and his men went up to their safe place.
translation: En David het vir Saul belowe. En Saul het teruggegaan huis toe; maar David en sy mense het na hulle veilige plek gegaan.

original: And death came to Samuel; and all Israel came together, weeping for him, and put his body in its resting-place in his house at Ramah. Then David went down to the waste land of Maon.
translation: En die dood het Samuel bereik; al die mense van Israel het bymekaargekom, huilend vir hom, en het sy liggaam in sy rusplek in sy huis in Rama neergelê. Toe het Dawid na die woeste grond van Maon gegaan.

original: Now there was a man in Maon whose business was in Carmel; he was a great man and had three thousand sheep and a thousand goats: and he was cutting the wool of his sheep in Carmel.
translation: Daar was 'n man in Maon wat sy besigheid in Karmel gehad het; hy was 'n groot man en het drie duisend skape en 'n duisend bokke gehad. Hy was besig om die wol van sy skape in Karmel af te sny.

original: Now this man was named Nabal, and his wife's name was Abigail: she was a woman of good sense and pleasing looks: but the man was cruel and evil in his ways; he was of the family of Caleb.
translation: Nou was hierdie man Nabal genoem, en sy vrou se naam was Abigail: sy was 'n vrou met goeie verstand en 'n mooi voorkoms: maar die man was wreed en sleg in sy gedrag; hy was van die familie van Kaleb.

original: And David had word in the waste land that Nabal was cutting the wool of his sheep.
translation: David het gehoor in die woestyn dat Nabal sy skaap se wol sny.

original: And David sent ten young men, and said to them, Go up to Carmel and go to Nabal, and say kind words to him in my name;
translation: En David het tien jong manne gestuur en vir hulle gesê: Gaan na Karmel toe en praat lekker met Nabal in my naam.

original: And say this to my brother, May all be well for you: peace be to you and your house and all you have.
translation: En sê dit vir my broer: Mag alles goed gaan met jou; vrede wees met jou, jou huis en al wat jy het.

original: I have had word that you have wool-cutters: now the keepers of your sheep have been with us, and we have done them no evil, and taken nothing of theirs while they were in Carmel.
translation: Ek het gehoor julle het wol snyers: die oppassers van julle skape was by ons en ons het niks sleg gedoen nie, en ons het niks van hulle geneem terwyl hulle in Karmel was.

original: If your young men are questioned they will say the same thing. So now, let my young men have grace in your eyes, for we are come at a good time; please give anything you may have by you to your servants and to your son David.
translation: As jou jong manne gevra word, sal hulle dieselfde sê. Laat my jong manne nou genade in jou oë hê, want ons het op 'n goeie tyd gekom. Gee asseblief enigiets wat jy by jou het aan jou dienaars en aan jou seun David.

original: And when David's young men came, they said all this to Nabal, in David's name, and said nothing more.
translation: Toe David se jong manne gekom het, het hulle alles aan Nabal gesê in David se naam en niks meer nie.

original: And Nabal gave them his answer and said, Who is David? who is the son of Jesse? there are a number of servants in these days running away from their masters.
translation: En Nabal het vir hulle geantwoord en gesê: "Wie is David? Wie is die seun van Jesse? Daar is baie dienaars wat vandag van hulle meesters weghardloop."

original: Am I to take my bread and my wine and the meat I have got ready for my wool-cutters and give it to men coming from I have no idea where?
translation: Moet ek my brood, wyn en die vleis wat ek vir my wol-skeerders reggemaak het, aan mense gee wat ek nie weet waar hulle vandaan kom nie?

original: So David's young men, turning away, went back and gave him an account of everything he had said.
translation: So David se jong manne het omgedraai, teruggegaan en vir hom vertel wat hy alles gesê het.

original: And David said to his men, Put on your swords, every one of you. And every man put on his sword; and David did the same; and about four hundred men went up with David, and two hundred kept watch over their goods.
translation: Toe het David vir sy mense gesê: "Trek julle swerte aan, almal van julle." En elke man het sy swaard aangetrek; en David het ook so gedoen. En omtrent vierhonderd manne het saam met David gegaan, en tweehonderd het oor hulle goed gesorg.

original: But one of the young men said to Nabal's wife Abigail, David sent men from the waste land to say kind words to our master, and he gave them a rough answer.
translation: Maar een van die jong manne het vir Nabal se vrou Abigail gesê: David het mense uit die woestyn gestuur om vir ons meester vriendelike dinge te sê, maar hy het vir hulle 'n harde antwoord gegee.

original: But these men have been very good to us; they did us no wrong and nothing of ours was touched while we were with them in the fields:
translation: Maar hierdie mense was baie goed vir ons; hulle het ons nie kwaad aangedoen nie en niks van ons is aangeraak terwyl ons saam met hulle in die veld was.

original: But day and night they were like a wall round us while we were with them, looking after the sheep.
translation: Maar dag en nag was hulle soos 'n muur om ons terwyl ons by hulle was, en die skape na te gaan.

original: So now, give thought to what you are going to do; for evil is in store for our master and all his house: for he is such a good-for-nothing person that it is not possible to say anything to him.
translation: Dink goed na oor wat jy gaan doen; want daar is slegte dinge op pad vir ons meester en sy hele huis. Hy is so 'n luiaard dat jy glad niks vir hom kan sê nie.

original: Then Abigail quickly took two hundred cakes of bread and two skins full of wine and five sheep ready for cooking and five measures of dry grain and a hundred parcels of dry grapes and two hundred cakes of figs, and put them on asses.
translation: Toe het Abigail vinnig tweehonderd broodjies, twee leer vol wyn, vyf skaap wat bereid is om te kook, vyf maate droë graan, honderd pakkies droë druiwe en tweehonderd vyekoe-kaggels geneem en dit op donkies gesit.

original: And she said to her young men, Go on in front of me and I will come after you. But she said nothing to her husband Nabal.
translation: En sy het vir haar jong seuns gesê, Gaan vooruit en ek sal agter julle aankom. Maar sy het niks vir haar man Nabal gesê nie.

original: Now while she was going down under cover of the mountain on her ass, David and his men came down against her, and suddenly she came face to face with them.
translation: Toe sy onder die berg afkom op haar donkie, het David en sy manne ook daar aangekom, en skielik het sy hulle in die oë gekyk.

original: Now David had said, What was the use of my taking care of this man's goods in the waste land, so that there was no loss of anything which was his? he has only given me back evil for good.
translation: David het gesê, wat was die nut daarvan dat ek na hierdie man se goed in die woestyn omsien, sodat daar niks van hom verloor gaan het nie? Hy het my net slegter teruggegee vir die goeie wat ek gedoen het.

original: May God's punishment be on David, if when morning comes there is so much as one male of his people still living.
translation: Mag God se straf oor David kom, as daar, wanneer die oggend aanbreek, nog een man van sy mense lewendig is.

original: And when Abigail saw David, she quickly got off her ass, falling down on her face before him.
translation: En toe Abigail David sien, het sy vinnig van haar donkie afgeklim en op haar gesig voor hom neergeval.

original: And falling at his feet she said, May the wrong be on me, my lord, on me: let your servant say a word to you, and give ear to the words of your servant.
translation: Toe sy voor sy voete val, sê sy: Laat die skuld op my wees, my heer, laat ek 'n woord vir jou sê, en luister na die woorde van jou dienaar.

original: Let my lord give no attention to Nabal, that good-for-nothing: for as his name is, so is he, a man without sense: but I, your servant, did not see the young men whom my lord sent.
translation: Moet asseblief nie na Nabal, daardie nuttelose man, kyk nie: want soos sy naam is, so is hy, 'n man sonder verstand: maar ek, u dienskneg, het nie die jong mans gesien wat my heer gestuur het nie.

original: So now, my lord, by the living God and by your living soul, seeing that the Lord has kept you from the crime of blood and from taking into your hands the punishment for your wrongs, may all your haters, and those who would do evil to my lord, be like Nabal.
translation: So nou, my meneer, in die naam van die lewende God en deur jou lewende siel, omdat die Here jou beskerm het teen moord en jy nie self wraak moet neem nie, mag al jou vyande en dié wat jou kwaad wil doen, soos Nabal wees.

original: And let this offering, which your servant gives to my lord, be given to the young men who are with my lord.
translation: Laat hierdie aanbod wat jy aan my gee, aan die jong mense gegee word wat saam met jou is.

original: And may the sin of your servant have forgiveness: for the Lord will certainly make your family strong, because my lord is fighting in the Lord's war; and no evil will be seen in you all your days.
translation: En mag die sonde van jou dienaar vergewe word, want die Here sal jou gesin sterk maak, omdat my heer in die Here se oorlog veg; en geen kwaad sal jou al die dae oorval nie.

original: And though a man has taken up arms against you, putting your life in danger, still the soul of my lord will be kept safe among the band of the living with the Lord your God; and the souls of those who are against you he will send violently away from him, like stones from a bag.
translation: Al het 'n man wapens teen jou opgeneem en jou lewe in gevaar gestel, sal my heer se siel steeds veilig wees tussen die lewendes by die Here jou God; en die siele van dié wat teen jou is, sal Hy met geweld van Hom af wegstuur, soos klippe uit 'n sak.

original: And when the Lord has done for my lord all those good things which he has said he will do for you, and has made you a ruler over Israel;
translation: En wanneer die Here alles wat Hy vir my heer belowe het, vir jou gedoen het, en jou 'n heerser oor Israel gemaak het;

original: Then you will have no cause for grief, and my lord's heart will not be troubled because you have taken life without cause and have yourself given punishment for your wrongs: and when the Lord has been good to you, then give a thought to your servant.
translation: Dan sal jy nie meer hartseer wees nie, en my heer se hart sal nie meer pla nie omdat jy sonder rede lewe geneem het en jouself gestraf het vir jou foute: en wanneer die Here goed vir jou is, onthou dan jou dienaar.

original: And David said to Abigail, May the Lord, the God of Israel, be praised, who sent you to me today:
translation: En David het vir Abigail gesê: Mag die Here, die God van Israel, geprys wees, wat jou vandag na my gestuur het.

original: A blessing on your good sense and on you, who have kept me today from the crime of blood and from taking into my hands the punishment for my wrongs.
translation: Ek sê dankie vir jou goeie oordeel en vir jou wat my vandag gehelp het om weg te bly van moord en om nie self wraak te neem vir my foute nie.

original: For truly, by the living Lord, the God of Israel, who has kept me from doing you evil, if you had not been so quick in coming to me and meeting me, by dawn there would not have been in Nabal's house so much as one male living.
translation: Want werklik, by die lewende Here, die God van Israel, wat my keer om jou kwaad te doen, as jy nie so vinnig na my toe gekom het en my ontmoet het nie, teen die môre sou daar in Nabal se huis nie eens een man oorleef het nie.

original: Then David took from her hands her offering: and he said to her, Go back to your house in peace; see, I have given ear to your voice, and taken your offering with respect.
translation: Toe het Dawid haar offer uit haar hande geneem en vir haar gesê: Gaan terug huis toe in vrede. Kyk, ek het na jou stem geluister en jou offer met respek aanvaar.

original: And Abigail went back to Nabal; and he was feasting in his house like a king; and Nabal's heart was full of joy, for he had taken much wine; so she said nothing to him till dawn came.
translation: En Abigail het teruggegaan na Nabal; hy was besig om soos 'n koning in sy huis te fees; Nabal se hart was vol vreugde omdat hy baie wyn gedrink het; sy het vir hom niks gesê totdat dit daglig geword het.

original: And in the morning, when the effect of the wine was gone, Nabal's wife gave him an account of all these things, and all the heart went out of him, and he became like stone.
translation: En in die oggend, toe die wyn se invloed weg was, het Nabal se vrou hom vertel van al hierdie dinge, en sy hart het gebroke, en hy het soos 'n klip geword.

original: And about ten days after, the Lord sent disease on Nabal and death came to him.
translation: Ongeveer tien dae later het die Here siekte op Nabal gestuur en het die dood na hom gekom.

original: And David, hearing that Nabal was dead, said, May the Lord be praised, who has taken up my cause against Nabal for the shame which he put on me, and has kept back his servant from evil, and has sent on Nabal's head the reward of his evil-doing. And David sent word to Abigail, desiring to take her as his wife.
translation: En David, toe hy hoor dat Nabal dood is, het gesê: Prys die Here, wat my help teen Nabal vir die skande wat hy my aangedoen het, en my van die kwaad gehelp het, en op Nabal se kop die straf vir sy slegte dade gestuur het. En David het vir Abigail laat weet dat hy haar wil hê as sy vrou.

original: And when David's servants came to Carmel, to Abigail, they said to her, David has sent us to you to take you to him as his wife.
translation: En toe David se helpers by Karmel aankom, by Abigail, het hulle vir haar gesê: David het ons gestuur om jou na hom toe te neem as sy vrou.

original: And she got up, and going down on her face to the earth, said, See, I am ready to be a servant-girl, washing the feet of the servants of my lord.
translation: En sy het opgestaan, en sy het met haar gesig op die grond neergeloop en gesê, Kyk, ek is reg om 'n diensmeisie te wees wat die voete van my heer se dienaars was.

original: Then Abigail got up quickly and went on her ass, with five of her young women, after the men whom David had sent; and she became David's wife.
translation: Toe het Abigail vinnig opgestaan en op haar donkie geklim, saam met vyf van haar jong vroue, om by die manne te gaan wat David gestuur het; en sy het David se vrou geword.

original: And David had taken Ahinoam of Jezreel, to be his wife; these two were his wives.
translation: David het Ahinoam van Jezreel geneem as sy vrou; hulle twee was sy vroue.

original: Now Saul had given his daughter Michal, David's wife, to Palti the son of Laish of Gallim.
translation: Nou het Saul sy dogter Michal, David se vrou, aan Palti, die seun van Laish van Gallim, gegee.

original: And the Ziphites came to Saul at Gibeah, and said, Is not David waiting secretly near us in the hill of Hachilah, before the waste land?
translation: En die Zifiete het by Saul in Gibea gekom en gesê: Is David nie stilletjies naby ons op die Hachilah-heuvel, voor die woestyn nie?

original: Then Saul went down to the waste land of Ziph, taking with him three thousand of the best men of Israel, to make search for David in the waste land of Ziph.
translation: Toe het Saul na die verlate gebied van Ziph gegaan, saam met drie duisend van die beste mense van Israel, om vir Dawid in daardie gebied te soek.

original: And Saul put up his tents on the hill of Hachilah, which is in front of the waste land on the road. But David was in the waste land, and he saw that Saul was coming after him.
translation: En Saul het sy tente opgeslaan op die heuwel van Hachilah, wat voor die woeste grond langs die pad is. Maar David was in die woeste grond, en hy het gesien dat Saul hom agtervolg.

original: And so David sent out watchers, and got word from them that Saul was certainly coming.
translation: En so het David mense gestuur om te kyk, en hulle het vir hom gesê dat Saul beslis oppad was.

original: And David got up and came to the place where Saul's tents were: and David had a view of the place where Saul was sleeping with Abner, the son of Ner, the captain of his army: and Saul was sleeping inside the ring of carts, and the tents of the people were all round him.
translation: En David het opgestaan en na die plek gegaan waar Saul se tente was. David het gesien waar Saul en Abner, die seun van Ner, die kaptein van sy leër, slaap. Saul het binne die kring van waens geslaap, en die tente van die mense was rondom hom.

original: Then David said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, brother of Joab, Who will go down with me to the tents of Saul? And Abishai said, I will go down with you.
translation: Toe het David vir Ahimelech die Hittiet en vir Abishai, die seun van Zeruiah, Joab se broer, gevra: "Wie gaan saam met my na Saul se tente?" En Abishai het gesê: "Ek sal saam met jou gaan."

original: So David and Abishai came down to the army by night: and Saul was sleeping inside the ring of carts with his spear planted in the earth by his head: and Abner and the people were sleeping round him.
translation: Toe het David en Abishai snags na die leër gegaan. Saul het tussen die waens geslaap met sy spies in die grond langs sy kop, en Abner en die mense het om hom geslaap.

original: Then Abishai said to David, God has given up your hater into your hands today; now let me give him one blow through to the earth with his spear, and there will be no need to give him a second.
translation: Toe het Abishai vir David gesê, God het jou vyand vandag in jou hande gegee; laat ek hom met sy spies een keer op die grond slaan, en daar sal nie 'n tweede keer nodig wees nie.

original: And David said to Abishai Do not put him to death; for who, without sin, may put out his hand against the man on whom the Lord has put the holy oil?
translation: David het vir Abishai gesê: "Moet hom nie doodmaak nie; want wie, sonder sonde, kan sy hand teen die man opsteek op wie die Here die heilige olie gesalf het?"

original: And David said, By the living Lord, the Lord will send destruction on him; the natural day of his death will come, or he will go into the fight and come to his end.
translation: En David het gesê, By die lewende Here, die Here sal hom straf; die dag van sy dood sal aanbreek, of hy sal in die geveg gaan en dit sal tot sy einde lei.

original: Never will my hand be stretched out against the man marked with the holy oil; but take the spear which is by his head and the vessel of water, and let us go.
translation: Ek sal my hand nooit teen die man wat met die heilige olie gemerk is, uitsteek nie; maar neem die spies wat daar by sy kop is en die waterhouer, en kom ons gaan.

original: So David took the spear and the vessel of water from Saul's head; and they got away without any man seeing them, or being conscious of their coming, or awaking; for they were all sleeping because a deep sleep from the Lord had come on them.
translation: So David het die spies en die waterbeker van Saul se kop geneem; en hulle het weggekom sonder dat iemand hulle gesien het, of geweer het dat hulle daar was, of wakker geword het; want hulle het almal geslaap omdat 'n diep slaap van die Here op hulle gekom het.

original: Then David went over to the other side, and took his place on the top of a mountain some distance away, with a great space between them;
translation: Toe het David na die ander kant gegaan en sy plek bo op 'n berg ingeneem, 'n bietjie verder weg, met 'n groot ruimte tussen hulle.

original: And crying out to the people and to Abner, the son of Ner, David said, Have you no answer to give, Abner? Then Abner said, Who is that crying out to the king?
translation: En terwyl hy na die mense en Abner, die seun van Ner, roep, sê David, "Het julle nie 'n antwoord om te gee nie, Abner?" Toe sê Abner, "Wie is dit wat na die koning roep?"

original: And David said to Abner, Are you not a man of war? is there any other like you in Israel? why then have you not kept watch over your lord the king? for one of the people came in to put the king your lord to death.
translation: En David het vir Abner gesê: Is jy nie 'n man van oorlog nie? Is daar nie iemand anders soos jy in Israel nie? Hoekom het jy dan nie oor jou heer, die koning, opgekyk nie? Want een van die mense het ingekom om jou heer, die koning, dood te maak.

original: What you have done is not good. By the living Lord, death is the right fate for you, because you have not kept watch over your lord, the man on whom the Lord has put the holy oil. Now see, where is the king's spear, and the vessel of water which was by his head?
translation: Wat jy gedoen het, is nie goed nie. Deur die lewende Here, is die dood die regte straf vir jou, omdat jy nie oor jou baas opgelet het nie, die man op wie God die heilige olie gesit het. Kyk, waar is die koning se spies en die houer water wat by sy kop was?

original: And Saul, conscious that the voice was David's, said, Is that your voice, David, my son? And David said, It is my voice, O my lord king.
translation: En Saul, wat geweet het dit was David se stem, het gesê: Is dit jou stem, David, my seun? En David het gesê: Dit is my stem, O my koning.

original: And he said, Why does my lord go armed against his servant? what have I done? or what evil is there in me?
translation: Hy het gesê: "Waarom gaan my heer gewapen teen sy dienaar? Wat het ek gedoen? Of wat is verkeerd met my?"

original: And a third are to be stationed at the king's house; and a third at the doorway of the horses: while all the people are waiting in the open spaces round the house of the Lord.
translation: En 'n derde moet by die koning se huis gaan staan; en 'n derde by die deur van die perde, terwyl al die mense in die oop ruimtes rondom die huis van die Here wag.

original: But let no one come into the house of the Lord but only the priests and those of the Levites who have work to do there; they may go in for they are holy; but the rest of the people are to keep the orders of the Lord.
translation: Maar laat niemand in God se huis inkruip nie, sy net die priesters en die Leviete wat daar werk; hulle mag ingaan, want hulle is heilig; maar die ander mense moet aan God se opdragte voldoen.

original: And the Levites are to make a circle round the king, every man being armed; and any man who comes into the house is to be put to death; you are to keep with the king when he comes in and when he goes out.
translation: Die Leviete moet 'n sirkel om die koning maak, elke man moet gewapen wees; enige man wat die huis binnekom, moet doodgemaak word; julle moet by die koning bly wanneer hy inkom en wanneer hy uitgaan.

original: So the Levites and all Judah did as Jehoiada the priest had given them orders: every one took with him his men, those who were to come in and those who were to go out on the Sabbath; for Jehoiada had not sent away the divisions.
translation: Die Leviete en al Juda het gedoen soos wat die priester Jehoiada vir hulle gesê het: elkeen het sy mense saamgeneem, dié wat op die Saterdag moes inkom en dié wat moes uitgaan; want Jehoiada het nie die groepies weggestuur nie.

original: Then Jehoiada the priest gave to the captains of hundreds the spears and body-covers which had been King David's and which were kept in the house of God.
translation: Toe het die priester Jehojada aan die leiers van die honderde die spiese en beskermings gegee wat van King David af was en in God se huis gehou is.

original: And he put all the people in position, every man with his instruments of war in his hand, from the right side of the house to the left, by the altar and the house and all round the king.
translation: En hy het al die mense in plek gebring, elke man met sy wapens in sy hand, van die regterkant van die huis tot die linkerkant, by die altaar en die huis, reg rondom die koning.

original: Then they made the king's son come out, and they put the crown on his head and gave him the arm-bands and made him king: and Jehoiada and his sons put the holy oil on him and said, Long life to the king.
translation: Toe het hulle die koning se seun laat uitkom, en hulle het die kroon op sy kop gesit en vir hom die armbande gegee en hom koning gemaak: en Jehoiada en sy seuns het die heilige olie op hom gesit en gesê, Lang lewe die koning.

original: Now Athaliah, hearing the noise of the people running and praising the king, came to the people in the house of the Lord:
translation: Toe het Athaliah, toe sy die geraas hoor van die mense wat hardloop en die koning prys, na die mense in God se huis gegaan.

original: And looking, she saw the king in his place by the pillar at the doorway, and the captains and the horns by his side; and all the people of the land were giving signs of joy and sounding the horns; and the makers of melody were playing on instruments of music, taking the chief part in the song of praise. Then Athaliah, violently parting her robes, said, Broken faith, broken faith!
translation: Toe sy kyk, sien sy die koning op sy plek by die pilaar by die deur, en die leiers van die leër en die trompetspelers aan sy kant; en die hele volk van die land was bly en het die trompette geblaas; en die musiekspelers het op instrumente gespeel en hulle het die hoofdeel van die loflied gesing. Toe het Athaliah, wat haar klere met geweld geskeur het, gesê: 'Verbroken geloof, verbroken geloof!'

original: Then Jehoiada the priest gave orders to the captains of hundreds who had authority over the army, saying, Take her outside the lines, and let anyone who goes after her be put to death with the sword. For the priest said, Let her not be put to death in the house of the Lord.
translation: Toe het die priester Jehojada opdragte gegee aan die leiers van honderde wat oor die soldate was, en het gesê, "Neem haar buite die grense, en laat enigeen wat haar agtervolg, met die swaard doodgemaak word. Want die priester het gesê, "Laat haar nie in die huis van die Here doodgemaak word."

original: So they put their hands on her, and she went to the king's house by the doorway of the king's horses; and there she was put to death.
translation: Hulle het hande op haar gelê en sy het na die koning se huis gegaan deur die deur van die koning se perde; en daar is sy doodgemaak.

original: And Jehoiada made an agreement between the Lord and all the people and the king, that they would be the Lord's people.
translation: En Jehoiada het 'n ooreenkoms gemaakt tussen die Here, al die mense en die koning, dat hulle God se mense sal wees.

original: Then all the people went to the house of Baal and had it pulled down, and its altars and images broken up; and Mattan, the priest of Baal, they put to death before the altars.
translation: Toe het al die mense na Baal se huis gegaan en dit afgebreek, en sy altare en beelde gebroke; en hulle het Mattan, die priester van Baal, voor die altare doodgemaak.

original: And Jehoiada put the work and the care of the house of the Lord into the hands of the priests and the Levites, who had been grouped in divisions by David to make burned offerings to the Lord, as it is recorded in the law of Moses, with joy and song as David had said.
translation: En Jehoiada het die werk en sorg van God se huis in die hande van die priesters en die Leviete gegee, wat in groepe deur Dawid saamgestel is om brandoffers aan die Here te bied, soos dit in Moses se wet geskryf staan, met vreugde en sang, soos wat Dawid gesê het.

original: And he put door-keepers at the doors of the Lord's house, to see that no one who was unclean in any way might come in.
translation: En hy het wagters by die deure van God se huis gesit om te kyk dat niemand wat op enige manier nie skoon is, binne mag kom nie.

original: Then he took the captains of hundreds and the chiefs and the rulers of the people and all the people of the land, and they came down with the king from the house of the Lord through the higher doorway into the king's house, and put the king on the seat of the kingdom.
translation: Toe het hy die leiers van honderd en die hoofde van die mense, en al die mense van die land, saam met die koning van God se huis af gekom deur die hoër deur in die koning se huis, en die koning het op die sitplek van die koninkryk gesit.

original: So all the people of the land were glad and the town was quiet, for they had put Athaliah to death with the sword.
translation: So al die mense van die land was vrolik en die dorp was rustig, want hulle het Athaliah met die swaard doodgemaak.

original: Joash was seven years old when he became king, and he was ruling for forty years in Jerusalem: his mother's name was Zibiah of Beer-sheba.
translation: Joash was sewe jaar oud toe hy koning geword het, en hy het veertig jaar in Jerusalem geregeer: sy ma se naam was Zibiah van Beer-sheba.

original: And Joash did what was right in the eyes of the Lord as long as Jehoiada the priest was living.
translation: En Joash het gedoen wat reg was in God se oë solank Jehoiada, die priester, nog gelewe het.

original: And Jehoiada took two wives for him, and he became the father of sons and daughters.
translation: En Jehoiada het vir hom twee vrouens geneem, en hy het pa van seuns en dogters geword.

original: Now after this Joash had a desire to put the house of the Lord into good order again;
translation: Toe het Joash graag gewil dat God se huis weer in orde gebring moet word.

original: And getting together the priests and Levites, he said to them, Go out into the towns of Judah year by year, and get from all Israel money to keep the house of your God in good condition; and see that this is done without loss of time. The Levites, however, were slow in doing so.
translation: En toe hy die priesters en Leviete bymekaar gebring het, het hy vir hulle gesê: Gaan jaar na jaar in die dorpe van Juda uit, en kry geld van heel Israel om die huis van julle God in 'n goeie toestand te hou; en sorg dat dit gou gedoen word. Die Leviete was egter stadig om dit te doen.

original: Then the king sent for Jehoiada, the chief priest, and said to him, Why have you not given the Levites orders that the tax fixed by Moses, the servant of the Lord, and by the meeting of Israel, for the Tent of witness, is to be got in from Judah and Jerusalem and handed over?
translation: Toe het die koning vir Jehoiada, die hoëpriester, gestuur en vir hom gesê: Waarom het jy nie vir die Leviete gesê dat hulle die belasting wat Moses, God se dienaar, gemaak het, van Juda en Jerusalem moet insamel en aan die Tent van die getuienis moet gee nie?

original: For the house of the Lord had been broken up by Athaliah, that evil woman, and her sons; and all its holy things they had given to the Baals.
translation: Die huis van die Here is deur die slegte vrou Athaliah en haar seuns afgebreek, en hulle het al die heilige goed aan die Baäls gegee.

original: So at the king's order they made a chest and put it outside the doorway of the house of the Lord.
translation: Toe die koning gesê het, het hulle 'n kis gemaak en dit buite die deur van God se huis gesit.

original: And an order was sent out through all Judah and Jerusalem that payment was to be made to the Lord of the tax which Moses, the servant of God, had put on Israel in the waste land.
translation: Daar was 'n bevel wat deur heel Juda en Jerusalem gestuur is dat daar betaling gemaak moes word aan die Here vir die belasting wat Moses, God se dienaar, op Israel in die woestyn gestel het.

original: And all the chiefs and all the people came gladly and put their money into the chest, till they had all given.
translation: En al die leiers en al die mense het bly bymekaargekom en hul geld in die boks gesit, totdat hulle almal gegee het.

original: So when the chest was taken to the king's servants by the Levites, and they saw that there was much money in it, the king's scribe and the chief priest's servant took the money out, and put the chest back in its place. They did this day by day, and got together a great amount of money.
translation: Toe die Leviete die boksie na die koning se dienaars gebring het en hulle gesien het daar is baie geld daarin, het die koning se skrywer en die hoëpriester se dienaar die geld uitgehaal en die boksie weer op sy plek gesit. Hulle het dit elke dag gedoen en 'n groot hoeveelheid geld bymekaar gemaak.

original: Then the king and Jehoiada gave it to those who were responsible for getting the work done on the Lord's house, and with it they got wall-builders and woodworkers and metal-workers to put the house of the Lord in good order again.
translation: Toe het die koning en Jehoiada dit aan die mense gegee wat verantwoordelik was vir die werk aan God se huis, en so het hulle muurmakers, houtwerkers en metaalwerkers gekry om God se huis weer reg te maak.

original: So the workmen did their work, making good what was damaged and building up the house of God till it was strong and beautiful again.
translation: Die werkers het hul werk gedoen, hulle het reggemaak wat beskadig was en God se huis weer opgebou until dit sterk en mooi geword het.

original: And when the work was done, they took the rest of the money to the king and Jehoiada, and it was used for making the vessels for the house of the Lord, all the vessels needed for the offerings, the spoons and the vessels of gold and silver. And as long as Jehoiada was living, the regular burned offerings were offered in the house of the Lord.
translation: Toe hulle klaar was met die werk, het hulle die oorblywende geld na die koning en Jehoiada geneem. Dit is gebruik om goed te maak vir God se huis, alles wat nodig was vir die offerings, soos die lepels en die voorwerpe van goud en silwer. Solank Jehoiada gelewe het, het hulle gereeld gebrande offers in God se huis gebring.

original: But Jehoiada became old and full of days, and he came to his end; he was a hundred and thirty years old at the time of his death.
translation: Maar Jehoiada het oud geword en 'n vol lewe gehad, en toe het sy tyd gekom; hy was honderd en dertig jaar oud toe hy gesterf het.

original: And they put him into his last resting-place in the town of David, among the kings, because he had done good in Israel for God and for his house.
translation: Hulle het hom in sy laaste rusplek in die dorp van Dawid gesit, tussen die konings, want hy het goed gedoen in Israel vir God en sy familie.

original: Now after the death of Jehoiada, the chiefs of Judah came and went down on their faces before the king. Then the king gave ear to them.
translation: Nou, nadat Jehojada gesterf het, het die leiers van Juda gekom en voor die koning neergeval. Toe het die koning na hulle geluister.

original: And they gave up the house of the Lord God of their fathers, and became worshippers of pillars of wood and of the images; and because of this sin of theirs, wrath came on Judah and Jerusalem.
translation: Hulle het God se huis van hul vaders opgegee en het begin om pille van hout en beelde aan te bid; en omdat hulle dit gedoen het, het woede oor Juda en Jerusalem gekom.

original: And the Lord sent them prophets to make them come back to him; and they gave witness against them, but they would not give ear.
translation: En die Here het profete na hulle gestuur om hulle terug na Hom te bring; maar hulle het nie geluister nie.

original: Then the spirit of God came on Zechariah, the son of Jehoiada the priest, and, getting up before the people, he said to them, God has said, Why do you go against the orders of the Lord, so that everything goes badly for you? because you have given up the Lord, he has given you up.
translation: Toe het die Gees van God op Sagaria, die seun van Jehojada, die priester, gekom, en hy het voor die mense gestaan en vir hulle gesê: God sê, Hoekom gaan julle teen God se opdragte, sodat dit sleg met julle gaan? Omdat julle die Here losgelate het, het Hy ook julle verlaat.

original: But when they had made a secret design against him, he was stoned with stones, by the king's order, in the outer square of the Lord's house.
translation: Maar toe hulle 'n geheime plan teen hom gemaak het, is hy met klippe doodgestenig, op die koning se bevel, in die buiteplek van God se huis.

original: So King Joash did not keep in mind how good Jehoiada his father had been to him, but put his son to death. And in the hour of his death he said, May the Lord see it and take payment!
translation: Koning Joash het nie onthou hoe goed Jehoiada sy pa vir hom was nie, maar hy het sy seun doodgemaak. Toe hy doodgaan, het hy gesê: 'Mag die Here dit sien en regmaak!'

original: Now in the spring, the army of the Aramaeans came up against him; they came against Judah and Jerusalem, putting to death all the great men of the people and sending all the goods they took from them to the king of Damascus.
