translation: Nou in die lente het die Arameerse leër teen hom gekom. Hulle het Juda en Jerusalem aangeval, al die belangrike mense van die volk doodgemaak, en al die goed wat hulle van hulle geneem het, na die koning van Damaskus gestuur.

original: For though the army of Aram was only a small one, the Lord gave a very great army into their hands, because they had given up the Lord, the God of their fathers. So they put into effect the punishment of Joash.
translation: Al was die leër van Aram net klein, het die Here 'n baie groot leër in hulle hande gegee, omdat hulle die Here, hulle pa se God, verlaat het. So het hulle die straf van Joash begin uitvoer.

original: And when they had gone away from him, (for he was broken with disease,) his servants made a secret design against him because of the blood of the son of Jehoiada the priest, and they put him to death on his bed; and they put his body into the earth in the town of David, but not in the resting-place of the kings.
translation: Toe hulle van hom weggegaan het, omdat hy baie siek was, het sy mense 'n geheime plan teen hom gemaak oor die bloed van die seun van die priester Jehoiada. Hulle het hom op sy bed doodgemaak en sy liggaam in die grond in die stad van David begrawe, maar nie in die plek waar die konings begrawe word nie.

original: Those who made designs against him were Zabad, the son of Shimeath, an Ammonite woman, and Jehozabad, the son of Shimrith, a Moabite woman.
translation: Die mense wat teen hom beplan het, was Zabad, die seun van Shimeath, 'n Ammoniet vrou, en Jehozabad, die seun van Shimrith, 'n Moabiet vrou.

original: Now the story of his sons, and all the words said by the prophet against him, and the building up again of the Lord's house, are recorded in the account in the book of the kings. And Amaziah his son became king in his place.
translation: Nou die verhaal van sy seuns, en al die woorde wat die profeet teen hom gesê het, en die herbou van God se huis, is in die boek van die konings opgeteken. En sy seun Amazia het in sy plek koning geword.

original: Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for twenty-nine years; his mother's name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.
translation: Amaziah was vyf-en-twintig jaar oud toe hy koning geword het, en hy het nege-en-twintig jaar in Jerusalem regeer; sy ma se naam was Jehoaddan van Jerusalem.

original: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, but his heart was not completely true to the Lord.
translation: Hy het gedoen wat reg was in God se oë, maar sy hart was nie heeltemal opreg teenoor God nie.

original: Now when he became strong in the kingdom, he put to death those men who had taken the life of the king his father.
translation: Toe hy sterk geword het in die koninkryk, het hy die mense doodgemaak wat sy pa, die koning, se lewe geneem het.

original: But he did not put their children to death, for he kept the orders of the Lord recorded in the book of the law of Moses, saying, The fathers are not to be put to death for their children or the children for their fathers, but a man is to be put to death for the sin which he himself has done.
translation: Maar hy het nie hulle kinders doodgemaak nie, want hy het die opdragte van die Here gehou soos dit in die wetboek van Moses geskryf is, wat sê: Die vaders mag nie vir hulle kinders doodgemaak word nie, en die kinders nie vir hulle vaders nie, maar 'n man moet doodgemaak word vir die sonde wat hy self gedoen het.

original: Then Amaziah got all Judah together and put them in order by their families, even all Judah and Benjamin, under captains of thousands and captains of hundreds: and he had those of twenty years old and over numbered, and they came to three hundred thousand of the best fighting-men, trained for war and in the use of the spear and the body-cover.
translation: Toe het Amaziah al Juda bymekaar gekry en hulle volgens gesinne georden, al Juda en Benjamin, onder leiers van duisende en leiers van honderde. Hy het die wat twintig jaar en ouer was getel, en hulle was drie honderd duisend van die beste vegters, opgelei vir oorlog en bekend met die spies en skild.

original: And for a hundred talents of silver, he got a hundred thousand fighting-men from Israel.
translation: En vir 'n honderd talent silwer het hy honderd duisend soldate uit Israel gekry.

original: But a man of God came to him, saying, O king, let not the army of Israel go with you; for the Lord is not with Israel, that is, the children of Ephraim.
translation: Maar 'n man van God het na hom gekom en gesê: O koning, laat nie die Israelitiese leër saam met jou gaan nie; want die Here is nie met Israel nie, dis die kinders van Efraim.

original: But go yourself, and be strong in war; God will not let you go down before those who are fighting against you; for God has power to give help or to send you down before your attackers.
translation: Maar gaan jy self en wees dapper in die oorlog; God sal nie toelaat dat jy voor dié wat teen jou veg, val nie; want God het die krag om jou te help of jou neer te laat voor jou aanvallers.

original: Then Amaziah said to the man of God, But what is to be done about the hundred talents which I have given for the armed band of Israel? And the man of God in answer said, God is able to give you much more than this.
translation: Toe het Amazia met die man van God gepraat en gesê: Maar wat moet ek doen van die honderd talent wat ek gegee het vir die gewapende span van Israel? En die man van God het geantwoord: God kan jou baie meer gee as dit.

original: So Amaziah, separating the armed band which had come to him from Ephraim, sent them back again; which made them very angry with Judah, and they went back burning with wrath.
translation: So Amaziah het die gewapende groep wat van Efraim na hom gekom het, afsonderlik gemaak en hulle teruggestuur. Dit het hulle baie kwaad gemaak vir Juda, en hulle is in woede teruggegaan.

original: Then Amaziah took heart, and went out at the head of his people and came to the Valley of Salt, where he put to death ten thousand of the children of Seir;
translation: Toe het Amazia moed ingesep, en hy het voor sy mense uitgegaan en na die Soutvallei gegaan, waar hy tienduisend van die Seir mense doodgemaak het.

original: And ten thousand more the children of Israel took living, and made them go up to the top of the rock, pushing them down from the top of the rock so that their bodies were broken by the fall.
translation: En nog tienduisend het die kinders van Israel lewendig geneem en hulle na die bokant van die rots gevat, en hulle van die bokant van die rots af gestoot, sodat hulle liggame gebroke is van die val.

original: But the men of the band which Amaziah sent back and did not take with him to the fight, made attacks on the towns of Judah from Samaria to Beth-horon, putting to death three thousand of their people and taking away a great store of their goods.
translation: Maar die mense van die groep wat Amazía teruggestuur het en nie saam met hom na die geveg gegaan het nie, het dorpe in Juda van Samaria tot Bet-horon aangeval. Hulle het drie duisend van die mense doodgemaak en 'n groot hoeveelheid van hulle goedere weg geneem.

original: Now when Amaziah came back from the destruction of the Edomites, he took the gods of the children of Seir and made them his gods, worshipping them and burning offerings before them.
translation: Toe Amaziah teruggekom het van die vernietiging van die Edomiete, het hy die gode van die Seir mense geneem en hulle sy gode gemaak. Hy het voor hulle gebuig en offers vir hulle gebrand.

original: And so the wrath of the Lord was moved against Amaziah, and he sent a prophet to him, who said, Why have you gone after the gods of the people who have not given their people salvation from your hands?
translation: Die Here was kwaad vir Amazia, en Hy het 'n profeet na hom gestuur wat gesê het: Hoekom volg jy die gode van die mense wat nie vir hulle mense gehelp het om uit jou hande te kom nie?

original: But while he was talking to him the king said to him, Have we made you one of the king's government? say no more, or it will be the cause of your death. Then the prophet gave up protesting, and said, It is clear to me that God's purpose is your destruction, because you have done this and have not given ear to my words.
translation:
Maar terwyl hy met hom gepraat het, het die koning vir hom gesê: “Het ons jou een van die koning se regering gemaak? Moet nie meer sê nie, anders gaan dit jou doodmaak.” 

Toe het die profeet opgehou om te praat en gesê: “Ek kan duidelik sien dat God se plan jou ondergang is, omdat jy dit gedoen het en nie na my woorde geluister het nie.”

original: Then Amaziah, king of Judah, acting on the suggestion of his servants, sent to Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, Come, let us have a meeting face to face.
translation: Toe het Amazia, die koning van Juda, op sy dienaars se voorstel, Joash gestuur, die seun van Jehoahaz, die seun van Jehu, die koning van Israel, en gesê: Kom, kom ons ontmoet mekaar.

original: And Joash, king of Israel, sent to Amaziah, king of Judah, saying, The thorn-tree in Lebanon sent to the cedar in Lebanon, saying, Give your daughter to my son for a wife: and a beast from the woodland in Lebanon went by, crushing the thorn under his feet.
translation: En Joash, die koning van Israel, het vir Amaziah, die koning van Juda, gesê: "Die kardoesboom in Libanon het vir die sedertree in Libanon gesê: Gee jou dogter aan my seun as 'n vrou." En toe loop 'n dier uit die bos in Libanon verby en vergruis die kardoes onder sy voete.

original: You say, See, I have overcome Edom; and your heart is lifted up with pride: now keep in your country; why do you make causes of trouble, putting yourself, and Judah with you, in danger of downfall?
translation: Jy sê, kyk, ek het Edom oorwin; en jy is weer so trots: bly nou maar in jou land; hoekom maak jy moeilikheid en sit jouself en Juda in gevaar om te val?

original: But Amaziah gave no attention; and this was the purpose of God, so that he might give them up into the hands of Joash, because they had gone after the gods of Edom.
translation: Maar Amaziah het nie gelet nie; en dit was God se plan, sodat Hy hulle in die hande van Joash kon oorgee, want hulle het na die gode van Edom gegaan.

original: And so Joash, king of Israel, went up; and he and Amaziah, king of Judah, came face to face at Beth-shemesh in Judah.
translation: En so het Joash, die koning van Israel, daarheen gegaan; en hy en Amaziah, die koning van Juda, het mekaar ontmoet by Beth-shemesh in Juda.

original: And Judah was overcome before Israel, and they went in flight, every man to his tent.
translation: En Juda is oorwin deur Israel, en hulle het gevlug, elke man na sy tent.

original: And Joash, king of Israel, made Amaziah, king of Judah, the son of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, prisoner at Beth-shemesh, and took him to Jerusalem; and he had the wall of Jerusalem pulled down from the doorway of Ephraim to the doorway in the angle, four hundred cubits.
translation: En Joash, die koning van Israel, het Amaziah, die koning van Juda, die seun van Joash, die seun van Jehoahaz, gevangen geneem by Beth-shemesh en hom na Jerusalem geneem; en hy het die muur van Jerusalem afgebreek van die deur van Efraim tot by die deur in die hoek, vier honderd el.

original: And he took all the gold and silver and all the vessels which were in the house of the Lord, under the care of Obed-edom, and all the wealth from the king's house, as well as those whose lives would be the price of broken faith, and went back to Samaria.
translation: Hy het al die goud en silwer en al die goed wat in God se huis was, onder Obed-edom se sorg, asook al die rykdom van die koning se huis, en die mense wie se lewens die prys van gebroke vertroue sou wees, geneem en teruggegaan na Samaria.

original: Amaziah, son of Joash, king of Judah, went on living for fifteen years after the death of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, king of Israel.
translation: Amaziah, die seun van Joash, koning van Juda, het vyftien jaar langer geleef nadat Joash, die seun van Jehoahaz, koning van Israel, gesterf het.

original: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, first and last, are they not recorded in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel?
translation: Nou is die res van Amaziah se dade, van die begin tot die einde, nie in die boek van die konings van Juda en Israel opgeskryf nie?

original: Now from the time when Amaziah gave up worshipping the Lord, they made secret designs against him in Jerusalem; and he went in flight to Lachish: but they sent to Lachish after him and put him to death there.
translation: Toe Amaziah opgehou het om die Here te aanbid, het hulle geheime planne teen hom in Jerusalem gemaak; hy het na Lachish gevlug, maar hulle het hom daar na gegaan en hom doodgemaak.

original: And they took his body on horseback and put it into the earth with his fathers in the town of David.
translation: Hulle het sy liggaam op 'n perd geneem en dit in die grond saam met sy vaders in die stad van David begrawe.

original: Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah.
translation: Toe het al die mense van Juda Uzziah geneem, wat sestien jaar oud was, en hom koning gemaak in plaas van sy pa Amaziah.

original: He was the builder of Eloth, which he got back for Judah after the death of the king.
translation: Hy was die ou wat Eloth gebou het en dit weer vir Juda teruggekry het nadat die koning nie meer gelewe het nie.

original: Uzziah was sixteen years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for fifty-two years; his mother's name was Jechiliah of Jerusalem.
translation: Uzziah was sestien jaar oud toe hy koning geword het, en hy het twee-en-vyftig jaar in Jerusalem regeer; sy ma se naam was Jechiliah van Jerusalem.

original: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father Amaziah had done.
translation: Hy het gemaak wat reg was in God se oë, net soos sy pa Amazia gedoen het.

original: He gave himself to searching after God in the days of Zechariah, who made men wise in the fear of God; and as long as he was true to the Lord, God made things go well for him.
translation: Hy het homself gegee om God te soek in die dae van Sagaria, wat mense gewys het hoe om God te respekteer; en solank hy getrou aan die Here was, het God dit goed met hom laat gaan.

original: He went out and made war against the Philistines, pulling down the walls of Gath and Jabneh and Ashdod, and building towns in the country round Ashdod and among the Philistines.
translation: Hy het uitgegaan en oorlog gemaak teen die Filistyne, die mure van Gath, Jabneh en Ashdod afgebreek, en dorpe gebou in die gebied rondom Ashdod en onder die Filistyne.

original: And God gave him help against the Philistines, and against the Arabians living in Gur-baal, and against the Meunim.
translation: En God het vir hom help gegee teen die Filistyne, teen die Arabiërs wat in Gur-baal bly, en teen die Meunim.

original: The Ammonites gave offerings to Uzziah: and news of him went out as far as the limit of Egypt; for he became very great in power.
translation: Die Ammoniete het offers aan Uzziah gegee, en nuus van hom het tot by die grens van Egipte gegaan, want hy het baie kragtig geword.

original: Uzziah made towers in Jerusalem, at the doorway in the angle and at the doorway in the valley and at the turn of the wall, arming them.
translation: Uzziah het torings in Jerusalem gebou, by die deure in die hoek, en by die deure in die vallei, en by die draai van die muur, en het hulle gewapen.

original: And he put up towers in the waste land and made places for storing water, for he had much cattle, in the low hills and in the table land; and he had farmers and vine-keepers in the mountains and in the fertile land, for he was a lover of farming.
translation: Hy het torings in die woestyn gebou en plekke gemaak om water te stoor, want hy het baie vee gehad, in die lae heuwels en in die vlaktes; en hy het boere en oppassers van wingerde in die berge en in die vrugbare grond gehad, want hy was lief vir boerdery.

original: In addition, Uzziah had an army of fighting-men who went out to war in bands, as they had been listed by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the ruler, under the authority of Hananiah, one of the king's captains.
translation: Daarby het Uzzia 'n leër van soldate gehad wat in groepe oorlog toe gegaan het, soos wat Jeiel die skrywer en Maaseiah die leier dit opgeteken het, onder die gesag van Hananiah, een van die koning se kapteins.

original: The heads of families, the strong men of war, were two thousand, six hundred.
translation: Die hoofde van families, die sterk mans van oorlog, was twee duisend seshonderd.

original: And under their orders was a trained army of three hundred and seven thousand, five hundred, of great strength in war, helping the king against any who came against him.
translation: Onder hulle bevel was 'n getrainde leër van 307 500 soldate, wat baie sterk in die oorlog was en die koning gehelp het teen enigiemand wat hom teëkom.

original: And Uzziah had all these forces armed with body-covers and spears and head-covers and coats of metal and bows and stones for sending from leather bands.
translation: En Uzziah het al hierdie soldate gewapen met liggamebedekkings, spiesse, helms, metaaljasse, boë en klippe om met leerbande te gooi.

original: And in Jerusalem he made machines, the invention of expert men, to be placed on the towers and angles of the walls for sending arrows and great stones. And his name was honoured far and wide; for he was greatly helped till he was strong.
translation: En in Jerusalem het hy masjiene gemaak, wat vakmanne uitgevind het, om op die torings en hoeke van die mure te sit om pyle en groot klippe te stuur. En sy naam was oral geëer; want hy is baie gehelp totdat hy sterk was.

original: But when he had become strong, his heart was lifted up in pride, causing his destruction; and he did evil against the Lord his God; for he went into the Temple of the Lord for the purpose of burning perfumes on the altar of perfumes.
translation: Maar toe hy sterker geword het, het hy baie trots geword, wat sy ondergang veroorsaak het; en hy het slegte dinge teen God, sy Here, gedoen; want hy het in God se tempel gegaan om doeke op die altaar te brand.

original: And Azariah the priest went in after him, with eighty of the Lord's priests, who were strong men;
translation: En die priester Azariah het agterna gegaan met tagtig van God se priesters, wat sterk mans was.

original: And they made protests to Uzziah the king, and said to him, The burning of perfumes, Uzziah, is not your business but that of the priests, the sons of Aaron, who have been made holy for this work: go out of the holy place, for you have done wrong, and it will not be to your honour before God.
translation: Hulle het teen koning Uzziah geprotesteer en vir hom gesê: "Die brand van geure is nie jou saak nie, dit is die priesters, die seuns van Aaron, wat vir hierdie werk heilig gemaak is. Gaan uit die heilige plek uit, want jy het verkeerd gedoen. Dit sal nie tot jou eer voor God wees nie."

original: Then Uzziah was angry; and he had in his hand a vessel for burning perfume; and while his wrath was bitter against the priests, the mark of the leper's disease came out on his brow, before the eyes of the priests in the house of the Lord by the altar of perfumes.
translation: Toe was Uzziah kwaad; hy het 'n houer vir geurige olie in sy hand gehad. Terwyl hy bitter boos teen die priesters was, het die teken van melaatsheid op sy voorkop verskyn, voor die priester se oë in die Here se huis by die altaar van geurige olie.

original: And Azariah, the chief priest, and all the priests, looking at him, saw the mark of the leper on his brow, and they sent him out quickly and he himself went out straight away, for the Lord's punishment had come on him.
translation: En Azariah, die hoofpriester, en al die priesters, wat na hom kyk, het die teken van die melaatse op sy voorkop gesien. Hulle het hom vinnig gestuur en hy het onmiddellik gegaan, want God se straf het op hom gekom.

original: So King Uzziah was a leper till the day of his death, living separately in his private house; for he was cut off from the house of God; and Jotham his son was ruling over his house, judging the people of the land.
translation: Koning Uzzia was 'n melaatse tot sy dood en het in sy eie huis gewoon, want hy kon nie by die huis van God wees nie. Jotam, sy seun, het oor sy huis geregeer en die mense van die land geoordeel.

original: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, were recorded by Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.
translation: Nou is die oorblywende dade van Uzzia, van die begin tot die einde, opgeskryf deur die profeet Jesaja, die seun van Amoz.

original: So Uzziah went to rest with his fathers; and they put his body into the earth in the field used for the resting-place of the kings, for they said, He is a leper: and Jotham his son became king in his place.
translation: So Uzziah het gaan rus by sy voorvaders; hulle het sy liggaam in die grond neergelê in die veld wat as die graf van die konings gebruik word, want hulle het gesê hy is 'n melaatse; en sy seun Jotham het in sy plek koning geword.

original: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he became king; and he was ruling in Jerusalem for sixteen years; and his mother's name was Jerushah, the daughter of Zadok.
translation: Jotham was vyf-en-twintig jaar oud toe hy koning geword het; en hy het sestien jaar in Jerusalem geregeer; en sy ma se naam was Jerushah, die dogter van Zadok.

original: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father Uzziah had done; but he did not go into the Temple of the Lord. And the people still went on in their evil ways.
translation: Hy het gedoen wat reg was in God se oë, net soos sy pa Uzzia gedoen het; maar hy het nie na God se Tempel gegaan nie. En die mense het steeds in hulle slegte paaie aangehou.

original: He put up the higher doorway of the house of the Lord, and did much building on the wall of the Ophel.
translation: Hy het die hoër deur van God se huis opgesit en baie gebou aan die muur van Ophel.

original: In addition, he made towns in the hill-country of Judah, and strong buildings and towers in the woodlands.
translation: Hy het ook dorpe in die heuwels van Juda gebou, en sterk geboue en torings in die woude.

original: He went to war with the king of the children of Ammon and overcame them. That year, the children of Ammon gave him a hundred talents of silver, and ten thousand measures of grain and ten thousand measures of barley. And the children of Ammon gave him the same amount the second year and the third.
translation: Hy het oorlog gevoer met die koning van die Ammoniete en hulle oorwin. Daardie jaar het die Ammoniete vir hom honderd talent silwer gegee, sowel as tienduisend maat graan en tienduisend maat gars. En die Ammoniete het hom dieselfde hoeveelheid in die tweede en derde jaar gegee.

original: So Jotham became strong, because in all his ways he made the Lord his guide.
translation: So het Jotham sterker geword, omdat hy in alles wat hy gedoen het, die Here as sy gids gehad het.

original: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all his wars and his ways, are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
translation: Die ander dade van Jotam, al sy oorloë en wat hy gedoen het, is op skrif in die boek van die konings van Israel en Juda.

original: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for sixteen years.
translation: Hy was vyf-en-twintig jaar oud toe hy koning geword het, en hy het sestien jaar lank in Jerusalem geheers.

original: And Jotham went to rest with his fathers, and they put his body into the earth in the town of David; and Ahaz his son became king in his place.
translation: Jotham het gaan rus by sy voorvaders, en hulle het sy liggaam in die aarde in die stad van David gelê; sy seun Ahaz het in sy plek koning geword.

original: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for sixteen years; he did not do what was right in the eyes of the Lord, like David his father:
translation: Ahaz was twintig jaar oud toe hy koning geword het, en hy het vir sestien jaar in Jerusalem geheers; hy het nie gedoen wat reg was in God se oë nie, soos sy pa David.

original: But he went in the ways of the kings of Israel and made images of metal for the Baals.
translation: Maar hy het in die paaie van die konings van Israel gegaan en metaalbeelde vir die Baäls gemaak.

original: More than this, he had offerings burned in the valley of the son of Hinnom, and made his children go through fire, copying the disgusting ways of the nations whom the Lord had sent out of the land before the children of Israel.
translation: Hy het ook offers gebring wat in die Hinnom-vallei gebrand is en sy kinders deur die vuur laat gaan. Hy het die afschuwelike gewoontes van die nasies gevolg, waarvan die Here die mense voor die Israeliete uit die land gestuur het.

original: And he made offerings and had perfumes burned in the high places and on the hills and under every green tree.
translation: Hy het offers gebring en geurige olie op die hoë plekke gebrand, op die heuwels en onder elke groen boom.

original: So the Lord his God gave him up into the hands of the king of Aram; and they overcame him, and took away a great number of his people as prisoners to Damascus. Then he was given into the hands of the king of Israel, who sent great destruction on him.
translation: So het die Here, sy God, hom oorgegee aan die koning van Aram; en hulle het hom oorwin en 'n groot aantal van sy mense as gevangenes na Damaskus geneem. Toe is hy in die hande van die koning van Israel gegee, wat groot skade aan hom gedoen het.

original: For Pekah, the son of Remaliah, in one day put to death a hundred and twenty thousand men of Judah, all of them good fighting-men; because they had given up the Lord, the God of their fathers.
translation: Pekah, die seun van Remaliah, het op 'n dag honderdtwintig duisend mense van Juda doodgemaak, almal goeie vegters; omdat hulle die Here, die God van hulle vaders, in die steek gelaat het.

original: And Zichri, a great fighting-man of Ephraim, put to death Maaseiah, the king's son, and Azrikam, the controller of his house, and Elkanah, who was second in authority to the king.
translation: En Zichri, 'n groot vegter van Efraim, het Maaseiah, die seun van die koning, Azrikam, wat oor sy huis gegaan het, en Elkanah, wat tweede in bevel na die koning was, doodgemaak.

original: And the children of Israel took away as prisoners from their brothers, two hundred thousand, women and sons and daughters, and a great store of their goods, and took them to Samaria.
translation: Die kinders van Israel het tweehonderd duisend vroue, seuns en dogters van hulle broers as gevangenes weggeneem, saam met 'n groot hoeveelheid van hulle goedere, en hulle na Samaria geneem.

original: But a prophet of the Lord was there, named Oded; and he went out in front of the army which was coming into Samaria and said to them, Truly, because the Lord, the God of your fathers, was angry with Judah, he gave them up into your hands, and you have put them to death in an outburst of wrath stretching up to heaven.
translation: Maar daar was 'n profeet van die Here, met die naam Oded; en hy het voor die leër uit gegaan wat in Samaria inkom en vir hulle gesê, Kyk, omdat die Here, die God van julle voorouers, kwaad was vir Juda, het Hy hulle in julle hande gegee, en julle het hulle doodgemaak in 'n woede-uitbarsting wat tot in die hemel gestrek het.

original: And now your purpose is to keep the children of Judah and Jerusalem as men-servants and women-servants under your yoke: but are there no sins against the Lord your God to be seen among yourselves?
translation: En nou is julle doel om die kinders van Juda en Jerusalem as dienaars en dienskinners onder julle te hou. Maar is daar nie sondes teen julle God wat julle bymekaar kan sien nie?

original: And now give ear to me, and send back the prisoners whom you have taken from your brothers: for the wrath of the Lord is burning against you.
translation: Luister na my, en stuur die gevangenes terug wat julle van julle broers geneem het: want God se woede is teen julle.

original: Then certain of the heads of the children of Ephraim, Azariah, the son of Johanan, Berechiah, the son of Meshillemoth Jehizkiah, the son of Shallum, and Amasa the son of Hadlai, put themselves against those who had come from the war,
translation: Toe het sommige van die leiers van Efraim, Azariah, die seun van Johanan, Berechiah, die seun van Meshillemoth, Jehizkiah, die seun van Shallum, en Amasa, die seun van Hadlai, teen diegene wat van die oorlog af gekom het, gestaan.

original: And said to them, You are not to let these prisoners come here; for what you are designing to do will be a cause of sin against the Lord to us, making even greater our sin and our wrongdoing, which now are great enough, and his wrath is burning against Israel.
translation: En het vir hulle gesê, julle mag nie hierdie gevangenes hierheen laat kom nie; want wat julle beplan om te doen, sal ons sonde teen die Here groter maak, en ons foute, wat al groot genoeg is, maak sy woede teen Israel erger.

original: So the armed men gave up the prisoners and the goods they had taken to the heads and the meeting of the people.
translation: Die gewapende mense het die gevangenes en die goedere wat hulle geneem het aan die leiers en die mense se vergadering gegee.

original: And those men who have been named went up and took the prisoners, clothing those among them who were uncovered, with things from the goods which had been taken in the war, and putting robes on them and shoes on their feet; and they gave them food and drink and oil for their bodies, and seating all the feeble among them on asses, they took them to Jericho, the town of palm-trees, to their people, and then went back to Samaria.
translation: Die mense wat genoem is, het opgestaan en die gevangenes geneem. Hulle het die wat bloot was, aangeklee met goed wat in die oorlog gekry is, en klere en skoene aan hulle voete aangetrek. Hulle het ook vir hulle kos, drinkgoed en olie vir hulle liggame gegee, en al die swakkes onder hulle op donkies laat sit. Hulle het hulle na Jerigo, die stad van palm bome, geneem, na hulle mense toe, en toe weer teruggegaan na Samaria.

original: At that time King Ahaz sent for help to the king of Assyria.
translation: Toe het koning Ahaz vir hulp gevra by die koning van Assirië.

original: For the Edomites had come again, attacking Judah and taking away prisoners.
translation: Want die Edomiete het weer teruggekom, hulle het Juda aangeval en mense gevang.

original: And the Philistines, forcing their way into the towns of the lowlands and the south of Judah, had taken Beth-shemesh and Aijalon and Gederoth and Soco, with their daughter-towns, as well as Timnah and Gimzo and their daughter-towns, and were living there.
translation: En die Filistyne het hul pad gemaak in die dorpe van die laagliggende gebied en die suide van Juda. Hulle het Beth-shemesh, Aijalon, Gederoth en Soco geneem, saam met hulle dorpe, ook Timnah en Gimzo en hulle dorpe, en het daar gewoon.

original: For the Lord made Judah low, because of Ahaz, king of Israel; for he had given up all self-control in Judah, sinning greatly against the Lord.
translation: Die Here het Juda laag gemaak omdat Ahaz, die koning van Israël, sy selfbeheersing in Juda prysgegee het en groot sonde teen die Here gepleeg het.

original: Then Tiglath-pileser, king of Assyria, came to him, but was a cause of trouble and not of strength to him.
translation: Toe kom Tiglath-pileser, die koning van Assirië, na hom toe, maar hy het net probleme gebring en nie help nie.

original: For Ahaz took a part of the wealth from the house of the Lord, and from the house of the king and of the great men, and gave it to the king of Assyria; but it was no help to him.
translation: Want Ahaz het 'n stuk van die rykdom uit God se huis geneem, en ook uit die huis van die koning en die groot mense, en dit aan die koning van Assirië gegee; maar dit het nie vir hom gehelp nie.

original: And in the time of his trouble, this same King Ahaz did even more evil against the Lord.
translation: En in sy moeilike tyd het hierdie koning Ahaz selfs erger teen God gedoen.

original: For he made offerings to the gods of Damascus, who were attacking him, and said, Because the gods of the kings of Aram are giving them help, I will make offerings to them so that they may give me help. But they were the cause of his downfall, and of that of all Israel.
translation: Hy het offers gebring aan die gode van Damaskus wat hom aangeval het. Hy het gesê dat, omdat die gode van die konings van Aram hulle help, hy ook offers aan hulle gaan maak sodat hulle hom kan help. Maar hulle was die rede vir sy ondergang, en vir die hele Israel.

original: And Ahaz got together the vessels of the house of God, cutting up all the vessels of the house of God, and shutting the doors of the Lord's house; and he made altars in every part of Jerusalem.
translation: Ahas het al die dinge van God se huis bymekaargekry, al die dinge van God se huis vernietig, en die deure van God se huis toegemaak; hy het altare in elke plek van Jerusalem gemaak.

original: And in every town of Judah he made high places where perfumes were burned to other gods, awaking the wrath of the Lord, the God of his fathers.
translation: In elke dorpie van Juda het hy hoë plekke gebou waar hulle geure aan ander gode gebrand het, en dit het God se woede, die God van sy voorvaders, wakker gemaak.

original: Now the rest of his acts and all his ways, first and last, are recorded in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
translation: Nou is die res van wat hy gedoen het en al sy maniere, van die begin tot die einde, in die boek van die konings van Juda en Israel opgeteken.

original: And Ahaz went to rest with his fathers, and they put his body into the earth in Jerusalem; but they did not put him in the resting-place of the kings of Israel: and Hezekiah his son became king in his place.
translation: Ahaz het by sy vaders gaan rus, en hulle het sy liggaam in die grond in Jerusalem neergelê; maar hulle het hom nie in die graf van die konings van Israel gesit nie. Sy seun Hiskia het in sy plek koning geword.

original: Hezekiah became king when he was twenty-five years old; and he was king in Jerusalem for twenty-nine years; and his mother's name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.
translation: Hiskia het koning geword toe hy vyf-en-twintig jaar oud was. Hy was koning in Jerusalem vir nege-en-twintig jaar. Sy ma se naam was Abijah, die dogter van Sagaria.

original: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father David had done.
translation: Hy het gedoen wat reg was vir die Here, net soos sy pa Dawid.

original: In the first year of his rule, in the first month, opening the doors of the Lord's house, he made them strong.
translation: In die eerste jaar van sy heerskappy, in die eerste maand, het hy die deure van God se huis geopen en dit sterker gemaak.

original: And he sent for the priests and the Levites, and got them together in the wide place on the east side,
translation: Hy het die priesters en die Leviete laat kom en hulle bymekaar gemaak in die groot plek aan die ooskant.

original: And said to them, Give ear to me, O Levites: now make yourselves holy, and make holy the house of the Lord, the God of your fathers, and take away everything unclean from the holy place.
translation: En het vir hulle gesê, Luister na my, O Leviete: maak julle nou heilig, en maak die huis van die Here, die God van julle vaders, heilig, en verwyder alles wat onrein is uit die heilige plek.

original: May that man be like the towns overturned by the Lord without mercy: let a cry for help come to his ears in the morning, and the sound of war in the middle of the day;
translation: Mag daardie man wees soos die dorpe wat deur die Here omgekeer is, sonder genade: laat 'n hulp roep in sy ore kom in die oggend, en die geluid van oorlog gedurende die dag;

original: Because he did not put me to death before my birth took place: so my mother's body would have been my last resting-place, and she would have been with child for ever.
translation: Omdat hy my nie doodgemaak het voordat ek gebore is nie: dan sou my ma se liggaam my laaste plek van rus gewees het, en sy sou vir altyd swanger gewees het.

original: Why did I come from my mother's body to see pain and sorrow, so that my days might be wasted with shame?
translation: Waarom het ek uit my ma se liggaam gekom om pyn en hartseer te ervaar, sodat my dae vergeefs kan wees deur skaamte?

original: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur, the son of Malchiah, and Zephaniah, the son of Maaseiah the priest, saying,
translation: Die boodskap wat na Jeremia van die Here gekom het, toe koning Sedekia vir hom Pashhur, die seun van Malgajah, en Seraja, die seun van Maäseja die priester, gestuur het en gesê het,

original: Will you get directions from the Lord for us; for Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, is making war against us; it may be that the Lord will do something for us like all the wonders he has done, and make him go away from us.
translation: Sal jy vir ons vir die Here raad vra; want Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babel, is besig om oorlog teen ons te voer; dalk sal die Here iets vir ons doen soos al die wonderwerke wat Hy gedoen het, en maak dat hy ons los.

original: Then Jeremiah said to them, This is what you are to say to Zedekiah:
translation: Toe het Jeremia vir hulle gesê: Julle moet vir Sedekia sê:

original: The Lord God of Israel has said, See, I am turning back the instruments of war in your hands, with which you are fighting against the king of Babylon and the Chaldaeans, who are outside the walls and shutting you in; and I will get them together inside this town.
translation: Die Here God van Israel het gesê: Kyk, ek neem die wapens wat julle gebruik om teen die koning van Babel en die Chaldeërs te veg, wat buite die mure is en julle vastrap, terug; en ek sal hulle hier binne die stad bymekaarbring.

original: And I myself will be fighting against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even with angry feeling and passion and in great wrath.
translation: Ek gaan julle self teëstaan met 'n uitgestrekte hand en 'n sterk arm, met baie woede en hartstog en groot woede.

original: And I will send a great disease on the people living in this town, on man and on beast, causing their death.
translation: Ek sal 'n groot siekte na die mense in hierdie dorp stuur, wat die dood van mense en diere sal veroorsaak.

original: And after that, says the Lord, I will give up Zedekiah, king of Judah, and his servants and his people, even those in the town who have not come to their end from the disease and the sword and from need of food, into the hands of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, and into the hands of their haters, and into the hands of those desiring their death: he will put them to the sword; he will not let anyone get away, he will have no pity or mercy.
translation: En daarna, sê die Here, sal ek Zedekiah, die koning van Juda, en sy dienaars en sy mense, selfs dié in die dorp wat nie gesterf het van die siekte, die swaard, of honger nie, oorgee in die hande van Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babel, en in die hande van hulle wat hulle haat, en in die hande van dié wat hulle dood wil maak: hy sal hulle met die swaard doodmaak; hy sal niemand laat wegkom nie, hy sal nie genade of medelye hê nie.

original: And to this people you are to say, The Lord has said, See, I put before you the way of life and the way of death.
translation: En vir hierdie mense moet jy sê, die Here het gesê, Kyk, ek stel die pad van die lewe en die pad van die dood vir julle voor.

original: He who keeps in this town will come to his death by the sword and through need of food and through disease; but he who goes out and gives himself up to the Chaldaeans who are shutting you in, will go on living, and will keep his life safe.
translation: Hy wat in hierdie stad bly, sal deur die swaard sterf en honger en siekte ly; maar hy wat uitgaan en hom oorgee aan die Chaldeërs wat julle opsluit, sal voortleef en sy lewe veilig hou.

original: For my face is turned to this town for evil and not for good, says the Lord: it will be given into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will have it burned with fire.
translation: Want ek kyk na hierdie stad met slegte bedoelings en nie met goeie nie, sê die Here: dit sal in die hande van die koning van Babel gegee word, en hy sal dit met vuur laat verbrand.

original: About the family of the king of Judah. Give ear to the word of the Lord;
translation: Oor die familie van die koning van Juda. Luister na God se boodskap;

original: O family of David, this is what the Lord has said: Do what is right in the morning, and make free from the hands of the cruel one him whose goods have been violently taken away, or my wrath will go out like fire, burning so that no one may put it out, because of the evil of your doings.
translation: O familie van David, dit is wat die Here gesê het: Doen wat reg is in die oggend, en stel vry diegene wie se dinge met geweld afgeneem is uit die hande van die wrede, anders sal my woede soos 'n vuur uitbreek wat niemand kan blus nie, omdat julle kwaad gedoen het.

original: See, I am against you, you who are living on the rock of the valley, says the Lord; you who say, Who will come down against us? or who will get into our houses?
translation: Kyk, Ek is teen julle, julle wat op die rots van die vallei woon, sê die Here; julle wat sê, Wie sal teen ons kom? of wie sal in ons huise kom?

original: I will send punishment on you in keeping with the fruit of your doings, says the Lord: and I will put a fire in her woodlands, burning up everything round about her.
translation: Ek sal julle straf volgens wat julle gedoen het, sê die Here: en ek sal 'n vuur in haar woude aansteek wat alles om haar vernietig.

original: This is what the Lord has said: Go down to the house of the king of Judah and there give him this word,
translation: Dit is wat die Here gesê het: Gaan na die huis van die koning van Juda en sê vir hom hierdie boodskap.

original: And say, Give ear to the word of the Lord, O king of Judah, seated on the seat of David, you and your servants and your people who come in by these doors.
translation: En sê, Luister na God se boodskap, O koning van Juda, wat op Dawid se troon sit, jy en jou dienaars en jou mense wat deur hierdie deure inkom.

original: This is what the Lord has said: Do what is right, judging uprightly, and make free from the hands of the cruel one him whose goods have been violently taken away: do no wrong and be not violent to the man from a strange country and the child without a father and the widow, and let not those who have done no wrong be put to death in this place.
translation: Hier is wat die Here gesê het: Doen wat reg is, oordeel eerlik, en stel vry diegene wie se goed met geweld gesteel is uit die hande van die wrede. Moet nie kwaad doen nie en wees nie gewelddadig teen die man van 'n ander land, die kind sonder 'n pa, of die weduwee nie, en moenie toelaat dat diegene wat niks verkeerd gedoen het, in hierdie plek doodgemaak word nie.

original: For if you truly do this, then there will come in through the doors of this house kings seated on the seat of David, going in carriages and on horseback, he and his servants and his people
translation: As jy dit regtig doen, sal konings deur die deure van hierdie huis inkom, wat op Dawid se troon sit, en wat in waens en op perde ry, hy, sy helpers en sy mense.

original: But if you do not give ear to these words, I give you my oath by myself, says the Lord, that this house will become a waste.
translation: Maar as julle nie na hierdie woorde luister nie, maak ek vir julle 'n eed, sê die Here, dat hierdie huis 'n puinhoop sal wees.

original: For this is what the Lord has said about the family of the king of Judah: You are Gilead to me, and the top of Lebanon: but, truly, I will make you waste, with towns unpeopled.
translation: Want dit is wat die Here gesê het oor die familie van die koning van Juda: Jy is vir My soos Gilead en die hoogste punt van Libanon; maar, regtig, ek sal jou verwoes en dorpe sonder mense maak.

original: And I will make ready those who will send destruction on you, everyone armed for war: by them your best cedar-trees will be cut down and put in the fire.
translation: Ek sal mense gereedmaak wat verwoesting aan julle gaan bring, almal gewapend vir oorlog: deur hulle sal julle mooiste sederbome afgekap en in die vuur gegooi word.

original: And nations from all sides will go past this town, and every man will say to his neighbour, Why has the Lord done such things to this great town?
translation: En mense van oral sal verby hierdie dorp gaan, en elke man sal vir sy buurman sê, Hoekom het die Here sulke dinge aan hierdie groot dorp gedoen?

original: And they will say, Because they gave up the agreement of the Lord their God, and became worshippers and servants of other gods.
translation: Hulle sal sê dat hulle die ooreenkoms met God, hulle Here, opgegee het en dat hulle aanbidders en dienaars van ander gode geword het.

original: Let there be no weeping for the dead, and make no songs of grief for him: but make bitter weeping for him who has gone away, for he will never come back or see again the country of his birth.
translation: Moet nie vir die wat gesterf het huil nie, en maak nie treurliedere vir hom nie: maar huil hartseer vir die een wat weggegaan het, want hy sal nooit weer terugkom of sy geboorteland weer sien.

original: For this is what the Lord has said about Shallum, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who became king in place of Josiah his father, who went out from this place: He will never come back there again:
translation: Want dit is wat die Here gesê het oor Shallum, die seun van Josia, die koning van Juda, wat koning geword het in die plek van sy pa Josia, wat uit hierdie plek gegaan het: Hy sal nooit weer daarheen terugkom nie.

original: But death will come to him in the place where they have taken him away prisoner, and he will never see this land again.
translation: Maar die dood sal hom tref op die plek waar hulle hom as 'n gevangene weg geneem het, en hy sal hierdie land nooit weer sien nie.

original: A curse is on him who is building his house by wrongdoing, and his rooms by doing what is not right; who makes use of his neighbour without payment, and gives him nothing for his work;
translation: Hy is onder 'n vloek omdat hy sy huis op onregverdigheid bou en sy kamers nie reg is nie; hy gebruik sy buurman sonder om hom te betaal en gee hom niks vir sy werk nie.

original: Who says, I will make a wide house for myself, and rooms of great size, and has windows cut out, and has it roofed with cedar and painted with bright red.
translation: Wie sê, ek gaan 'n groot huis vir myself maak met groot kamers, vensters en 'n dak van sederhout wat helder rooi geverf is.

original: Are you to be a king because you make more use of cedar than your father? did not your father take food and drink and do right, judging in righteousness, and then it was well for him?
translation: Is jy 'n koning omdat jy meer sederbome gebruik as jou pa? Het jou pa nie kos en drink geneem en reg gedoen deur regverdig te oordeel nie? Toe het dit goed gegaan met hom.

original: He was judge in the cause of the poor and those in need; then it was well. Was not this to have knowledge of me? says the Lord.
translation: Hy het oor die arme mense en diegene in nood geoordeel; toe was dit reg. Was dit nie om my te verstaan nie? sê die Here.

original: But your eyes and your heart are fixed only on profit for yourself, on causing the death of him who has done no wrong, and on violent and cruel acts.
translation: Maar jou oë en jou hart kyk net na jou eie wins, om iemand wat niks verkeerd gedoen het, se dood te laat gebeur, en om gewelddadige en wrede dinge te doen.

original: So this is what the Lord has said about Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah: They will make no weeping for him, saying, Ah my brother! or, Ah sister! they will make no weeping for him, saying, Ah lord! or, Ah his glory!
translation: So dit is wat die Here gesê het oor Jehoiakim, die seun van Josia, die koning van Juda: Hulle gaan nie vir hom huil nie en sê, Ah my broer! of, Ah suster! Hulle gaan nie vir hom huil nie en sê, Ah meneer! of, Ah sy eer!

original: They will do to him what they do to the dead body of an ass; his body will be pulled out and placed on the earth outside the doors of Jerusalem.
translation: Hulle gaan met hom maak soos wat hulle met die dood liggaam van 'n donkie maak; sy liggaam gaan uitgehaal en op die grond buite die deure van Jerusalem neergesit word.

original: Go up to Lebanon and give a cry; let your voice be loud in Bashan, crying out from Abarim; for all your lovers have come to destruction
translation: Klim op na Libanon en skree; laat jou stem hard klink in Bashan, skree uit van Abarim; want al jou geliefdes is vernietig.

original: My word came to you in the time of your well-being; but you said, I will not give ear. This has been your way from your earliest years, you did not give attention to my voice.
translation: My woord het na jou gekom toe dit goed met jou gegaan het; maar jy het gesê, ek gaan nie luister nie. Dit was al van jou jong dae af so, jy het nie na my stem geluister nie.

original: All the keepers of your sheep will be food for the wind, and your lovers will be taken away prisoners: truly, then you will be shamed and unhonoured because of all your evil-doing.
translation: Al die mense wat jou skape oppas, sal soos kos vir die wind wees, en jou geliefdes sal as gevangenes weg geneem word: werklik, dan sal jy geskam en ongeërd wees oor al jou slegte dade.

original: O you who are living in Lebanon, making your living-place in the cedars, how greatly to be pitied will you be when pains come on you, as on a woman in childbirth!
translation: O julle wat in Libanon woon en julle huis tussen die sederbome bou, julle gaan baie sleg voel wanneer pyn julle oorval, soos 'n vrou wat geboorte gee!

original: By my life, says the Lord, even if Coniah, the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, was the ring on my right hand, even from there I would have you pulled off;
translation: Ek sê, sê God, al was Coniah, die seun van Jehoiakim, die koning van Juda, die ring aan my regterhand, ek sou jou nog daar verwerp.

original: And I will give you into the hands of those desiring your death, and into the hands of those whom you are fearing, even into the hands of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, and into the hands of the Chaldaeans.
translation: Ek sal jou oorgee aan die mense wat jou dood wil hê, en aan diegene wat jy bang is vir, selfs aan Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babilon, en aan die Chaldeërs.

original: I will send you out, and your mother who gave you birth, into another country not the land of your birth; and there death will come to you.
translation: Ek sal jou uitstuur, saam met jou ma wat jou gebring het, na 'n ander land wat nie jou geboorteland is nie; en daar sal die dood jou ontvang.

original: But to the land on which their soul's desire is fixed, they will never come back.
translation: Maar hulle sal nooit terugkom na die land waar hulle siel se begeerte is.

original: Is this man Coniah a broken vessel of no value? is he a vessel in which there is no pleasure? why are they violently sent out, he and his seed, into a land which is strange to them?
translation: Is hierdie man Coniah 'n gebroke vat sonder waarde? Is hy 'n vat waarin daar geen genot is nie? Hoekom stuur hulle hom en sy nageslag met geweld weg na 'n vreemde land?

original: O earth, earth, earth, give ear to the word of the Lord!
translation: O aarde, aarde, aarde, luister na die woorde van die Here!

original: The Lord has said, Let this man be recorded as having no children, a man who will not do well in all his life: for no man of his seed will do well, seated on the seat of the kingdom of David and ruling again in Judah.
translation: Die Here het gesê, Laat hierdie man as iemand sonder kinders neergeskryf word, 'n man wat in sy hele lewe nie goed sal doen nie: want niemand van sy nageslag sal goed doen nie, terwyl hy op die troon van die koninkryk van Dawid sit en weer in Juda regeer.

original: A curse is on the keepers who are causing the destruction and loss of the sheep of my field, says the Lord.
translation: Daar is 'n vloek op die mense wat die skape in my veld laat ineenstort en vergaan, sê die Here.

original: So this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said against the keepers who have the care of my people: You have let my flock be broken up, driving them away and not caring for them; see, I will send on you the punishment for the evil of your doings, says the Lord.
translation: So sê die Here, die God van Israel, teen die oppassers wat vir my volk sorg: Julle het my skape laat weggaan, hulle weggejaag en nie na hulle omgegee nie; kyk, ek sal julle straf vir die slegte dinge wat julle gedoen het, sê die Here.

original: And I will get the rest of my flock together from all the countries where I have sent them, and will make them come back again to their resting-place; and they will have offspring and be increased.
translation: Ek sal die res van my skape bymekaarmaak uit al die plekke waar ek hulle gestuur het, en hulle terugbring na hul rusplek; hulle sal jong skape hê en sal groei.

original: And I will put over them keepers who will take care of them: never again will they be overcome with fear or be troubled, and there will not be the loss of one of them, says the Lord.
translation: En Ek sal oor hulle oppas wat vir hulle sal sorg: nooit weer sal hulle oorweldig word deur vrees of probleme nie, en daar sal nie een van hulle verlore gaan nie, sê die Here.

original: See, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will give to David a true Branch, and he will be ruling as king, acting wisely, doing what is right, and judging uprightly in the land.
translation: Kyk, die dae kom, sê die Here, wanneer ek vir Dawid 'n ware tak sal gee, en hy sal as koning heers, verstandig optree, die regte dinge doen, en regverdig oordeel in die land.

original: In his days Judah will have salvation and Israel will be living without fear: and this is the name by which he will be named, The Lord is our righteousness.
translation: In sy tyd sal Juda gered word en Israel sal sonder vrees leef: en dit is die naam wat hy sal hê, Die Here is ons regverdigheid.

original: And so, truly, the days are coming when they will say no longer, By the living Lord, who took the children of Israel up out of the land of Egypt;
translation: Die dae kom werklik wanneer hulle nie meer sal sê nie, By die Lewende Here, wat die kinders van Israel uit Egipte uitgebring het.

original: But, By the living Lord, who took up the seed of Israel, and made them come out of the north country, and from all the countries where I had sent them; and they will be living in the land which is theirs.
translation: Maar, by die lewende Here, wat die nageslag van Israel opgeneem het en hulle uit die noorde gehaal het, en uit al die plekke waarheen ek hulle gestuur het; hulle sal woon in die land wat van hulle is.

original: About the prophets. My heart is broken in me, all my bones are shaking; I am like a man full of strong drink, like a man overcome by wine; because of the Lord, and because of his holy words.
translation: Oor die profete. My hart is gebroke, en my bene bewe; ek voel soos iemand wat te veel gedrink het, soos iemand wat nie meer kan klaar te kom met wyn nie; vanweë die Here, en sy heilige woorde.

original: For the land is full of men who are untrue to their wives; because of the curse the land is full of grief; the green fields of the waste land have become dry; and they are quick to do evil, their strength is for what is not right.
translation: Die land is vol mans wat nie by hul vroue bly nie. As gevolg van slegte dinge is die land vol hartseer. Die groen velde van die onvrugbare grond het droog geword. Hulle is vinnig om slegte dinge te doen; hulle gebruik hul krag vir wat nie reg is nie.

original: For the prophet as well as the priest is unclean; even in my house I have seen their evil-doing, says the Lord.
translation: Want die profeet en die priester is onrein; selfs in my huis het ek hulle slegte dade gesien, sê die Here.

original: For this cause their steps will be slipping on their way: they will be forced on into the dark and have a fall there: for I will send evil on them in the year of their punishment, says the Lord.
translation: Hulle se stappe gaan gly op hulle pad: hulle sal in die donker gedwing word en daar val: want Ek sal slegte dinge oor hulle stuur in die jaar van hulle straf, sê die Here.

original: And I have seen ways without sense in the prophets of Samaria; they became prophets of the Baal, causing my people Israel to go wrong.
translation: Ek het sinnelose paaie gesien by die profete van Samaria; hulle het profete van die Baal geword en my mense Israel verkeerd gelok.

original: And in the prophets of Jerusalem I have seen a shocking thing; they are untrue to their wives, walking in deceit, and they make strong the hands of evil-doers, so that a man may not be turned back from his evil-doing: they have all become like Sodom to me, and its people like Gomorrah.
translation: Ek het iets vreesliks in die profete van Jerusalem gesien; hulle is nie waaragtig teenoor hul vroue nie, hulle lewe in bedrog, en hulle steun die slegte mense, sodat 'n man nie kan wegbly van sy boosheid nie. Hulle het vir my soos Sodom geword, en hulle mense soos Gomorra.

original: So this is what the Lord of armies has said about the prophets: See, I will give them a bitter plant for their food, and bitter water for their drink: for from the prophets of Jerusalem unclean behaviour has gone out into all the land.
translation: So dit is wat die Here van die leërs oor die profete gesê het: Kyk, ek sal vir hulle 'n slegte plant vir hul kos gee en slegte water vir hul drink: want van die profete in Jerusalem het onwelgevallige gedrag oor die hele land versprei.

original: This is what the Lord of armies has said: Do not give ear to the words which the prophets say to you: they give you teaching of no value: it is from themselves that their vision comes, and not out of the mouth of the Lord.
translation: Dit is wat die Here van leërs gesê het: Moet nie na die woorde luister wat die profete vir julle sê nie; hulle leer julle dinge wat nie waardevol is nie: hulle se vision kom van hulself en nie uit die mond van die Here nie.

original: They keep on saying to those who have no respect for the word of the Lord, You will have peace; and to everyone who goes on his way in the pride of his heart, they say, No evil will come to you.
translation: Hulle hou aan om vir diegene wat nie respek het vir God se boodskap, te sê: 'Jy gaan vrede hê;' en vir almal wat in die trots van hulle harte hul pad loop, sê hulle: 'Geen kwaad sal jou oorkom.'

original: For which of them has knowledge of the secret of the Lord, and has seen him, and given ear to his word? which of them has taken note of his word and given attention to it?
translation: Wie van hulle het kennis van God se geheim, Hom gesien, en na Sy boodskap geluister? Wie van hulle het op Sy woorde gelet en daaroor aandag gegee?

original: See, the storm-wind of the Lord, even the heat of his wrath, has gone out, a rolling storm, bursting on the heads of the evil-doers.
translation: Kyk, die stormwind van die Here, die hitte van sy woede, kom aan, soos 'n tornado, wat op die slegte mense neerslaan.

original: The wrath of the Lord will not be turned back till he has done, till he has put into effect, the purposes of his heart: in days to come you will have full knowledge of this.
translation: Die woede van die Here sal nie teruggehou word voordat Hy dit gedoen het, voordat Hy sy doelwitte laat gebeur het nie: in die komende dae sal julle dit heeltemal verstaan.

original: I did not send these prophets, but they went running: I said nothing to them, but they gave out the prophet's word.
translation: Ek het nie hierdie profete gestuur nie, maar hulle het self gaan hardloop. Ek het niks vir hulle gesê nie, maar hulle het die profete se boodskap gegee.

original: But if they had been in my secret, then they would have made my people give ear to my words, turning them from their evil way, and from the evil of their doings.
translation: Maar as hulle my geheim geken het, sou hulle my mense laat luister na my woorde en hulle van hulle slegte pad en dade afgetrek het.

original: Am I only a God who is near, says the Lord, and not a God at a distance?
translation: Is ek net 'n God wat naby is, sê die Here, en nie 'n God wat ver weg is nie?

original: In what secret place may a man take cover without my seeing him? says the Lord. Is there any place in heaven or earth where I am not? says the Lord.
translation: Waar kan iemand hom wegsteek sodat ek hom nie kan sien nie? sê die Here. Is daar enige plek in die hemel of op aarde waar ek nie is nie? sê die Here.

original: My ears have been open to what the prophets have said, who say false words in my name, saying, I have had a dream, I have had a dream, I have had a dream,
translation: My ore was oop vir wat die profete gesê het, wat leuens in my naam vertel en sê, Ek het 'n droom gehad, Ek het 'n droom gehad, Ek het 'n droom gehad.

original: Is (my word) in the hearts of the prophets who give out false words, even the prophets of the deceit of their hearts?
translation: Is (my woord) in die harte van die profete wat leuens praat, selfs die profete van die bedrog van hulle harte?

original: Whose purpose is to take away the memory of my name from my people by their dreams, of which every man is talking to his neighbour, as their fathers gave up the memory of my name for the Baal.
translation: Wie se doel is om my mense se herinnering van my naam te vergeet deur hulle drome, waarvan elke man met sy buurman praat, soos wat hulle vaders die herinnering van my naam vir die Baal opgegee het.

original: If a prophet has a dream, let him give out his dream; and he who has my word, let him give out my word in good faith. What has the dry stem to do with the grain? says the Lord.
translation: As 'n profeet 'n droom het, moet hy dit deel; en hy wat my boodskap het, moet dit op 'n eerlike manier deel. Wat het die droë stingel met die graan te doen? sê die Here.

original: Is not my word like fire? says the Lord; and like a hammer, smashing the rock to bits?
translation: Is my woord nie soos vuur nie? vra die Here; en soos 'n hamer wat die klip in stukke breek?

original: For this cause I am against the prophets, says the Lord, who take my words, every one from his neighbour.
translation: Ek is teen die profete, sê die Here, wat my woorde neem van elkeen van sy buurman.

original: See, I am against the prophets, says the Lord, who let their tongues say, He has said.
translation: Kyk, ek is teen die profete, sê die Here, wat hul tale laat sê, Hy het gesê.

original: See, I am against the prophets of false dreams, says the Lord, who give them out and make my people go out of the way by their deceit and their uncontrolled words: but I did not send them or give them orders; and they will be of no profit to this people, says the Lord.
translation: Kyk, ek is teen die profete van vals drome, sê die Here, wat dit versprei en my mense laat afdwaal met hulle bedrog en onbeheersde woorde. Maar ek het hulle nie gestuur of vir hulle opdragte gegee nie; en hulle sal nie vir hierdie mense enige hulp bring nie, sê die Here.

original: And if this people, or the prophet, or a priest, questioning you, says, What word of weight is there from the Lord? then you are to say to them, You are the word, for I will not be troubled with you any more, says the Lord.
translation: As hierdie mense, of die profeet, of 'n priester jou vra en sê: Watter belangrike boodskap het God? dan moet jy vir hulle sê: Julle is die boodskap, want ek sal nie meer met julle te doen hê nie, sê God.

original: And as for the prophet and the priest and the people who say, A word of weight from the Lord! I will send punishment on that man and on his house.
translation: En wat die profeet, die priester en die mense sê: "‘n Belangrike boodskap van die Here!" Ek sal straf oor daardie man en sy huis stuur.

original: But this is what you are to say, every man to his neighbour and every man to his brother, What answer has the Lord given? and, What has the Lord said?
translation: Maar dit is wat julle moet sê, elkeen aan sy buurman en elkeen aan sy broer: Wat het die Here geantwoord? En, wat het die Here gesê?

original: And you will no longer put people in mind of the word of weight of the Lord: for every man's word will be a weight on himself; for the words of the living God, of the Lord of armies, our God, have been twisted by you.
translation: En julle sal nie meer mense herinner aan wat die Here op julle harte lê nie; want elkeen se woorde sal vir homself tel; want die woorde van die lewende God, die Here van die leërs, ons God, is deur julle verdraai.

original: This is what you are to say to the prophet, What answer has the Lord given to you? and, What has the Lord said?
translation: Dit is wat julle vir die profeet moet sê: Wat het die Here vir jou geantwoord? en, Wat het die Here gesê?

original: But if you say, The word of weight of the Lord; this is what the Lord has said: Because you say, The weight of the Lord, and I have sent to you, saying, You are not to say, The weight of the Lord;
translation: Maar as jy sê, God se boodskap; dit is wat God gesê het: Want jy sê, God se boodskap, en ek het na jou gestuur en gesê, jy moet nie sê, God se boodskap nie;

original: For this reason, truly, I will put you completely out of my memory, and I will put you, and the town which I gave to you and to your fathers, away from before my face:
translation: Om hierdie rede sal ek jou heeltemal uit my gedagtes laat verdwijn, en ek sal jou en die dorp wat ek aan jou en jou vaders gegee het, uit my gesig hou.

original: And I will give you a name without honour for ever, and unending shame which will never go from the memory of men.
translation: Ek sal vir julle 'n naam gee wat nooit eer sal ontvang nie, en 'n skande wat nooit uit mense se gedagtes sal verdwyn nie.

original: The Lord gave me a vision, and I saw two baskets full of figs put in front of the Temple of the Lord, after Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, had taken prisoner Jeconiah, the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the chiefs of Judah, and the expert workmen and metal-workers from Jerusalem, and had taken them to Babylon.
translation: Die Here het vir my ‘n visioen gegee, en ek het twee mandjies vol vye gesien wat voor die Tempel van die Here neergestel is, nadat Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babilon, Jeconiah, die seun van Jehoiakim, die koning van Juda, gevangene gemaak het, asook die leiers van Juda en die vakmanne en metaalwerkers uit Jerusalem, en hulle na Babilon geneem het.

original: One basket had very good figs, like the figs which first come to growth: and the other basket had very bad figs, so bad that they were of no use for food.
translation: Een mandjie het baie goeie vye gehad, soos die vye wat eerste groei. Die ander mandjie het baie slegte vye gehad, so sleg dat hulle nie gebruik kon word vir kos nie.

original: Then the Lord said to me, What do you see, Jeremiah? And I said, Figs; the good figs are very good, and the bad very bad, and of no use for food, they are so bad.
translation: Toe het die Here vir my gesê, wat sien jy, Jeremia? En ek het gesê, Vye; die goeie vye is baie goed, en die slegte vye is baie sleg, en is nie geskik vir kos nie, hulle is so sleg.

original: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
translation: En God se boodskap het na my gekom en gesê,

original: This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said: Like these good figs, so in my eyes will be the prisoners of Judah, whom I have sent from this place into the land of the Chaldaeans for their good.
translation: Dit is wat die Here, die God van Israel, gesê het: Soos hierdie goeie vye, so sal die gevangenes van Juda in my oë wees, wat ek uit hierdie plek in die Chaldeërs gestuur het om goed vir hulle te wees.

original: For I will keep my eyes on them for good, and I will take them back again to this land, building them up and not pulling them down, planting them and not uprooting them.
translation: Ek sal op hulle let vir die goeie, en ek sal hulle weer na hierdie land terugbring, ek sal hulle opbou en nie afbreek nie, ek sal hulle plant en nie uitruk nie.

original: And I will give them a heart to have knowledge of me, that I am the Lord: and they will be my people, and I will be their God: for they will come back to me with all their heart.
translation: Ek sal vir hulle 'n hart gee om my te verstaan, dat Ek die Here is: hulle sal my mense wees, en Ek sal hul God wees, omdat hulle met hul hele hart na my sal terugkom.

original: And like the bad figs which are so bad that they are of no use for food, so I will give up Zedekiah, king of Judah, and his chiefs and the rest of Jerusalem who are still in this land, and those who are in the land of Egypt:
translation: En soos die slegte vye wat so sleg is dat hulle nie eens vir kos nuttig is nie, sal ek Zedekiah, die koning van Juda, en sy leiers, en die res van Jerusalem wat nog in hierdie land is, en diegene wat in Egipte is, oorgee.

original: I will give them up to be a cause of fear and of trouble among all the kingdoms of the earth; to be a name of shame and common talk and a cutting word and a curse in all the places wherever I will send them wandering.
translation: Ek sal hulle oorgee sodat hulle 'n rede vir vrees en probleme sal wees onder al die koninkryke op aarde; hulle sal 'n naam van skaamte, 'n onderwerp van gesprek, 'n seergestelde woord en 'n vloek wees op al die plekke waar ek hulle laat rondwander.

original: And I will send the sword, and need of food, and disease, among them till they are all cut off from the land which I gave to them and to their fathers.
translation: Ek sal die swaard, gebrek aan kos, en siektes onder hulle stuur totdat hulle almal weg is van die grond wat Ek aan hulle en aan hulle vaders gegee het.

original: The word which came to Jeremiah about all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah king of Judah; this was the first year of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon.
translation: Die boodskap wat aan Jeremia gekom het oor al die mense van Juda in die vierde jaar van Jehoiakim, die seun van Josia, koning van Juda; dit was die eerste jaar van Nebukadnesar, koning van Babilon.

original: This word Jeremiah gave out to all the people of Judah and to those living in Jerusalem, saying,
translation: Hierdie boodskap het Jeremia aan al die mense van Juda en aan diegene wat in Jerusalem woon, gegee en gesê,

original: From the thirteenth year of Josiah, the son of Amon, king of Judah, even till this day, for twenty-three years, the word of the Lord has been coming to me, and I have given it to you, getting up early and talking to you; but you have not given ear.
translation: Van die dertiende jaar van Josia, die seun van Amon, die koning van Juda, tot vandag toe, al vir drie-en-twintig jaar, het God se boodskap na my toe gekom, en ek het dit aan julle gegee, ek het vroeg opgestaan en met julle gepraat; maar julle het nie geluister nie.

original: And the Lord has sent to you all his servants the prophets, getting up early and sending them; but you have not given attention and your ear has not been open to give hearing;
translation: Die Here het al sy dienaars, die profete, na julle gestuur. Hulle het vroeg opgestaan om julle te waarsku, maar julle het nie opgelet nie en julle het nie geluister nie.

original: Saying, Come back now, everyone from his evil way and from the evil of your doings, and keep your place in the land which the Lord has given to you and to your fathers, from times long past even for ever:
translation: Kom nou terug, julle almal, van julle slegte pad en van die kwaad wat julle doen. Hou julle plek in die land wat God aan julle en julle vaders gegee het, van baie lank gelede, selfs vir altyd.

original: Do not go after other gods to be their servants and to give them worship, and do not make me angry with the work of your hands, causing evil to yourselves.
translation: Moet nie ander gode volg om vir hulle te dien en hulle te aanbid nie, en maak my nie kwaad met die goed wat julle doen nie, wat sleg vir julle is.

original: But you have not given ear to me, says the Lord; so that you have made me angry with the work of your hands, causing evil to yourselves.
translation: Maar julle het nie na my geluister nie, sê die Here; julle het my kwaad gemaak met wat julle doen, en dit bring slegte dinge oor julle.

original: So this is what the Lord of armies has said: Because you have not given ear to my words,
translation: So dit is wat die Here van die leërs gesê het: Omdat julle nie na my woorde geluister het nie,

original: See, I will send and take all the families of the north, says the Lord, and Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, my servant, and make them come against this land, and against its people, and against all these nations on every side; and I will give them up to complete destruction, and make them a cause of fear and surprise and a waste place for ever.
translation: Kyk, ek sal al die families van die noorde stuur, sê die Here, en Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babilon, my dienaar, en hulle teen hierdie land laat kom, teen sy mense, en teen al hierdie nasies rondom; ek sal hulle oorgee aan totale vernietiging, en hulle sal 'n rede vir vrees en verbasing wees, en dit sal vir ewig 'n verwoeste plek wees.

original: And more than this, I will take from them the sound of laughing voices, the voice of joy, the voice of the newly-married man, and the voice of the bride, the sound of the stones crushing the grain, and the shining of lights.
translation: En meer as dit, sal ek van hulle die geluid van laggende stemme, die stem van vreugde, die stem van die pasgetroude man, en die stem van die bruid, die geluid van die klippe wat die graan maal, en die skyn van ligte neem.

original: All this land will be a waste and a cause of wonder; and these nations will be the servants of the king of Babylon for seventy years.
translation: Hierdie land sal 'n woesterny wees en mense sal wonder oor dit; en hierdie nasies sal vir sewentig jaar lank die dienaars van die koning van Babel wees.

original: And it will come about, after seventy years are ended, that I will send punishment on the king of Babylon, and on that nation, says the Lord, for their evil-doing, and on the land of the Chaldaeans; and I will make it a waste for ever.
translation: En dit gaan gebeur, nadat sewentig jaar verby is, dat Ek straf op die koning van Babilon en op daardie volk gaan stuur, sê die Here, vir hulle slegte dade, en op die land van die Chaldeërs; en Ek sal dit vir altyd verwoes.

original: And I will make that land undergo everything I have said against it, even everything recorded in this book, which Jeremiah the prophet has said against all the nations.
translation: Ek sal hierdie land laat deurmaak wat ek teen dit gesê het, alles wat in hierdie boek geskryf staan, wat Jeremia die profeet oor al die nasies gesê het.

original: For a number of nations and great kings will make servants of them, even of them: and I will give them the reward of their acts, even the reward of the work of their hands.
translation: Baie nasies en groot konings sal hulle as dienaars gebruik, en ek sal hulle beloon vir wat hulle doen, en ook vir die werk van hulle hande.

original: For this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said to me: Take the cup of the wine of this wrath from my hand, and make all the nations to whom I send you take of it.
translation: Want dit is wat die Here, God van Israel, vir my gesê het: Neem die beker met die wyn van hierdie woede uit my hand en laat al die nasies waarheen ek jou stuur, daarvan drink.

original: And after drinking it, they will go rolling from side to side, and be off their heads, because of the sword which I will send among them.
translation: En nadat hulle dit gedrink het, sal hulle van kant tot kant rol en nie reg wees nie, omdat Ek die swaard onder hulle sal stuur.

original: Then I took the cup from the Lord's hand, and gave a drink from it to all the nations to whom the Lord sent me;
translation: Toe het ek die beker uit God se hand geneem en 'n slukkie daarvan vir al die nasies gegee na wie God my gestuur het.

original: Jerusalem and the towns of Judah and their kings and their princes, to make them a waste place, a cause of fear and surprise and a curse, as it is this day;
translation: Jerusalem en die dorpe van Juda, saam met hulle konings en prinses, word 'n verlaten plek gemaak, 'n rede vir vrees en verbasing en 'n vloek, soos dit vandag is.

original: Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and his servants and his princes and all his people;
translation: Farao, die koning van Egipte, sy dienaars, prinses en al sy mense;

original: And all the mixed people and all the kings of the land of Uz, and all the kings of the land of the Philistines, and Ashkelon and Gaza and Ekron and the rest of Ashdod;
translation: En al die gemengde mense en al die konings van die land van Uz, en al die konings van die Filistyne, en Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron en die ander mense van Ashdod;

original: Edom and Moab and the children of Ammon,
translation: Edom en Moab en die kinders van Ammon.

original: And all the kings of Tyre, and all the kings of Zidon, and the kings of the lands across the sea;
translation: En al die konings van Tirus, en al die konings van Sidon, en die konings van die lande oor die see;

original: Dedan and Tema and Buz, and all who have the ends of their hair cut;
translation: Dedan en Tema en Buz, en almal wat die punte van hulle hare afgeknip het;

original: And all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mixed people living in the waste land;
translation: En al die konings van Arabië, en al die konings van die mense wat in die woestyn woon;

original: And all the kings of Zimri, and all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes;
translation: En al die konings van Zimri, en al die konings van Elam, en al die konings van die Medes;

original: And all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.
translation: En al die konings van die noorde, naby en ver, saam; en al die koninkryke van die wêreld op die aarde.

original: And you are to say to them, This is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: Take of this cup and be overcome, and let it come out again from your lips, and from your fall you will never be lifted up again, because of the sword which I will send among you.
translation: En jy moet vir hulle sê: Dit is wat die Here van die leërs, die God van Israel, gesê het: Neem hierdie beker en hou aan, en laat dit weer uit julle mond kom, en jy sal nooit weer opstaan nie, vanweë die swaard wat ek onder julle sal stuur.
