original: And it will be, if they will not take of the cup in your hand, then you are to say to them, This is what the Lord of armies has said: You will certainly take of it.
translation: En dit sal wees, as hulle nie die beker in jou hand wil neem nie, dan moet jy vir hulle sê, dit is wat die Here van die leërskare gesê het: Julle sal dit beslis neem.

original: For see, I am starting to send evil on the town which is named by my name, and are you to be without any punishment? You will not be without punishment: for I will send a sword on all people living on the earth, says the Lord of armies.
translation: Ek begin slegte dinge oor die stad wat my naam dra, en dink julle gaan daarmee wegkom? Julle sal nie ongestraf bly nie: want ek gaan 'n swaard stuur oor al die mense op aarde, sê die Here van die leërskare.

original: So, as a prophet, give out these words among them, and say to them, The voice of the Lord will be sounding like a lion from on high; he will send out his voice from his holy place, like the loud voice of a lion, against his flock; he will give a cry, like those who are crushing the grapes, against all the people of the earth.
translation: So, as 'n profeet, sê hierdie woorde vir hulle, en sê vir hulle, die stem van die Here sal klink soos 'n leeu van bo; Hy sal sy stem stuur vanaf sy heilige plek, soos die harde stem van 'n leeu, teen sy kudde; Hy sal 'n skree gee, soos dié wat die druiwe trap, teen al die mense van die aarde.

original: A noise will come, even to the end of the earth; for the Lord has a cause against the nations, he will give his decision against all flesh; as for the evil-doers, he will give them to the sword, says the Lord.
translation: Daar sal 'n geluid wees, selfs tot aan die einde van die aarde; want die Here het 'n probleem met die nasies; hy sal sy besluit teen alle mense neem; wat die kwaadwilliges betref, sal hy hulle aan die swaard oorhandig, sê die Here.

original: This is what the Lord of armies has said: See, evil is going out from nation to nation, and a great storm will come up from the inmost parts of the earth.
translation: Dit is wat die Here van die leërskare gesê het: Kyk, slegtheid gaan van nasie na nasie, en 'n groot storm sal uit die diepste plekke van die aarde kom.

original: And at that day, the bodies of those whom the Lord has put to death will be seen from one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth: there will be no weeping for them, their bodies will not be taken up or put to rest in the earth; they will be like waste on the face of the land.
translation: En op daardie dag sal die liggame van diegene wat die Here doodgemaak het, van een kant van die aarde tot die ander kant gesien word: daar sal geen trane oor hulle wees nie, hulle liggame sal nie opgeneem of in die grond begrawe word nie; hulle sal soos rommel op die aarde wees.

original: Give cries of grief, you keepers of sheep; give cries for help, rolling yourselves in the dust, you chiefs of the flock: for the days of your destruction have fully come, and I will send you in all directions, and your fall will be like that of the males of the flock.
translation: Huil van hartseer, julle skaapwagters; roep om hulp terwyl julle in die stof rol, julle leiers van die trop: want die dae van julle verwoesting het aangebreek, en ek sal julle in alle rigtings stuur, en julle val sal soos dié van die ramme van die trop wees.

original: There will be no way of flight for the keepers of sheep, no road for the chiefs of the flock to get away safely.
translation: Daar sal geen manier wees vir die skaapwagters om weg te kom nie, geen pad vir die leiers van die kudde om veilig te ontsnap nie.

original: A sound of the cry of the keepers of sheep, and the bitter crying of the chiefs of the flock! for the Lord has made waste their green fields.
translation: Die geskree van die skape se oppassers en die hartseergeluid van die leiers van die kudde! Want die Here het hulle groen weivelde verwoes.

original: And there is no sound in the fields of peace, because of the burning wrath of the Lord.
translation: En daar is niks wat klink in die vredevolle velde nie, omdat God se brandende woede daar is.

original: The lion has come out of his secret place, for the land has become a waste because of the cruel sword, and because of the heat of his wrath.
translation: Die leeu het uit sy skuilplek gekom, want die land het 'n woesteny geword weens die wrede swaard en die hitte van sy woede.

original: When Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, first became king, this word came from the Lord, saying,
translation: Toe Jehoiakim, die seun van Josia, die koning van Juda, vir die eerste keer koning geword het, het God hierdie woord gestuur en gesê,

original: Or which of you, if his son makes a request for bread, will give him a stone?
translation: Of watter een van julle, as sy seun vir brood vra, sal vir hom 'n klip gee?

original: Or if he makes a request for a fish, will give him a snake?
translation: Of as hy vir 'n vis vra, sal hy vir hom 'n slang gee?

original: If you, then, being evil, are able to give good things to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who make requests to him?
translation: As julle, wat sleg is, goeie dinge aan julle kinders kan gee, hoeveel meer sal julle Vader in die hemel goeie dinge aan diegene gee wat Hom om iets vra?

original: All those things, then, which you would have men do to you, even so do you to them: because this is the law and the prophets.
translation: Doen aan ander wat jy wil hê hulle moet aan jou doen, want dit is die wet en die profete.

original: Go in by the narrow door; for wide is the door and open is the way which goes to destruction, and great numbers go in by it.
translation: Gaan in deur die smal deur; want die deur is breed en die pad is oop wat na ondergang lei, en baie mense gaan daarin.

original: For narrow is the door and hard the road to life, and only a small number make discovery of it.
translation: Die deur is smal en die pad na die lewe is moeilik, en net 'n paar mense vind dit.

original: Be on the watch for false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but inside they are cruel wolves.
translation: Wees versigtig vir valse profete, wat soos skape lyk, maar binne-in is hulle gemene wolwe.

original: By their fruits you will get knowledge of them. Do men get grapes from thorns or figs from thistles?
translation: Aan hulle vrugte sal jy hulle ken. Kry mense druiwe uit dorings of vywe uit distels?

original: Even so, every good tree gives good fruit; but the bad tree gives evil fruit.
translation: So gee elke goeie boom goeie vrugte; maar die slegte boom gee slegte vrugte.

original: It is not possible for a good tree to give bad fruit, and a bad tree will not give good fruit.
translation: Dit is nie moontlik vir 'n goeie boom om slegte vrugte te gee nie, en 'n slegte boom kan nie goeie vrugte hê nie.

original: Every tree which does not give good fruit is cut down and put in the fire.
translation: Elke boom wat nie goeie vrugte gee nie, word afgekap en in die vuur gegooi.

original: So by their fruits you will get knowledge of them.
translation: Julle sal hulle leer ken deur hulle vrugte.

original: Not everyone who says to me, Lord, Lord, will go into the kingdom of heaven; but he who does the pleasure of my Father in heaven.
translation: Nie almal wat vir my sê: Here, Here, gaan in die koninkryk van die hemel ingaan nie; maar net die een wat doen wat my Vader in die hemel wil hê.

original: A great number will say to me on that day, Lord, Lord, were we not prophets in your name, and did we not by your name send out evil spirits, and by your name do works of power?
translation: Baie mense sal op daardie dag vir my sê: Here, Here, was ons nie profete in jou naam nie, en het ons nie bose geeste in jou naam uitgestuur nie, en het ons nie wonderwerke in jou naam gedoen nie?

original: And then will I say to them, I never had knowledge of you: go from me, you workers of evil.
translation: En dan sal ek vir hulle sê, ek het nooit van julle geweet nie: gaan weg van my, julle wat slegte dinge doen.

original: Everyone, then, to whom my words come and who does them, will be like a wise man who made his house on a rock;
translation: Almal wat my woorde hoor en dit ook doen, sal soos 'n wyse man wees wat sy huis op 'n rots gebou het.

original: And the rain came down and there was a rush of waters and the winds were driving against that house, but it was not moved; because it was based on the rock.
translation: En die reën het geval en daar was 'n stroom van water, en die winde het teen daardie huis geblaas, maar dit het nie beweeg nie; omdat dit op die rots gebou was.

original: And everyone to whom my words come and who does them not, will be like a foolish man who made his house on sand;
translation: En almal wat na my woorde luister en dit nie doen nie, sal soos 'n dom man wees wat sy huis op sand gebou het.

original: And the rain came down and there was a rush of waters and the winds were driving against that house; and it came down and great was its fall.
translation: En die reën het neergedaal en daar was 'n stroom van water, en die winde het teen daardie huis geblaas; en dit het ingekruk, en dit was 'n groot val.

original: And it came about, when Jesus had come to the end of these words, that the people were surprised at his teaching,
translation: Toe Jesus aan die einde van hierdie woorde gekom het, was die mense verbaas oor sy onderrig.

original: for he was teaching as one having authority, and not as their scribes.
translation: want hy het geleer soos iemand met werklike gesag, en nie soos hulle skrifgeleerders nie.

original: And when he had come down from the mountain, great numbers of people came after him.
translation: En toe hy van die berg af gekom het, het 'n groot aantal mense hom gevolg.

original: And a leper came and gave him worship, saying, Lord, if it is your pleasure, you have power to make me clean.
translation: 'N Melaatse het na Jesus gekom en hom aangebid, en gesê: "Here, as dit u wil is, kan U my skoonmaak."

original: And he put his hand on him, saying, It is my pleasure; be clean. And straight away he was made clean.
translation: Hy het sy hand op hom gesit en gesê: "Ek is bly; wees skoon." En sommer dadelik was hy skoon.

original: And Jesus said to him, See that you say nothing about this to anyone; but go and let the priest see you and make the offering which was ordered by Moses, for a witness to them.
translation: En Jesus sê vir hom, moenie vir iemand hiervan vertel nie; maar gaan en laat die priester jou sien en maak die offer wat Moses gesê het, as 'n getuienis vir hulle.

original: And when Jesus was come into Capernaum, a certain captain came to him with a request,
translation: Toe Jesus by Kapernaum aankom, kom daar 'n offisier na Hom met 'n versoek.

original: Saying, Lord, my servant is ill in bed at the house, with no power in his body, and in great pain.
translation:
Here is the final translation:

Here, my Heer, my dienaar is siek in die bed by die huis, hy het nie krag in sy liggaam nie, en hy ly baie.

original: And he said to him, I will come and make him well.
translation: Hy het vir hom gesê, ek gaan kom en hom gesond maak.

original: And the captain in answer said, Lord, I am not good enough for you to come under my roof; but only say the word, and my servant will be made well.
translation: Die hoofman het geantwoord en gesê, Here, ek is nie goed genoeg dat U onder my dak kom nie; maar sê net die woord, en my diener sal gesond wees.

original: Because I myself am a man under authority, having under me fighting men; and I say to this one, Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes; and to my servant, Do this, and he does it.
translation: Ek is 'n man onder gesag, met soldate onder my. Ek sê vir hierdie een: Gaan, en hy gaan. Ek sê vir 'n ander: Kom, en hy kom. Ek sê vir my dienskneg: Doen dit, en hy doen dit.

original: And when these words came to the ears of Jesus he was surprised, and said to those who came after him, Truly I say to you, I have not seen such great faith, no, not in Israel.
translation: En toe hierdie woorde by Jesus gekom het, was hy verbaas en het vir die mense wat hom gevolg het gesê: "Ek sê vir julle, ek het nie so 'n groot geloof gesien nie, nie eers in Israel nie."

original: And I say to you that numbers will come from the east and the west, and will take their seats with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven:
translation: Ek sê vir julle dat daar mense van die ooste en die weste gaan kom, en hulle gaan saam met Abraham, Isak en Jakob in die hemel se koninkryk sit.

original: But the sons of the kingdom will be put out into the dark, and there will be weeping and cries of pain.
translation: Maar die seuns van die koninkryk sal in die donker geplaas word, en daar sal gehuil en geroep word van pyn.

original: And Jesus said to the captain, Go in peace; as your faith is, so let it be done to you. And the servant was made well in that hour.

original: And when Jesus had come into Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother in bed, very ill.
translation: En toe Jesus by Petrus se huis aankom, het hy sy vrou se ma in die bed gesien, sy was baie siek.

original: And he put his hand on hers and the disease went from her, and she got up and took care of his needs.
translation: Hy het sy hand op haarne gegee en die siekte het van haar af gegaan, en sy het opgestaan en vir hom gesorg.

original: And in the evening, they took to him a number of people who had evil spirits; and he sent the spirits out of them with a word, and made well all who were ill;
translation: En in die aand het hulle 'n paar mense na hom gebring wat slegte geeste gehad het; en hy het die geeste met 'n woord uit hulle gestuur, en almal wat siek was, gesond gemaak.

original: So that the word of Isaiah the prophet might come true: He himself took our pains and our diseases.
translation: So dat die woorde van die profeet Jesaja waar kan word: Hy het ons pyn en siektes op Hom geneem.

original: Now when Jesus saw a great mass of people about him, he gave an order to go to the other side.
translation: Toe Jesus 'n groot groep mense om hom sien, het hy gesê hulle moet oorsteek na die ander kant.

original: And there came a scribe and said to him, Master, I will come after you wherever you go.
translation: En daar het 'n skrifgeleerde na Hom toe gekom en gesê: Meester, ek sal jou volg, waar jy ook al gaan.

original: And Jesus said to him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of heaven have a resting-place; but the Son of man has nowhere to put his head.
translation: En Jesus het vir hom gesê: Die jakkals het gate om in te gaan, en die voëls van die lug het 'n plek om te sit; maar die Seun van die mens het nêrens om sy kop neer te lê nie.

original: And another of the disciples said to him, Lord, let me first go and give the last honours to my father.
translation: En een van die dissipels het vir Hom gesê: "Here, laat my eers gaan om my pa se laaste eer te betoon."

original: But Jesus said to him, Come after me; and let the dead take care of their dead.
translation: Maar Jesus het vir hom gesê, kom na my toe; en laat die dooies om hul eie sorg.

original: And when he had got into a boat, his disciples went after him.
translation: En toe hy in 'n boot geklim het, het sy dissipels hom gevolg.

original: And there came up a great storm in the sea, so that the boat was covered with the waves: but he was sleeping.
translation: Daar het 'n groot storm op die see ontstaan, sodat die boot deur die golwe bedek was: maar hy het geslaap.

original: And they came to him, and, awaking him, said, Help, Lord; destruction is near.
translation: Hulle het na hom toe gegaan en hom wakker gemaak, en gesê: "Help, Here; die ondergang is naby."

original: And he said to them, Why are you full of fear, O you of little faith? Then he got up and gave orders to the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.
translation: En hy het vir hulle gesê, Hoekom is julle so bang, julle met 'n klein geloof? Toe het hy opgestaan en vir die winde en die see gesê om stil te wees; en dit het baie kalm geword.

original: And the men were full of wonder, saying, What sort of man is this, that even the winds and the sea do his orders?
translation: En die mense was verbysterd en het gesê: Wat vir 'n man is hierdie, wat selfs die winde en die see op sy bevel luister?

original: And when he had come to the other side, to the country of the Gadarenes, there came out to him from the place of the dead, two who had evil spirits, so violent that no man was able to go that way.
translation: En toe hy aan die ander kant gekom het, in die land van die Gadareners, het daar twee mense met slegte geeste uit die dood na hom toe gekom, so gewelddadig dat niemand daardie pad kon loop nie.

original: And they gave a loud cry, saying, What have we to do with you, you Son of God? Have you come here to give us punishment before the time?
translation: Hulle het hard geskree en gesê, Wat het ons met jou te doen, jy Seun van God? Het jy hierheen gekom om ons voordat dit tyd is te straf?

original: Now there was, some distance away, a great herd of pigs taking their food.
translation: Nou was daar, 'n entjie verder, 'n groot groep varke wat hulle kos geniet.

original: And the evil spirits made strong prayers to him, saying, If you send us out, let us go into the herd of pigs.
translation: Die bose geeste het vir hom sterk gebid en gesê: "As jy ons wegstuur, laat ons in die varke gaan."

original: And he said to them, Go. And they came out, and went into the pigs; and the herd went rushing down a sharp slope into the sea and came to their end in the water.
translation: Hy het vir hulle gesê, Gaan. En hulle het uitgekom en in die varke ingegaan; toe het die kudde af die steile helling in die see gelaai en in die water geëindig.

original: And their keepers went in flight to the town and gave an account of everything, and of the men who had the evil spirits.
translation: En hulle se oppassers het na die dorp gevlug en het alles vertel, insluitend van die mense met die slegte geeste.

original: And all the town came out to Jesus; and seeing him they made request that he would go away from their part of the country.
translation: En die hele dorp het na Jesus toe gekom; toe hulle hom gesien het, het hulle hom gevra om van hulle plek af te gaan.

original: And he got into a boat and went across and came to his town.
translation: Hy het in 'n boot geklim en oor die water gegaan en by sy dorp aangekom.

original: And they took to him a man stretched on a bed who had no power of moving; and Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the man who was ill, Son, take heart; you have forgiveness for your sins.
translation: Hulle het vir Jesus 'n man gebring wat op 'n bed gele het en nie kon beweeg nie. Toe Jesus hulle geloof sien, het Hy vir die siek man gesê: 'Seun, moenie ontsteld wees nie; jy het vergifnis vir jou sondes.'

original: And some of the scribes said among themselves, This man has no respect for God.
translation: En party van die skrifkenners het vir mekaar gesê, Hierdie man het nie respek vir God nie.

original: And Jesus, having knowledge of what was in their minds, said, Why are your thoughts evil?
translation: En Jesus, wat geweet het wat in hulle gedagtes was, het gesê: Hoekom is julle gedagtes so verkeerd?

original: For which is the simpler, to say, You have forgiveness for your sins; or to say, Get up and go?
translation: Wat is makliker om te sê: "Jy is vergewe van jou sondes"; of om te sê: "Staan op en gaan?"

original: But so that you may see that on earth the Son of man has authority for the forgiveness of sins, (then said he to the man who was ill,) Get up, and take up your bed, and go to your house.
translation: Maar sodat julle kan sien dat die Seun van die mens hier op aarde die mag het om sondes te vergewe, het Hy vir die man wat siek was gesê: Staan op, neem jou bed op en gaan huis toe.

original: And he got up and went away to his house.
translation: En hy het opgestaan en na sy huis gegaan.

original: But when the people saw it they were full of fear, and gave glory to God who had given such authority to men.
translation: Maar toe die mense dit gesien het, het hulle baie bang geword, en hulle het God se eer gegee, omdat Hy so 'n gesag aan mense gegee het.

original: And when Jesus was going from there, he saw a man whose name was Matthew, seated at the place where taxes were taken; and he said to him, Come after me. And he got up and went after him.
translation: En toe Jesus daar weggaan, sien hy 'n man met die naam Matteus wat sit waar hulle belasting insamel; en hy sê vir hom, “Kom volg my.” En hy het opgestaan en agter Hom gegaan.

original: And it came about, when he was in the house taking food, that a number of tax-farmers and sinners came and took their places with Jesus and his disciples.
translation: En toe dit gebeur het, was hy in die huis aan die eet, toe 'n paar belastingamptenare en sondaars gekom het en saam met Jesus en sy dissipels gaan sit het.

original: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples, Why does your Master take food with tax-farmers and sinners?
translation: Toe die Fariseërs dit gesien het, het hulle vir sy dissipels gesê: Hoekom eet julle Meester saam met belastingpligtige en sondaars?

original: But on hearing this he said, Those who are well have no need of a medical man, but those who are ill.
translation: Maar toe hy dit hoor, het hy gesê: Mense wat gesond is, het nie 'n dokter nodig nie, maar mense wat siek is.

original: But go and take to heart the sense of these words, My desire is for mercy, not offerings: for I have come not to get the upright, but sinners.
translation: Gaan en dink goed oor wat hierdie woorde beteken: Ek wil genade gee, nie offers nie; want Ek het nie gekom om die regverdiges te soek nie, maar sondaars.

original: Then the disciples of John came to him, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees frequently go without food, but your disciples do not?
translation: Die dissipels van Johannes het na hom toe gekom en gesê: Waarom gaan ons en die Fariseërs dikwels sonder kos, maar jou dissipels nie?

original: And Jesus said to them, Will the friends of the newly-married man be sad as long as he is with them? But the days will come when he will be taken away from them, and then will they go without food.
translation: En Jesus het vir hulle gesê: Sal die vriende van die pasgetroude man hartseer wees solank hy by hulle is? Maar daar sal dae kom wanneer hy van hulle weggeneem word, en dan sal hulle honger wees.

original: And no man puts a bit of new cloth on an old coat, for by pulling away from the old, it makes a worse hole.
translation: En niemand sit 'n stuk nuwe materiaal op 'n oujas nie, want as jy dit van die ou een af trek, maak dit 'n groter gat.

original: And men do not put new wine into old wine-skins; or the skins will be burst and the wine will come out, and the skins are of no more use: but they put new wine into new wine-skins, and so the two will be safe.
translation: Mense sit nie nuwe wyn in ou wynsakke nie, want die sakke sal bars en die wyn sal uitkom, en die sakke is nie meer nuttig nie. Maar hulle sit nuwe wyn in nuwe wynsakke, en dan is albei veilig.

original: While he was saying these things to them, there came a ruler and gave him worship, saying, My daughter is even now dead; but come and put your hand on her, and she will come back to life.
translation: Terwyl hy hierdie dinge vir hulle gesê het, het daar 'n leier gekom en hom vereer. Hy het gesê, my dogter is nou al dood; maar kom en sit jou hand op haar, dan sal sy weer lewe.

original: And Jesus got up and went after him, and so did his disciples.
translation: En Jesus het opgestaan en agter Hom aan gegaan, en sy dissipels het ook dieselfde gedoen.

original: And a woman, who for twelve years had had a flow of blood, came after him, and put her hand on the edge of his robe:
translation: En 'n vrou wat al twaalf jaar lank gebloei het, het van agter gekom en haar hand op die rand van sy rok gesit.

original: Because, she said to herself, if I may but put my hand on his robe, I will be made well.
translation: Want, het sy vir haarself gesê, as ek net my hand op sy rok kan sit, sal ek gesond wees.

original: But Jesus, turning and seeing her, said, Daughter, take heart; your faith has made you well. And the woman was made well from that hour.
translation: Maar Jesus, toe Hy haar sien, het gesê: Dogter, hou moed; jou geloof het jou gesond gemaak. En die vrou was vanaf daardie oomblik gesond.

original: And when Jesus came into the ruler's house and saw the players with their instruments and the people making a noise,
translation: En toe Jesus in die leier se huis kom, het hy die musiekkunstenaars met hul instrumente gesien en die mense wat lawaai maak.

original: He said, Make room; for the girl is not dead, but sleeping. And they were laughing at him.
translation: Hy het gesê, Maak plek; want die meisie is nie dood nie, sy slaap net. En hulle het vir hom gelag.

original: But when the people were sent out, he went in and took her by the hand; and the girl got up.
translation: Maar toe die mense wegwas, het hy ingegaan en haar hand gevat; en die meisie het opgestaan.

original: And the news of it went out into all that land.
translation: En die nuus daarvan het in hele land versprei.

original: And when Jesus went on from there, two blind men came after him, crying out, Have mercy on us, you Son of David.
translation: En toe Jesus van daar af verder gegaan het, het twee blindemanne agter hom gekom en uitgeroep: "Moet asseblief vir ons Lig genoeg, Seun van David."

original: And when he had come into the house, the blind men came to him; and Jesus said to them, Have you faith that I am able to do this? They said to him, Yes, Lord.
translation: Toe Hy in die huis ingegaan het, het die blindes na Hom toe gekom; en Jesus het vir hulle gesê, Glo julle dat Ek dit kan doen? Hulle het vir Hom gesê, Ja, Here.

original: Then he put his hand on their eyes, saying, As your faith is, let it be done to you.
translation: Toe sit hy sy hand op hulle oë en sê: "Soos julle geloof is, mag dit aan julle gebeur."

original: And their eyes were made open. And Jesus said to them sharply, Let no man have knowledge of it.
translation: Hulle oë is oopgemaak. En Jesus het vir hulle gesê: Moet dit vir niemand vertel nie.

original: But they went out and gave news of him in all that land.
translation: Maar hulle het uit gegaan en van hom in die hele land vertel.

original: And while they were going away, there came to him a man without the power of talking, and with an evil spirit.
translation: Terwyl hulle weggaan, het 'n man na hom toe gekom wat nie kon praat nie en 'n slegte gees gehad het.

original: And when the evil spirit had been sent out, the man had the power of talking: and they were all surprised, saying, Such a thing has never been seen in Israel.
translation: Toe die bose gees weggejaag is, het die man begin praat, en almal was verbaas en het gesê: So iets het nog nooit in Israel gebeur nie.

original: But the Pharisees said, By the ruler of evil spirits, he sends evil spirits out of men.
translation: Maar die Fariseërs het gesê, Hy stuur slegte geeste uit mense uit deur die heerser van slegte geeste.

original: And Jesus went about all the towns and small places, teaching in their Synagogues and preaching the good news of the kingdom and making well all sorts of disease and pain.
translation: En Jesus het in al die dorpe en klein plekke rondgegaan, hulle in die sinagoges geleer, die goeie nuus van die koninkryk verkondig, en al die verskillende siektes en pyn gesond gemaak.

original: But when he saw all the people he was moved with pity for them, because they were troubled and wandering like sheep without a keeper.
translation: Maar toe hy al die mense sien, het hy medelye met hulle gehad, omdat hulle ontsteld was en rondbeweeg het soos skape sonder 'n herder.

original: Then he said to his disciples, There is much grain but not enough men to get it in.
translation: Toe het hy vir sy dissipels gesê, daar is baie graan, maar nie genoeg mense om dit in te bring nie.

original: Make prayer, then, to the Lord of the grain-fields, that he may send out workers to get in his grain.
translation: Bid dan tot die Here van die graanvelde dat Hy werkers kan uitstuur om Sy graan in te bring.

original: And he got together his twelve disciples and gave them the power of driving out unclean spirits, and of making well all sorts of disease and pain.
translation: Hy het sy twaalf dissipels bymekaargemaak en vir hulle die krag gegee om slegte geeste uit te jaag en om verskillende siektes en pyn te genees.

original: Now the names of the twelve are these: The first, Simon, who is named Peter, and Andrew, his brother; James, the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother;
translation: Die name van die twaalf is soos volg: Die eerste is Simon, wat Petrus genoem word, en Andreas, sy broer; Jakobus, die seun van Sebedee, en Johannes, sy broer.

original: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew, the tax-farmer; James, the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;
translation: Filippus en Bartolomeus; Thomas en Matteus, die belastingman; Jakobus, die seun van Alfeus, en Taddeus;

original: Simon the Zealot, and Judas Iscariot, who was false to him.
translation: Simon die Ywerige, en Judas Iskariot, wat nie regverdig was nie.

original: These twelve Jesus sent out and gave them orders, saying, Do not go among the Gentiles, or into any town of Samaria,
translation: Jesus het hierdie twaalf gestuur en vir hulle gesê: Moet nie na die nie-Jode gaan nie, of na enige dorpie van Samaria nie.

original: But go to the wandering sheep of the house of Israel,
translation: Maar gaan na die afgedwaalde skape van die huis van Israel.

original: And, on your way, say, The kingdom of heaven is near.
translation: En, op jou pad, sê, God se koninkryk is naby.

original: Make well those who are ill, give life to the dead, make lepers clean, send evil spirits out of men; freely it has been given to you, freely give.
translation: Maak mense wat siek is gesond, gee lewe aan mense wat dood is, maak lewendes wat lewersiek is gesond, stuur slegte geeste uit mense uit; dit is gratis aan julle gegee, gee dit ook gratis.

original: Take no gold or silver or copper in your pockets;
translation: Neem geen goud, silwer of koper in jou sak nie;

original: Take no bag for your journey and do not take two coats or shoes or a stick: for the workman has a right to his food.
translation: Neem nie 'n tas vir jou reis nie, en neem nie twee jakke of skoene of 'n stok nie, want 'n werker het reg op sy kos.

original: And into whatever town or small place you go, make search there for someone who is respected, and make his house your resting-place till you go away.
translation: En waar jy ook al gaan, in enige dorp of klein plek, soek iemand wat gerespekteer word, en maak sy huis jou plek om te ontspan totdat jy vertrek.

original: And when you go in, say, May peace be on this house.
translation: En wanneer julle inkom, sê, Mag daar vrede in hierdie huis wees.

original: And if the house is good enough, let your peace come on it: but if not, let your peace come back to you.
translation: En as die huis goed genoeg is, laat jou vrede daar bly; maar as dit nie is nie, kom jou vrede terug na jou.

original: And whoever will not take you in, or give ear to your words, when you go out from that house or that town, put off its dust from your feet.
translation: En wie nie vir jou kom help nie, of nie na jou woorde luister nie, wanneer jy uit daardie huis of daardie dorp gaan, skud die stof van jou voete af.

original: Truly I say to you, It will be better for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of God's judging than for that town.
translation: Ek sê vir julle, dit sal beter wees vir Sodom en Gomorra op die dag van God se oordeel as vir daardie dorp.

original: See, I send you out as sheep among wolves. Be then as wise as snakes, and as gentle as doves.
translation: Kyk, ek stuur julle uit soos skape tussen wolwe. Wees dan so slim soos slange en so vriendelik soos duiwe.

original: But be on the watch against men: for they will give you up to the Sanhedrins, and in their Synagogues they will give you blows;
translation: Maar wees op julle hoede vir mense: hulle sal jou aan die Sanhedrin oorlewer, en in hul sinagoges sal hulle jou slaan.

original: And you will come before rulers and kings because of me, for a witness to them and to the Gentiles.
translation: En julle sal voor regeerders en konings kom oor my, as 'n getuienis vir hulle en vir die nie-Joodse mense.

original: But when you are given up into their hands, do not be troubled about what to say or how to say it: for in that hour what you are to say will be given to you;
translation: Maar wanneer julle in hulle hande gegee word, moenie julle bekommer oor wat julle moet sê of hoe om dit te sê nie: in daardie uur sal julle gegee word wat julle moet sê.

original: Because it is not you who say the words, but the Spirit of your Father in you.
translation: Want dit is nie julle wat die woorde sê nie, maar die Gees van julle Vader in julle.

original: And brother will give up brother to death, and the father his child: and children will go against their fathers and mothers, and put them to death.
translation: En 'n broer sal sy broer doodmaak, en 'n vader sy kind: en kinders sal teen hulle vaders en moeders gaan en hulle doodmaak.

original: And you will be hated by all men because of my name: but he who is strong to the end will have salvation.
translation: En julle sal deur almal gehaat word weens my naam: maar hy wat sterk is tot die einde, sal gered word.

original: But when they are cruel to you in one town, go in flight to another: for truly, I say to you, You will not have gone through the towns of Israel before the Son of man comes.
translation: Maar as hulle gemeen teenoor jou is in 'n dorp, hardloop na 'n ander; want regtig, ek sê vir julle, julle sal nie deur die dorpe van Israel gegaan het nie voordat die Mens se Seun kom.

original: A disciple is not greater than his master, or a servant than his lord.
translation: "'n Volgeling is nie groter as sy leier nie, of 'n helper as sy baas."

original: It is enough for the disciple that he may be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have given the name Beelzebub to the master of the house, how much more to those of his house!
translation: Dit is genoeg vir die volgeling dat hy soos sy meester kan wees, en die dienaar soos sy baas. As hulle die naam Beelzebul aan die baas van die huis gegee het, hoeveel te meer aan die mense van sy huis!

original: Have, then, no fear of them: because nothing is covered which will not come to light, or secret which will not be made clear.
translation: Wees dan nie bang vir hulle nie: niks is verborge wat nie aan die lig gaan kom nie, of geheim wat nie duidelik gemaak sal word nie.

original: What I say to you in the dark, say in the light: and what comes to your ear secretly, say publicly from the house-tops.
translation: Wat ek vir julle in die donker sê, moet julle in die lig sê: en wat stilletjies in julle ore kom, moet julle openlik van die dakke af vertel.

original: And have no fear of those who put to death the body, but are not able to put to death the soul. But have fear of him who has power to give soul and body to destruction in hell.
translation: Moet nie bang wees vir mense wat die liggaam kan doodmaak nie, maar nie die siel nie. Wees eerder bang vir Hom wat die krag het om siel en liggaam in die hel te vernietig.

original: Are not sparrows two a farthing? and not one of them comes to an end without your Father:
translation: Is daar nie twee mussen vir 'n kwart nie? En nie een van hulle raak verlore sonder jou Vader nie.

original: But the hairs of your head are all numbered.
translation: Maar God het al jou hare getel.

original: Then have no fear; you are of more value than a flock of sparrows.
translation: Moet dan nie bang wees nie; jy is meer waardevol as 'n skare voëltjies.

original: To everyone, then, who gives witness to me before men, I will give witness before my Father in heaven.
translation: Vir elkeen wat oor my getuig voor mense, sal ek ook voor my Vader in die hemel oor hulle getuig.

original: But if anyone says before men that he has no knowledge of me, I will say that I have no knowledge of him before my Father in heaven.
translation: Maar as iemand vir mense sê dat hy niks van My weet nie, sal ek ook sê dat ek niks van hom weet nie voor My Vader in die hemel.

original: Do not have the thought that I have come to send peace on the earth; I came not to send peace but a sword.
translation: Dink nie dat ek gekom het om vrede op die aarde te bring nie; ek het nie gekom om vrede te bring nie, maar 'n swaard.

original: For I have come to put a man against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law:
translation: Ek het gekom om 'n man teen sy pa te las, en 'n dogter teen haar ma, en 'n skoondogter teen haar skoonma aan te dui:

original: And a man will be hated by those of his house.
translation: En 'n man sal haat van die mense in sy huis ervaar.

original: He who has more love for his father or mother than for me is not good enough for me; he who has more love for son or daughter than for me is not good enough for me.
translation: Hy wat meer van sy pa of ma hou as van My, is nie goed genoeg vir My nie; hy wat meer van sy seun of dogter hou as van My, is nie goed genoeg vir My nie.

original: And he who does not take his cross and come after me is not good enough for me.
translation: En iemand wat nie sy kruis opneem en my volg nie, is nie genoeg vir my nie.

original: He who has the desire to keep his life will have it taken from him, and he who gives up his life because of me will have it given back to him.
translation: Wie sy lewe wil hou, sal dit verloor, maar wie sy lewe om my ontwil opgee, sal dit weer terugkry.

original: He who gives honour to you gives honour to me; and he who gives honour to me gives honour to him who sent me.
translation: Die persoon wat jou eer gee, gee ook vir my eer; en die persoon wat my eer gee, gee eer aan Hom wat my gestuur het.

original: He who gives honour to a prophet, in the name of a prophet, will be given a prophet's reward; and he who gives honour to an upright man, in the name of an upright man, will be given an upright man's reward.
translation: Hy wat eer aan 'n profeet gee, in die naam van 'n profeet, sal 'n profeet se beloning kry; en hy wat eer aan 'n regverdige man gee, in die naam van 'n regverdige man, sal 'n regverdige man se beloning kry.

original: And whoever gives to one of these little ones a cup of cold water only, in the name of a disciple, truly I say to you, he will not go without his reward.
translation: En almal wat een van hierdie klein ouens net 'n koppie koue water gee, in die naam van 'n volgeling, sê ek vir julle, hy gaan nie sonder sy beloning weg nie.

original: And it came about that when Jesus had come to the end of giving these orders to his twelve disciples, he went away from there, teaching and preaching in their towns.
translation: Toe Jesus klaar was om sy opdragte aan sy twaalf dissipels te gee, het hy daar weggegaan en in hulle dorpe geleer en gepreek.

original: Now when John had news in prison of the works of the Christ, he sent his disciples
translation: Toe Johannes in die tronke hoor van wat Jesus doen, het hy sy dissipels gestuur.

original: To say to him, Are you he who is to come, or are we waiting for another?
translation: Om vir hom te sê, Is jy die een wat moet kom, of wag ons vir iemand anders?

original: And Jesus, answering, said to them, Go and give news to John of the things which you are seeing and hearing:
translation: En Jesus sê vir hulle, Gaan en vertel vir Johannes van die goed wat julle sien en hoor:

original: The blind see; those who were not able to, are walking; lepers are made clean; those who were without hearing, now have their ears open; the dead come to life again, and the poor have the good news given to them.
translation: Die blindes sien; die wat nie kon, stap; melaatses word skoon gemaak; die wat nie kon hoor nie, het nou hulle ore oop; die dooies kom weer tot lewe, en die armes kry die goeie nuus.

original: And a blessing will be on him who has no doubts about me.
translation: En 'n seën sal op hom wees wat geen twyfel oor my het nie.

original: And when they were going away, Jesus, talking of John, said to all the people, What went you out into the waste land to see? a tall stem moving in the wind?
translation: Toe hulle weggaan, het Jesus, terwyl Hy van Johannes praat, vir die mense gesê: "Waarom het julle na die woestyn gegaan om te kyk? 'n Lang bietjie wat in die wind beweeg?"

original: But what went you out to see? a man delicately clothed? Those who have fair robes are in kings' houses.
translation: Maar wat het julle gaan kyk? 'n Man wat mooi aantrek? Die mense met mooi klere is in die koning se huis.

original: But why did you go out? to see a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.
translation: Maar hoekom het julle uitgegaan? Om 'n profeet te sien? Ja, ek sê vir julle, en meer as 'n profeet.

original: This is he of whom it has been said, See, I send my servant before your face, who will make ready your way before you.
translation: Dit is die een van wie daar gesê is: Kyk, ek stuur my dienaar voor jou, wat jou pad reg gaan maak.

original: Truly I say to you, Among the sons of women there has not been a greater than John the Baptist: but he who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
translation: Ek sê vir julle, onder almal wat gebore is uit vroue, was daar nog nooit iemand groter as Johannes die Doper nie, maar die een wat die kleinste in die koninkryk van die hemel is, is groter as hy.

original: And from the days of John the Baptist till now, the kingdom of heaven is forcing its way in, and men of force take it.
translation: En vanaf die dae van Johannes die Doper tot nou toe, breek die koninkryk van die hemel deur, en sterk mense neem dit.

original: For all the prophets and the law were in force till John.
translation: Want al die profete en die wet het gegeld tot by Johannes.

original: And if you are able to see it, this is Elijah who was to come.
translation: En as jy dit kan sien, is dit Elia wat gaan kom.

original: He who has ears, let him give ear.
translation: Hy wat oë het, moet luister.

original: But what comparison may I make of this generation? It is like children seated in the market-places, crying out to one another,
translation: Maar wat kan ek van hierdie geslag sê? Dit is soos kinders wat in die mark sit en vir mekaar skree.

original: We made music for you and you did not take part in the dance; we gave cries of sorrow and you made no signs of grief.
translation: Ons het musiek vir jou gemaak, maar jy het nie gedans nie; ons het in hartseer geroep, maar jy het nie jammer gevoel nie.

original: For John came, taking no food or drink, and they say, He has an evil spirit.
translation: Want Johannes het gekom, sonder om kos of drank te neem, en hulle sê hy het 'n slegte gees.

original: The Son of man has come feasting, and they say, See, a lover of food and wine, a friend of tax-farmers and sinners! And wisdom is judged to be right by her works.
translation: Die Seun van die mens het gekom om lekker te eet en te drink, en hulle sê, kyk, 'n persoon wat hou van kos en wyn, 'n vriend van belastinginsamelaars en sondige mense! En wysheid word regverdig deur wat sy doen.

original: Then he went on to say hard things to the towns where most of his works of power were done, because they had not been turned from their sins.
translation: Toe het hy begin om moeilike goed te sê vir die dorpe waar hy die meeste van sy wonderwerke gedoen het, omdat hulle nie van hulle sondes afgekom het nie.

original: Unhappy are you, Chorazin! Unhappy are you, Beth-saida! For if the works of power which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have been turned from their sins in days gone by, clothing themselves in haircloth and putting dust on their heads.
translation: Julle is ongelukkig, Chorasin! Julle is ongelukkig, Bet-saida! Want as die kragtige werke wat in julle gedoen is, in Tyros en Sidon gedoen was, sou hulle al lankal van hulle sondes bekeer het, met harige klere aan en stof op hulle koppe.

original: But I say to you, It will be better for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judging, than for you.
translation: Maar ek sê vir julle, dit sal beter wees vir Tirus en Sidon op die dag van oordeel, as vir julle.

original: And you, Capernaum, were you not to be lifted up to heaven? you will go down into hell: for if the works of power which were done in you had been done in Sodom, it would have been here to this day.
translation: En jy, Kapernaum, was jy nie bedoel om na die hemel opgeneem te word nie? Jy gaan in die hel af: want as die kragtige werke wat in jou gedoen is, in Sodom gedoen was, sou dit tot vandag toe daar gewees het.

original: But I say to you that it will be better for the land of Sodom in the day of judging, than for you.
translation: Maar ek sê vir julle, dit gaan beter wees vir die land van Sodom op die dag van oordeel as vir julle.

original: At that time Jesus made answer and said, I give praise to you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have kept these things secret from the wise and the men of learning, and have made them clear to little children.
translation: In daardie tyd het Jesus geantwoord en gesê, ek prys U, O Vader, Here van die hemel en die aarde, omdat U hierdie dinge geheim gehou het van die slim mense en die geleerdes, en dit duidelik gemaak het vir klein kinders.

original: Yes, Father, for so it was pleasing in your eyes.
translation: Ja, Vader, dit was werklik goed in u oë.

original: All things have been given to me by my Father; and no one has knowledge of the Son, but the Father; and no one has knowledge of the Father, but the Son, and he to whom the Son will make it clear.
translation: Alles is aan my gegee deur my Vader; niemand ken die Seun nie, behalwe die Vader; en niemand ken die Vader nie, behalwe die Seun, en die een aan wie die Seun dit sal verduidelik.

original: Come to me, all you who are troubled and weighted down with care, and I will give you rest.
translation: Kom na my toe, julle wat moeilikheid en bekommernisse het, en ek sal julle laat rus.

original: Take my yoke on you and become like me, for I am gentle and without pride, and you will have rest for your souls;
translation: Neem my las op jou en wees soos ek, want ek is sagmoedig en nie trots nie, en julle sal rustigheid vir julle siele vind.

original: For my yoke is good, and the weight I take up is not hard.
translation: Want my juk is goed, en die las wat ek dra is nie moeilik nie.

original: At that time Jesus went through the fields on the Sabbath day; and his disciples, being in need of food, were taking the heads of grain.
translation: Op daardie tyd het Jesus deur die veld gegaan op die Sabbat; en sy dissipels, wat honger was, het die koringkoppe gepluk.

original: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said to him, See, your disciples do that which it is not right to do on the Sabbath.
translation: Maar die Fariseërs het, toe hulle dit gesien het, vir hom gesê: Kyk, jou dissipels doen iets wat nie reg is om op die Sabbat te doen nie.

original: But he said to them, Have you no knowledge of what David did when he had need of food, and those who were with him?
translation: Maar hy het vir hulle gesê: Weet julle nie wat David gedoen het toe hy honger was, saam met die mense wat by hom was nie?

original: How he went into the house of God and took for food the holy bread which it was not right for him or for those who were with him to take, but only for the priests?
translation: Hoe hy in God se huis ingegaan het en heilige brood geneem het vir ete, wat nie reg was vir hom of vir die mense saam met hom om te neem nie, maar net vir die priesters.

original: Or is it not said in the law, how the Sabbath is broken by the priests in the Temple and they do no wrong?
translation: Of sê die wet nie hoe die priesters in die Tempel die Sabbat breek en hulle doen niks verkeerd nie?

original: But I say to you that a greater thing than the Temple is here.
translation: Maar ek sê vir julle dat daar iets groter as die Tempel hier is.

original: But if these words had been in your minds, My desire is for mercy and not for offerings, you would not have been judging those who have done no wrong.
translation: Maar as hierdie woorde in julle gedagtes was, ek wil genade en nie offers nie, sou julle nie diegene wat niks verkeerd gedoen het, oordeel nie.

original: For the Son of man is lord of the Sabbath.
translation: Want die Seun van die mens is die baas van die Sabbat.

original: And while they were going on their way, they came to some water, and the Ethiopian said, See, here is water; why may I not have baptism?
translation: Terwyl hulle op pad was, het hulle by 'n stuk water gekom, en die Ethiopian het gesê: "Kyk, hier is water; hoekom mag ek nie gedoop word nie?"
Sorry, there doesn't seem to be any text provided for translation. Please provide the text you'd like me to translate.

original: And he gave orders for the carriage to be stopped, and the two of them went down into the water, and Philip gave him baptism.
translation: Hy het gesê dat die kar moet stop, en hulle het albei in die water gegaan, en Filippus het hom gedoop.

original: And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord took Philip away; and the Ethiopian saw him no more, for he went on his way full of joy.
translation: Toe hulle uit die water gekom het, het die Gees van die Here Filippus weggevat; en die Etiopeer het hom nie meer gesien nie, want hy het bly en vol vreugde sy pad gegaan.

original: But Philip came to Azotus, and went through all the towns, preaching the good news, till he came to Caesarea.
translation: Maar Filippus het na Azotus gekom en deur al die dorpie gegaan om die goeie nuus te vertel, totdat hy by Caesarea gekom het.

original: But Saul, still burning with desire to put to death the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest,
translation: Maar Saul, nog steeds brandend van die begeerte om die volgelinge van die Here te dood, het na die hoëpriester gegaan.

original: And made a request for letters from him to the Synagogues of Damascus, so that if there were any of the Way there, men or women, he might take them as prisoners to Jerusalem.
translation: Hy het gevra vir briewe van hom na die sinagoges in Damaskus, sodat, as daar enige mense van die Weg daar was, mans of vroue, hy hulle as gevangenes na Jerusalem kon neem.

original: And while he was journeying, he came near Damascus; and suddenly he saw a light from heaven shining round him;
translation: Terwyl hy op reis was, het hy naby Damaskus gekom; en skielik het hy 'n lig vanuit die hemel gesien wat om hom geskyn het.

original: And he went down on the earth, and a voice said to him, Saul, Saul, why are you attacking me so cruelly?
translation: Hy het op die aarde neergedaal, en toe het 'n stem vir hom gesê: Saul, Saul, waarom aanvaar jy my so ongenadig?

original: And he said, Who are you, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus, whom you are attacking:
translation: Hy het gesê, Wie is jy, Here? Hy het gesê, Ek is Jesus, wie jy aanval.

original: But get up, and go into the town, and it will be made clear to you what you have to do.
translation: Maar staan op en gaan in die stad in, en dit sal vir jou duidelik wees wat jy moet doen.

original: And the men who were with him were not able to say anything; hearing the voice, but seeing no one.
translation: Die mans wat saam met hom was, kon niks sê nie; hulle het die stem gehoor, maar niemand gesien nie.

original: And Saul got up from the earth, and when his eyes were open, he saw nothing; and he was guided by the hand into Damascus.
translation: En Saul het opgestaan van die aarde, en toe sy oë oop was, het hy niks gesien nie; en hy is met die hand na Damaskus gelei.

original: And for three days he was not able to see, and he took no food or drink.
translation: En vir drie dae kon hy nie sien nie, en hy het geen kos of drink gehad nie.

original: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and the Lord said to him in a vision, Ananias! and he said, Here I am, Lord.
translation: Daar was 'n man, Ananias, wat in Damaskus gewoon het; en die Here het vir hom in 'n visioen gesê, Ananias! En hy het geantwoord, Here, hier is ek.

original: And the Lord said to him, Get up, and go to the street which is named Straight, and make search at the house of Judas for one named Saul of Tarsus: for he is at prayer;
translation: En die Here het vir hom gesê, staan op en gaan na die straat wat Regtig genoem word, en soek in die huis van Judas vir iemand wat Saul van Tarsus genoem word, want hy is aan die bid.

original: And he has seen a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hands on him, so that he may be able to see.
translation: En hy het 'n man gesien wat Ananias genoem word, wat binnegekom het en sy hande op hom gelê het, sodat hy weer kon sien.

original: But Ananias said, Lord, I have had accounts of this man from a number of people, how much evil he has done to your saints at Jerusalem:
translation: Maar Ananias het gesê, Here, ek het van 'n paar mense gehoor oor hierdie man, hoeveel slegte dinge hy aan jou mense in Jerusalem gedoen het:

original: And here he has authority from the chief priests to make prisoners all who give worship to your name.
translation: En hier het hy die gesag van die hoof priester om almal wat jou naam aanbid in die tronk te sit.

original: But the Lord said, Go without fear: for he is a special vessel for me, to give to the Gentiles and kings and to the children of Israel the knowledge of my name:
translation: Maar die Here het gesê, gaan sonder vrees: want hy is 'n spesiale persoon vir my, om vir die heidene, konings en die kinders van Israel te vertel van my naam.

original: For I will make clear to him what troubles he will have to undergo for me.
translation: Ek sal vir hom wys watter moeilikhede hy vir My gaan ervaar.

original: And Ananias went out and came to the house, and putting his hands on him, said, Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, whom you saw when you were on your journey, has sent me, so that you may be able to see, and be full of the Holy Spirit.
translation: En Ananias het uit gegaan en na die huis gegaan. Toe hy sy hande op hom gelê het, het hy gesê: Broer Saul, die Here Jesus, wat jy gesien het terwyl jy op pad was, het my gestuur sodat jy weer kan sien en vol kan wees van die Heilige Gees.

original: And straight away it seemed as if a veil was taken from his eyes, and he was able to see; and he got up, and had baptism;
translation: En dadelik het dit gelyk asof 'n doek van sy oë afgehaal is, en hy kon sien; en hy het opgestaan en is gedoop.

original: And when he had taken food his strength came back. And for some days he kept with the disciples who were in Damascus.
translation: En toe hy kos geëet het, het sy krag teruggekom. En vir 'n paar dae het hy saam met die dissipels in Damaskus gebly.

original: And straight away, in the Synagogues, he was preaching Jesus as the Son of God.
translation: En dadelik, in die sinagoges, het hy Jesus preek as God se Seun.

original: And all those hearing him were full of wonder and said, Is not this the man who in Jerusalem was attacking all the worshippers of this name? and he had come here so that he might take them as prisoners before the chief priests.
translation: Die mense wat na hom geluister het, was verstom en het gesê: Is dit nie die man wat in Jerusalem al die aanhangers van hierdie naam aangeval het nie? En hy het hierheen gekom om hulle as gevangenes na die hoëpriesters te neem.

original: But Saul went on increasing in power, and the Jews in Damascus were not able to give answers to the arguments by which he made it clear that Jesus was the Christ.
translation: Maar Saul het al meer krag gekry, en die Jode in Damaskus kon nie vir sy argumente antwoordgee waaruit dit duidelik geword het dat Jesus die Christus was nie.

original: Then, after some days, the Jews made an agreement together to put him to death:
translation: Toe, na 'n paar dae, het die Jode saam 'n ooreenkoms gemaak om hom dood te maak:

original: But Saul got knowledge of their design. And they kept watch day and night on the roads out of the town, so that they might put him to death:
translation: Maar Saul het van hul plan geweet. Hulle het dag en nag op die paaie buite die dorp gewaak, sodat hulle hom kon doodmaak.

original: But his disciples took him by night and let him down from the wall in a basket.
translation: maar sy dissipels het hom snags geneem en in 'n mandjie van die muur af laat sak.

original: And when he came to Jerusalem, he made an attempt to be joined to the disciples, but they were all in fear of him, not taking him for a disciple.
translation: En toe hy in Jerusalem kom, het hy probeer om by die dissipels aan te sluit, maar hulle was almal bang vir hom en het hom nie as 'n dissipel gesien nie.

original: But Barnabas took him to the Apostles and gave them an account of how he had seen the Lord on the road, and had given hearing to his words, and how at Damascus he had been preaching in the name of Jesus without fear.
translation: Maar Barnabas het hom na die Apostels geneem en vir hulle vertel hoe hy die Here op die pad gesien het, en hoe hy na sy woorde geluister het, en hoe hy in Damaskus in die naam van Jesus gepreek het sonder om bang te wees.

original: And he was with them, going in and out at Jerusalem,
translation: En hy was saam met hulle, en het in en uit Jerusalem gegaan.

original: Preaching in the name of the Lord without fear; and he had discussions with the Greek Jews; but they were working for his death.
translation: Preek in die naam van die Here sonder vrees; en hy het met die Griekse Jode gepraat; maar hulle het probeer om hom dood te maak.

original: And when the brothers had knowledge of it, they took him to Caesarea and sent him to Tarsus.
translation: Toe die broers daarvan verneem, het hulle hom na Caesarea gestuur en daarna na Tarsus.

original: And so the church through all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria had peace and was made strong; and, living in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, was increased greatly.
translation: Die kerk het vrede gehad en is sterk gemaak regoor Juda, Galilea en Samaria. Hulle het in die vrees van die Here geleef en die troos van die Heilige Gees ervaar, en hulle het baie gegroei.

original: And it came about that while Peter was going through all parts of the country he came to the saints who were living at Lydda.
translation: En terwyl Petrus deur al die plekke van die land gegaan het, het hy by die gelowiges in Lydda gegaan.

original: And there was a certain man there, named Aeneas, who for eight years had been in bed, without power of moving.
translation: En daar was 'n man daar, wat Aeneas genoem word, wat al agt jaar in die bed gelê het, sonder om te kan beweeg.

original: And Peter said to him, Aeneas, Jesus Christ makes you well: get up and make your bed. And straight away he got up.
translation: En Peter het vir hom gesê, Aeneas, Jesus Christus maak jou gesond: staan op en maak jou bed. En hy het dadelik opgestaan.

original: And all those living in Lydda and Sharon saw him, and were turned to the Lord.
translation: En al die mense wat in Lydda en Sharon gewoon het, het hom gesien en het na die Here gedraai.

original: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, that is, Dorcas: this woman was given to good works and acts of mercy at all times.
translation: Daar was in Joppe 'n leerder met die naam Tabitha, wat ook Dorcas genoem word. Hierdie vrou het altyd goeie dinge gedoen en ander gehelp.

original: And it came about, in those days, that she got ill and came to her death: and when she had been washed, they put her in a room which was high up.
translation: In daardie dae het sy siek geword en gesterf. Nadat hulle haar gewas het, het hulle haar in 'n hoë kamer neergelê.

original: And because Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, having knowledge that Peter was there, sent two men to him, requesting him to come to them straight away.
translation: En omdat Lydda naby Joppa was, het die dissipels geweet dat Petrus daar was, en hulle het twee mans na hom gestuur om hom te vra om dadelik na hulle toe te kom.

original: And Peter went with them. And when he had come, they took him into the room: and all the widows were there, weeping and putting before him the coats and clothing which Dorcas had made while she was with them.
translation: En Petrus het saam met hulle gegaan. Toe hy aankom, het hulle hom in die kamer ingeneem: en al die verlate vroue was daar en het gehuil en het vir hom die klere en goedjies gewys wat Dorcas gemaak het terwyl sy saam met hulle was.

original: But Peter made them all go outside, and went down on his knees in prayer; and turning to the body, he said, Tabitha, get up. And, opening her eyes, she saw Peter and got up.
translation: Maar Petrus het vir almal gesê om buite te gaan, en hy het op sy knieë gebid; toe hy na die liggaam kyk, het hy gesê: 'Tabitha, staan op.' Toe sy haar oë oopmaak, het sy Petrus gesien en opgestaan.

original: And he took her hand, lifting her up; and, sending for the saints and widows, he gave her to them, living.
translation: Hy het haar handgeneem en haar opgetel; en hy het die gelowiges en weduwees gestuur en haar lewendig aan hulle gegee.

original: And news of it went all through Joppa, and a number of people had faith in the Lord.
translation: Die nuus het oor Joppa versprei, en 'n paar mense het in die Here geglo.

original: And he was living in Joppa for some time with Simon, a leather-worker.
translation: Hy het 'n tyd in Joppa gewoon saam met Simon, wat leerder was.

original: Now there was a certain man in Caesarea, named Cornelius, the captain of the Italian band of the army;
translation: Daar was 'n man in Caesarea, sy naam was Cornelius, die kaptein van die Italiaanse groep soldate.

original: A serious-minded man, fearing God with all his family; he gave much money to the poor, and made prayer to God at all times.
translation: Hy was 'n ernstige man wat vir God vrees gehad het saam met sy hele gesin; hy het baie geld aan die armes gegee en altyd gebid tot God.

original: He saw in a vision, clearly, at about the ninth hour of the day, an angel of the Lord coming to him and saying to him, Cornelius!
translation: Hy het in 'n visie duidelik gesien, omtrent die negende uur van die dag, 'n engel van die Here wat na hom toe kom en vir hom sê, Cornelius!

original: And he, looking on him in fear, said, What is it, Lord? And he said to him, Your prayers and your offerings have come up to God, and he has kept them in mind.
translation: En hy het hom met vrees aangekyk en gesê: Wat is dit, Here? En hy het vir hom gesê: Jou gebede en jou offers het by God opgeduik, en Hy het dit in gedagte gehou.

original: Now send men to Joppa, and get one Simon, named Peter,
translation: Stuur nou mense na Joppa toe en kry 'n man met die naam Simon, wat ook Peter genoem word.

original: Who is living with Simon, a leather-worker, whose house is by the sea.
translation: Wie woon saam met Simon, 'n leerwerker, wie se huis is by die see?

original: And when the angel who said these words to him had gone away, he sent for two of his house-servants, and a God-fearing man of the army, one of those who were waiting on him at all times;
translation: Toe die engel wat hierdie woorde vir hom gesê het, weggegaan het, het hy twee van sy huisdienaars gestuur, en 'n man wat vir God respekteer van die soldate, een van hulle wat altyd vir hom gewag het.

original: And having given them an account of everything, he sent them to Joppa.
translation: En nadat hy vir hulle alles vertel het, het hy hulle na Joppa gestuur.

original: Now the day after, when they were on their journey and were near the town, Peter went up to the top of the house for prayer, about the sixth hour:
translation: Nou, die dag daarna, terwyl hulle op pad was en naby die dorpie was, het Peter op die dak van die huis gegaan om te bid, ongeveer sesuur.

original: And he was in need of food: but while they were getting it ready, a deep sleep came on him;
translation: Hy het kos nodig gehad, maar terwyl hulle dit voorbereid het, het 'n diep slaap oor hom gekom.

original: And he saw the heavens opening, and a vessel coming down, like a great cloth let down on the earth,
translation: En hy het gesien hoe die hemel oopgaan, en 'n houer wat neerdaal, soos 'n groot doek wat op die aarde neergelaat word.

original: In which were all sorts of beasts and birds.
translation: Waarin was al soort diere en voëls.

original: And a voice came to him, saying, Come, Peter; take them for food.
translation: En 'n stem het na hom toe gekom en gesê: Kom, Peter; neem hulle vir kos.

original: But Peter said, No, Lord; for I have never taken food which is common or unclean.
translation: Maar Petrus het gesê, Nee, Here; ek het nog nooit kos geëet wat gewoon of onrein is nie.

original: And the voice came to him a second time, What God has made clean, do not you make common.
translation: En die stem het 'n tweede keer na hom gesê: Wat God skoon gemaak het, moet jy nie as gewone dinge behandel nie.

original: And this was done three times: and then the vessel was taken back into heaven.
translation: En dit is drie keer gedoen: toe is die vaartuig weer na die hemel geneem.

original: Now while Peter was in doubt as to the purpose of this vision, the men who were sent by Cornelius, having made search for Simon's house, came to the door,
translation: Terwyl Petrus gewonder het oor wat hierdie visie beteken, het die manne wat deur Kornelius gestuur is, vir Simon se huis gesoek en by die deur geklop.

original: To see if Simon, named Peter, was living there.
translation: Om te kyk of Simon, wat Petrus genoem word, daar woon.

original: And, while Peter was turning the vision over in his mind, the Spirit said to him, See, three men are looking for you.
translation: En terwyl Petrus oor die visioen gedink het, het die Gees vir hom gesê: Kyk, drie mense soek jou.

original: Go down, then, and go with them, doubting nothing, for I have sent them.
translation: Gaan dan af en gaan saam met hulle, moenie twyfel nie, want ek het hulle gestuur.

original: And Peter went down to the men, and said, I am the man you are looking for: why have you come?
translation: En Petrus het na die mans toe gegaan en gesê: Ek is die man wat julle soek. Hoekom het julle gekom?

original: And they said, Cornelius, a captain, an upright and God-fearing man, respected by all the nation of the Jews, had word from God by an angel to send for you to his house, and to give hearing to your words.
translation: En hulle het gesê, Cornelius, 'n kaptein, 'n regverdig en godvresende man, wat deur die hele Joodse nasie gerespekteer word, het 'n boodskap van God deur 'n engel gekry om jou na sy huis te stuur en na jou woorde te luister.

original: So he took them in for the night. And the day after, he went with them, taking some of the brothers from Joppa with him.
translation: Hy het hulle vir die nag ingeneem. En die volgende dag het hy saam met hulle gegaan, saam met 'n paar van die broers van Joppa.

original: And the day after that, they came to Caesarea. And Cornelius was waiting for them, having got together his relations and his near friends.
translation: Die volgende dag het hulle in Caesarea aangekom. Cornelius het op hulle gewag en sy familie en naby vriende bymekaargebring.

original: And when Peter came in, Cornelius came to him and, falling down at his feet, gave him worship.
translation: Toe Petrus binnekom, het Kornelius na hom toe gekom en, terwyl hy voor sy voete geval het, het hy hom geëer.

original: But Peter, lifting him up, said, Get up, for I am a man as you are.
translation: Maar Petrus het hom opgetel en gesê: "Staan op, ek is net 'n man soos jy."

original: And saying these words, he went in, and saw that a great number of people had come together;
translation: En terwyl hy hierdie woorde gesê het, het hy ingegaan en gesien dat 'n groot aantal mense bymekaar gekom het;

original: And he said to them, You yourselves have knowledge that it is against the law for a man who is a Jew to be in the company of one who is of another nation; but God has made it clear to me that no man may be named common or unclean:
translation: Hy het vir hulle gesê, julle weet self dat dit teen die wette is vir 'n Jood om saam met iemand van 'n ander nasie te wees; maar God het vir my duidelik gemaak dat geen man as gewone of onrein gesien mag word nie.

original: And so I came without question, when I was sent for. What then is your purpose in sending for me?
translation: En so het ek sonder vrae gekom toe jy my geroep het. Wat is jou rede om my te stuur?

original: And Cornelius said, Four days from now I was in my house in prayer at the ninth hour; and I saw before me a man in shining clothing,
translation: En Cornelius het gesê: "Oor vier dae was ek in my huis en het ek by die negende uur gebid; en ek het voor my 'n man in helder klere gesien."

original: Who said, Cornelius, your prayer has come to the ears of God, and your offerings are kept in his memory.
translation: Cornelius, jou gebed het God se aandag getrek, en jou offergawes is in sy gedagtes.

original: Send, then, to Joppa, and get Simon, named Peter, to come to you; he is living in the house of Simon, a leather-worker, by the sea.
translation: Stuur dan na Joppa en vra Simon, wat Peter genoem word, om na jou toe te kom; hy woon in die huis van Simon, 'n leerwerker, by die see.

original: So, straight away, I sent for you; and you have done well to come. And now, we are all present before God, ready to give attention to all the things which the Lord has given you to say.
translation: So, ek het jou onmiddellik gestuur om te kom; en jy het goed gemaak om te kom. En nou is ons almal hier voor God, reg om te luister na alles wat die Here jou gegee het om te sê.

original: Then Peter said, Truly, I see clearly that God is no respecter of persons:
translation: Toe het Petrus gesê, Ek sien duidelik dat God nie mense verskillend behandel nie.

original: But in every nation, the man who has fear of him and does righteousness is pleasing to him.
translation: Maar in elke land is die man wat respek vir hom het en regverdig is, vir hom welkom.

original: The word which he sent to the children of Israel, giving the good news of peace through Jesus Christ (who is Lord of all) —
translation: Die boodskap wat Hy na die kinders van Israel gestuur het, wat die goeie nuus van vrede deur Jesus Christus bring (wat oor almal heers) —

original: That word you yourselves have knowledge of, which was made public through all Judaea, starting from Galilee, after the baptism of which John was the preacher,
translation: Die woord waarvan julle weet, wat in die hele Judea bekend gemaak is, begin in Galilea, na die doop waar Johannes gepreek het.

original: About Jesus of Nazareth, how God gave the Holy Spirit to him, with power: and how he went about doing good and making well all who were troubled by evil spirits, for God was with him.
translation: Van Jesus van Nasaret, hoe God die Heilige Gees aan Hom gegee het, met krag: en hoe hy goed gedoen het en almal wat deur bose geeste lastiggevallen is, gesond gemaak het, want God was by Hom.

original: And we are witnesses of all the things which he did in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem; whom they put to death, hanging him on a tree.
translation: En ons is getuies van alles wat hy in die land van die Jode en in Jerusalem gedoen het; hulle het hom doodgemaak deur hom aan 'n boom op te hang.

original: On the third day God gave him back to life, and let him be seen,
translation: Op die derde dag het God hom weer lewendig gemaak en dit laat mense sien.

original: Not by all the people, but by witnesses marked out before by God, even by us, who took food and drink with him after he came back from the dead.
translation: Nie deur almal nie, maar deur die mense wat God vooraf gekies het om te getuig, ook deur ons wat saam met hom geëet en gedrink het nadat hy uit die dood teruggekom het.

original: And he gave us orders to give news of this to the people, and to give public witness that this is he whom God has made judge of the living and the dead.
translation: Hy het vir ons gesê om vir die mense hiervan te vertel en om openlik te sê dat hy die een is wat God aangestel het om oor die lewendes en die dooies te oordeel.

original: To him all the prophets give witness, that through his name everyone who has faith in him will have forgiveness of sins.
translation: Die profete sê van Hom dat deur sy naam, almal wat in Hom glo, vergifnis van hulle sondes sal kry.

original: While Peter was saying these words, the Holy Spirit came on all those who were hearing the word.
translation: Terwyl Peter hierdie woorde gesê het, het die Heilige Gees oor almal gekom wat na die boodskap geluister het.

original: And the Jews of the faith, who had come with Peter, were full of wonder, because the Holy Spirit was given to the Gentiles,
translation: En die Jode van die geloof wat saam met Petrus gekom het, was vol van verwondering, omdat die Heilige Gees aan die nie-Jode gegee is.

original: And they were talking in tongues, and giving glory to God. Then Peter said,
translation: En hulle het in ander tale gepraat en God se eer gegee. Toe sê Petrus,

original: Will any man say that these may not have baptism who have been given the Holy Spirit as we have?
translation: Sal iemand sê dat hierdie mense nie gedoop kan word nie, terwyl hulle die Heilige Gees ontvang het soos ons?

original: And he gave orders for them to have baptism in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they kept him with them for some days.
translation: Hy het gesê hulle moet gedoop word in Jesus se naam. Toe het hulle hom vir 'n paar dae by hulle gehad.

original: Now the Apostles and the brothers who were in Judaea had news that the word of God had been given to the Gentiles.
translation: Nou het die Apostels en die broers in Judea gehoor dat God se boodskap aan die nie-Jode gegee is.

original: And when Peter came to Jerusalem, those who kept the rule of circumcision had an argument with him,
translation: En toe Petrus in Jerusalem aankom, het die mense wat die reëls van besny gevolg het, met hom gestruikel.

original: Saying, You went to men without circumcision, and took food with them.
translation: Jy het na mense wat nie besny is nie gegaan en saam met hulle geëet.

original: But Peter gave them an account of it all in order, saying to them,
translation: Maar Petrus het vir hulle alles op 'n keer vertel en vir hulle gesê,

original: I was in the town of Joppa, at prayer: and falling into a deep sleep, I saw in a vision a vessel like a great cloth let down from heaven, and it came down to me:
translation: Ek was in die stad Joppa terwyl ek gebid het, en toe ek in 'n diep slaap geval het, het ek in 'n visioen gesien hoe 'n houer soos 'n groot doek uit die hemel neergesak het, en dit het na my toe gekom.

original: And looking on it with attention I saw in it all sorts of beasts and birds.
translation: Toe ek goed daarop kyk, het ek al soort diere en voëls daarin gesien.

original: And a voice came to my ears saying, Come, Peter; take them for food.
translation: En 'n stem het in my ore gekom en gesê, Kom, Petrus; neem hulle om te eet.

original: But I said, No, Lord; for nothing common or unclean has ever come into my mouth.
translation: Maar ek het gesê, Nee, Here; want niks onrein of vuil het ooit in my mond gekom nie.

original: But the voice, coming a second time from heaven, said, What God has made clean, do not you make common.
translation: Maar die stem wat weer van die hemel gekom het, het gesê: Wat God skoon gemaak het, moet jy nie as vuil beskou nie.

original: And this was done three times, and they were all taken up again into heaven.
translation: En dit het drie keer gebeur, en hulle is almal weer in die hemel opgeneem.

original: And at that minute, three men, sent from Caesarea, came to the house where we were.
translation: En op daardie oomblik het drie mans van Kesarea by die huis gekom waar ons was.

original: And the Spirit gave me orders to go with them, doubting nothing. And these six brothers came with me; and we went into that man's house:
translation: En die Gees het vir my gesê om saam met hulle te gaan, sonder om te twyfel. En hierdie ses broers het saam met my gekom; en ons het in daardie man se huis ingegaan.

original: And he gave us an account of how he had seen the angel in his house, saying, Send to Joppa, and get Simon, named Peter, to come to you;
translation: Hy het vir ons vertel hoe hy die engel in sy huis gesien het en gesê: Stuur na Joppa en haal Simon, wat Petrus genoem word, na jou toe.

original: Who will say words to you through which you and all your family may get salvation.
translation: Wie sal vir jou woorde sê waardeur jy en jou hele gesin gered kan word?

original: And, while I was talking to them, the Holy Spirit came on them, as on us at first.
translation: En terwyl ek met hulle gepraat het, het God se Gees op hulle gekom, soos wat dit aan ons in die begin gebeur het.

original: And the words of the Lord came into my mind, how he said, The baptism of John was with water, but you will have baptism with the Holy Spirit.
translation: En die woorde van die Here het in my gedagtes gekom, hoe Hy gesê het, Die doop van Johannes was met water, maar julle sal 'n doop hê met die Heilige Gees.

original: If then God gave them, when they had faith in the Lord Jesus Christ, the same as he gave to us, who was I to go against God?
translation: As God vir hulle gegee het toe hulle in die Here Jesus geglo het, net soos wat Hy vir ons gegee het, wie was ek om teen God te gaan?

original: And hearing these things they said nothing more, but gave glory to God, saying, Then to the Gentiles as to us has God given a change of heart, so that they may have life.
translation: Toe hulle dit gehoor het, het hulle niks meer gesê nie, maar het God geprys en gesê: Toe het God vir die nie-Jode, net soos vir ons, 'n nuwe hart gegee, sodat hulle kan lewe.

original: Then those who had gone away at the time of the trouble about Stephen, went as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus, preaching to the Jews only.
translation: Toe het die mense wat weggeloop het tydens die probleme met Stefanus, so ver as Phoenicië en Siprus gegaan en net vir die Jode gesê.

original: But some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, when they came to Antioch, gave the good news about the Lord Jesus to the Greeks.
translation: Maar sommige van hulle, mense van Siprus en Sirene, het, toe hulle in Antiog aankom, die goeie nuus oor die Here Jesus aan die Grieke vertel.

original: And the power of the Lord was with them, and a great number had faith and were turned to the Lord.
translation: En die krag van die Here was by hulle, en baie mense het in God begin glo en het na die Here toe gegaan.

original: And news of them came to the ears of the church at Jerusalem: and they sent Barnabas as far as Antioch:
translation: Die nuus oor hulle het by die kerk in Jerusalem gekom, en hulle het Barnabas tot by Antiochië gestuur.
