original: Who, when he came and saw the grace of God, was glad; and he made clear to them the need of keeping near the Lord with all the strength of their hearts:
translation: Toe hy gekom het en God se genade gesien het, was hy bly; en hy het vir hulle verduidelik hoe belangrik dit is om naby die Here te wees met al julle harte se krag.

original: For he was a good man and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith: and a great number were joined to the Lord.
translation: Hy was 'n goeie man, vol van die Heilige Gees en geloof, en 'n groot groep mense het by die Here aangekom.

original: Then he went on to Tarsus, looking for Saul;
translation: Toe het hy verder gegaan na Tarsus, om Saul te soek.

original: And when he had come across him, he took him to Antioch. And they were with the church there for a year, teaching the people; and the disciples were first given the name of Christians in Antioch.
translation: En toe hy hom gesien het, het hy hom na Antiog geneem. En hulle was 'n jaar lank by die kerk daar, waar hulle die mense geleer het; en die dissipels het eers die naam Christene in Antiog ontvang.

original: Now in those days prophets came from Jerusalem to Antioch.
translation: In daardie tyd het profete van Jerusalem na Antiog gegaan.

original: And one of them, named Agabus, said publicly through the Spirit that there would be serious need of food all over the earth: which came about in the time of Claudius.
translation: En een van hulle, genaamd Agabus, het deur die Gees vir almal gesê dat daar 'n groot honger regoor die wêreld gaan wees: dit het gebeur in die tyd van Claudius.

original: And the disciples, everyone as he was able, made a decision to send help to the brothers living in Judaea:
translation: En die leerlinge, elkeen op sy eie manier, het besluit om hulp te stuur na die broers wat in Judaea woon.

original: Which they did, sending it to the rulers of the church by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.
translation: Hulle het dit gedoen en dit gestuur na die leiers van die gemeente deur Barnabas en Saulus.

original: Now, about that time, Herod the king made cruel attacks on the Christians.
translation: Nou, rondom daardie tyd, het koning Herodes gemeen om hard teen die Christene op te tree.

original: And he put James, the brother of John, to death with the sword.
translation: Hy het Jakob, die broer van Johannes, met die swaard doodgemaak.

original: And when he saw that this was pleasing to the Jews he went on to take Peter in addition. This was at the time of the feast of unleavened bread.
translation: En toe hy gesien het dat die Jode dit geniet, het hy voortgegaan om Peter ook te kry. Dit was tydens die feestyd van die ongesuurde brood.

original: And having taken him, he put him in prison, with four bands of armed men to keep watch over him; his purpose being to take him out to the people after the Passover.
translation: Hy het hom geneem en in die tronk gesit, met vier groepies gewapende mense wat oor hom oppas; sy plan was om hom na die Pesach by die mense te bring.

original: So Peter was kept in prison: but the church made strong prayer to God for him.
translation: So Petrus was in die tronk, maar die kerk het sterk vir God gebid vir hom.

original: And when Herod was about to take him out, the same night Peter was sleeping in chains between two armed men, and the watchmen were keeping watch before the door of the prison.
translation: En toe Herodes hom wou uithaal, het Peter daardie nag in kettings tussen twee gewapende mense geslaap, en die wagte het voor die deur van die tronk gewaak.

original: And a great light was seen shining in the room, and an angel of the Lord came to Peter and, touching him on his side so that he came out of his sleep, said, Get up quickly. And his chains came off his hands.
translation: En 'n groot lig het in die kamer geskyn, en 'n engel van die Here het na Pieter toe gekom en, terwyl hy hom aan sy sy raak, het hy hom wakker gemaak en gesê, staan vinnig op. En sy kettings het van sy hande afgekom.

original: Then the angel said, Put on your shoes and get ready to go. And he did so. And he said, Put your coat round you and come with me.
translation: Toe het die engel gesê, sit jou skoene aan en maak jouself reg om te gaan. En hy het dit gedaan. Hy het ook gesê, sit jou baadjie aan en kom saam met my.

original: And he went out after him; and he was not certain if what was done by the angel was a fact, for it seemed to him that he was seeing a vision.
translation: En hy het agter hom uitgegaan; en hy was nie seker of wat die engel gedoen het, werklik was nie, want dit het vir hom gelyk asof hy 'n visioen gesien het.

original: And when they had gone past the first and second watchmen they came to the iron door into the town, which came open by itself: and they went out and down one street; and then the angel went away.
translation: En toe hulle by die eerste en tweede wagte verbygegaan het, het hulle by die ysterdeur van die dorp gekom, wat vanself oopgemaak het. Hulle het uitgehardloop en 'n straat af gegaan, en toe het die engel weggegaan.

original: And when Peter came to his senses he said, Now, truly, I am certain that the Lord has sent his angel and taken me out of the hands of Herod, against all the hopes of the Jews.
translation: En toe Petrus weer by homself kom, sê hy: Nou weet ek regtig, die Here het sy engel gestuur en my uit die hande van Herodes geneem, teen al die hoop van die Jode.

original: And when he became clear about this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John named Mark, where a number of them had come together for prayer.
translation: En toe hy dit verstaan het, het hy na Maria se huis gegaan, die ma van Johannes wat Mark genoem word, waar ‘n paar van hulle bymekaar was om te bid.

original: And he gave a blow on the door, and a young girl came to it, named Rhoda.
translation: Hy het aan die deur geklop, en 'n jong meisie, Rhoda, het gekom.

original: And hearing the voice of Peter, in her joy she went running, without opening the door, to say that Peter was outside.
translation: En toe sy Peter se stem hoor, het sy van blydskap begin hardloop, sonder om die deur oop te maak, om te sê Peter is buite.

original: And they said to her, You are off your head. But still she said, with decision, that it was so. And they said, It is his angel.
translation: Hulle het vir haar gesê, Jy is nie reg in jou kop nie. Maar sy het steeds met oortuiging gesê dat dit so is. En hulle het gesê, Dit is sy engel.

original: But Peter went on giving blows on the door: and when it was open and they saw him, they were full of wonder.
translation: Maar Petrus het aanhou klop op die deur, en toe dit oopgaan en hulle hom sien, was hulle baie verbaas.

original: But he made a sign to them with his hand to be quiet, and gave them an account of how the Lord had taken him out of prison. And he said, Give the news to James and the brothers. And then he went away.
translation: Maar hy het met sy hand vir hulle 'n teken gemaak om stil te wees, en het hulle vertel hoe die Here hom uit die tronk uitgehaal het. Hy het gesê: "Gee die nuus aan Jakobus en die broers." En toe het hy weggegaan.

original: Now when it was day, the armed men were greatly troubled about what had become of Peter.
translation: Toe dit dag geword het, was die gewapende manne baie bekommerd oor wat met Peter gebeur het.

original: And Herod, when he sent for him, and he was not there, after questioning the watchmen, gave orders that they were to be put to death. Then he went down from Judaea to Caesarea for a time.
translation: En Herodes, toe hy vir hom gestuur het en hy was nie daar nie, het, nadat hy die wagte vrae gevra het, opdrag gegee dat hulle doodgemaak moet word. Daarna het hy vir ’n tydjie van Judaea na Caesarea gegaan.

original: Now he was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon: and they came to him, all together, and having made friends with Blastus, the controller of the king's house, they made a request for peace, because their country was dependent on the king's country for its food.
translation: Hy was baie kwaad vir die mense van Tyrus en Sidon. Hulle het saam na hom toe gegaan en vriende geword met Blastus, die baas van die koning se huis. Hulle het hom gevra om vrede te maak, omdat hulle land afhanklik was van die koning se land vir kos.

original: And on the day which had been fixed, Herod, dressed in his robes and seated in his place, made a public statement to them.
translation: En op die dag wat vasgestel is, het Herodes, in sy klere en op sy plek, 'n publieke uitspraak aan hulle gemaak.

original: And the people, with loud cries, said, It is the voice of a god, not of a man.
translation: En die mense het hard geskreeu, dit is die stem van 'n god, nie van 'n man nie.

original: And straight away the angel of the Lord sent a disease on him, because he did not give the glory to God: and his flesh was wasted away by worms, and so he came to his end.
translation: En dadelik het die engel van die Here 'n siekte op hom gestuur, omdat hy nie God die eer gegee het nie. Sy liggaam het deur wurms begin vrot, en so het hy sy einde gekom.

original: But the word of the Lord went on increasing.
translation: maar God se boodskap het aangehou om te groei

original: And Barnabas and Saul came back from Jerusalem, when their work was ended, taking with them John named Mark.
translation: En Barnabas en Saul het teruggekom van Jerusalem, toe hulle klaar was met hulle werk, en het Johannes genaamd Mark saamgebring.

original: Now there were at Antioch, in the church there, prophets and teachers, Barnabas, and Symeon who was named Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, a relation of Herod the king, and Saul.
translation: In Antiochië was daar in die kerk profete en onderwysers: Barnabas, Symeon wat Niger genoem word, Lucius van Sirene, Manaen, 'n familielid van koning Herodes, en Saul.

original: And while they were doing the Lord's work, and going without food, the Holy Spirit said, Let Barnabas and Saul be given to me for the special work for which they have been marked out by me.
translation: En terwyl hulle God se werk doen en nie kos het nie, het die Heilige Gees gesê: Laat Barnabas en Saulus vir die spesiale werk wat ek vir hulle gekies het, aan My gegee word.

original: Then, after prayer and going without food they put their hands on them, and sent them away.
translation: Toe, na gebed en vas, het hulle hulle hande op hulle geleë en hulle weggestuur.

original: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia; and from there they went by ship to Cyprus.
translation: Toe hulle deur die Heilige Gees gestuur is, het hulle na Seleucia gegaan; en van daar het hulle per skip na Siprus gegaan.

original: And at Salamis they were preaching the word of God in the Synagogues of the Jews: and John was with them, helping them.
translation: En in Salamis het hulle God se boodskap in die Joodse sinagoges gepreek, en Johannes was saam met hulle om hulle te help.

original: And when they had gone through all the island to Paphos, they came across a certain wonder-worker and false prophet, a Jew whose name was Bar-Jesus;
translation: En toe hulle deur die hele eiland na Paphos gegaan het, het hulle 'n wonderwerker en vals profeet teëgekom, 'n Jood wat Bar-Jesus genoem is;

original: Who was with the ruler, Sergius Paulus, an able man. This man sent for Barnabas and Saul, desiring to have knowledge of the word of God.
translation: Wie was by die leier, Sergius Paulus, 'n vaardige man? Hierdie man het vir Barnabas en Saul gestuur, omdat hy meer wou weet van God se boodskap.

original: But Elymas, the wonder-worker (for that is the sense of his name), put himself against them, with the purpose of turning the ruler from the faith.
translation: Maar Elymas, die wonderwerker (want dit is wat sy naam beteken), het teen hulle gaan staan om die leier van die geloof af te draai.

original: But Saul, whose other name is Paul, being full of the Holy Spirit, looking hard at him, said,
translation: Maar Saul, wat ook Paulus genoem word, vol van die Heilige Gees, kyk hom reg in die oë aan en sê,

original: O you, who are full of false tricks and evil ways, a son of the Evil One, hating all righteousness, will you for ever be turning people from the right ways of the Lord?
translation: O jy, wat vol is van leuens en slegte maniere, 'n seun van die boosheid, wat alles wat regverdig is haat, gaan jy vir altyd mense wegtrek van die regte paaie van die Here?

original: And now, see, the hand of the Lord is on you, and you will be blind and not able to see the sun for a time. And straight away a dark mist came down on him; and he went about looking for a guide.
translation: Kyk, die hand van die Here is op jou, en jy sal blind wees en nie die son kan sien nie vir 'n tyd. En dadelik het 'n donker mis oor hom gekom; en hy het rondgestap en gesoek na iemand om hom te help.

original: Then the ruler, when he saw what was done, had faith, being full of wonder at the teaching of the Lord.
translation: Toe die leier gesien het wat gebeur het, het hy geloof gehad en was hy vol verwondering oor wat die Here sê.

original: Then Paul and those who were with him went by ship from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia: and there John went away from them and came back to Jerusalem.
translation: Paulus en die mense saam met hom het met 'n skip van Paphos gegaan en in Perga in Pamfilië aangekom; en daar het Johannes hulle verlaat en teruggegaan na Jerusalem.

original: But they, going through from Perga, came to Antioch in Pisidia; and they went into the Synagogue on the Sabbath and were seated.
translation: Maar hulle het van Perga af gegaan en in Antiochië in Pisidië aangekom. Hulle het op die Sabbat in die Sinagoge ingegaan en gesit.

original: And after the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the Synagogue sent to them, saying, Brothers, if you have a word of comfort for the people, say on.
translation: En na die lees van die wet en die profete, het die leiers van die Sinagoge na hulle gestuur en gesê, Broers, as julle 'n woord van troos vir die mense het, sê dit gerus.

original: And Paul, getting up and making a sign with his hand, said, Men of Israel, and you who have the fear of God, give ear.
translation: En Paulus het opgestaan en met sy hand 'n teken gemaak en gesê, Mannen van Israel, en julle wat respek vir God het, luister mooi.

original: The God of this people Israel made selection of our fathers, lifting the people up from their low condition when they were living in the land of Egypt, and with a strong arm took them out of it.
translation: Die God van hierdie volk Israel het ons voorvaders gekies en hulle uit hul swak toestand gehelp toe hulle in Egipte gewoon het, en met 'n sterk hand het Hy hulle daar weggebring.

original: And for about forty years he put up with their ways in the waste land.
translation: En vir ongeveer veertig jaar het hy hulle maniere in die woestyn geduld.

original: And having put to destruction seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them the land for their heritage for about four hundred and fifty years.
translation: Hy het sewe nasies in Kanaan vernietig en vir hulle die land gegee om vir ongeveer vierhonderd en vyftig jaar daar te woon.

original: Give praise to the Lord, O my soul; let everything in me give praise to his holy name.
translation: Loof die Here, my siel; laat alles in my God se heilige naam prysgee.

original: Give praise to the Lord, O my soul; let not all his blessings go from your memory.
translation: Gee prys aan die Here, my siel; vergeet nooit al die seëninge wat Hy vir jou gegee het.

original: He has forgiveness for all your sins; he takes away all your diseases;
translation: Hy het vergifnis vir al jou sondes; hy neem al jou siektes weg.

original: He keeps back your life from destruction, crowning you with mercy and grace.
translation: Hy hou jou lewe weg van vernietiging en bedek jou met genade en liefde.

original: He makes your mouth full of good things, so that your strength is made new again like the eagle's.
translation: Hy maak jou mond vol met goeie dinge, sodat jou krag weer vars word soos 'n arend se.

original: The Lord gives decisions in righteousness for all who are in trouble.
translation: Die Here maak regvaardige keuses vir almal wat in moeilikheid is.

original: He gave knowledge of his way to Moses, and made his acts clear to the children of Israel.
translation: Hy het vir Moses vertel wat sy pad was en sy dade vir die Israeliete duidelik gemaak.

original: The Lord is kind and full of pity, not quickly made angry, but ever ready to have mercy.
translation: Die Here is goed en vol medelye, nie maklik om kwaad te raak nie, maar altyd gereed om te vergewe.

original: His feeling will no longer be bitter; he will not keep his wrath for ever.
translation: Sy gevoel sal nie meer sleg wees nie; hy sal nie sy kwaad vir altyd hou nie.

original: He has not given us the punishment for our sins, or the reward of our wrongdoing.
translation: Hy het ons nie gestraf vir ons sondes nie, of ons nie beloon vir wat ons verkeerd gedoen het nie.

original: For as the heaven is high over the earth, so great is his mercy to his worshippers.
translation: Want soos die hemel ver bo die aarde is, so groot is God se genade vir sy aanbidders.

original: As far as the east is from the west, so far has he put our sins from us.
translation: So ver soos die ooste van die weste is, so ver het Hy ons sondes van ons af verwyder.

original: As a father has pity on his children, so the Lord has pity on his worshippers.
translation: Soos 'n pa wat omgee vir sy kinders, so het die Here ook om vir sy aanbidders.

original: For he has knowledge of our feeble frame; he sees that we are only dust.
translation: Want Hy weet van ons swak liggaam; Hy sien dat ons net stof is.

original: As for man, his days are as grass: his beautiful growth is like the flower of the field.
translation: As dit by mense kom, is hulle dae soos gras: hulle pragtige groei is soos die blomme in die veld.

original: The wind goes over it and it is gone; and its place sees it no longer.
translation: Die wind waai oor dit en dit is weg; sy plek kan dit nie meer sien nie.

original: But the mercy of the Lord is eternal for his worshippers, and their children's children will see his righteousness;
translation: Maar God se genade is ewiging vir sy mense wat Hom aanbid, en hulle kinders se kinders sal sy regverdigheid sien;

original: If they keep his agreement, and have his laws in mind to do them.
translation: As hulle sy ooreenkoms nakom en sy wette in hulle gedagtes hou om dit te doen.

original: The Lord has made ready his high seat in the heavens; his kingdom is ruling over all.
translation: Die Here het sy troon in die hemel reggekry; sy koninkryk heers oor alles.

original: Give praise to the Lord, you his angels, who are great in strength, doing his orders, and waiting for his voice.
translation: Gee lof aan die Here, julle sy engele, wat sterk is en sy opdragte doen en wag vir sy stem.

original: Give praise to the Lord, all you his armies; and you his servants who do his pleasure.
translation: Lof die Here, almal van sy leërs; en julle, sy dienaars, wat doen wat Hy wil.

original: Give praise to the Lord, all his works, in all places under his rule: give praise to the Lord, O my soul.
translation: Loof die Here, al sy werke, oral waar Hy die baas is: loof die Here, O my siel.

original: Give praise to the Lord, O my soul. O Lord my God, you are very great; you are robed with honour and power.
translation: Loof die Here, my siel. O Here, my God, U is baie groot; U is vol eer en krag.

original: You are clothed with light as with a robe; stretching out the heavens like a curtain:
translation: Jy is geklee in lig soos met 'n rok; jy strek die hemel uit soos 'n gordyn.

original: The arch of your house is based on the waters; you make the clouds your carriage; you go on the wings of the wind:
translation: Die boog van jou huis staan op die waters; jy maak die wolke jou vervoer; jy vlieg op die vlerke van die wind.

original: He makes winds his angels, and flames of fire his servants.
translation: Hy maak die winde sy engele, en vlamme van vuur sy dienaars.

original: He has made the earth strong on its bases, so that it may not be moved for ever and ever;
translation: Hy het die aarde sterk gemaak op sy grond, sodat dit nie vir altyd en ewig kan beweeg nie;

original: Covering it with the sea as with a robe: the waters were high over the mountains;
translation: Die see het dit bedek soos 'n klere, die waters was hoog oor die berge.

original: At the voice of your word they went in flight; at the sound of your thunder they went away in fear;
translation: By die klank van jou woorde het hulle gevlug; by die gedreun van jou donder het hulle bang weggehardloop.

original: The mountains came up and the valleys went down into the place which you had made ready for them.
translation: Die berge het opgekom en die valleie het afgedaal na die plek wat jy vir hulle reg gemaak het.

original: You made a limit over which they might not go, so that the earth would never again be covered by them.
translation: Jy het 'n grens gestel waaroor hulle nie mag gaan nie, sodat die aarde nooit weer deur hulle bedek sal word nie.

original: You sent the springs into the valleys; they are flowing between the hills.
translation: Jy het die fonteine in die dale gestuur; hulle vloei tussen die heuwels.

original: They give drink to every beast of the field; the mountain asses come to them for water.
translation: Hulle gee vir elke dier in die veld om te drink; die bergesels kom na hulle toe vir water.

original: The birds of the air have their resting-places by them, and make their song among the branches.
translation: Die voëls in die lug het plekke om te rus en sing hul lied tussen die takke.

original: He sends down rain from his store-houses on the hills: the earth is full of the fruit of his works.
translation: Hy stuur reën uit sy voorrade op die heuwels: die aarde is vol van die vrugte van wat Hy gedoen het.

original: He makes the grass come up for the cattle, and plants for the use of man; so that bread may come out of the earth;
translation: Hy laat die gras groei vir die diere en plante wat mense kan gebruik, sodat daar brood uit die grond kan kom.

original: And wine to make glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face shining, and bread giving strength to his heart.
translation: en wyn om die mens se hart bly te maak, en olie om sy gesig te laat skyn, en brood wat krag aan sy hart gee.

original: The trees of the Lord are full of growth, the cedars of Lebanon of his planting;
translation: Die bome van die Here is vol groei, die sederbome van Libanon wat Hy geplant het.

original: Where the birds have their resting-places; as for the stork, the tall trees are her house.
translation: Waar die voëls hul nes het; en vir die ooievaar, die lang bome is haar huis.

original: The high hills are a safe place for the mountain goats, and the rocks for the small beasts.
translation: Die hoë heuwels is 'n veilige plek vir die bergbokke, en die klippe is vir die klein diertjies.

original: He made the moon for a sign of the divisions of the year; teaching the sun the time of its going down.
translation: Hy het die maan gemaak as 'n teken van die seisoene en wys die son wanneer dit ondergaan.

original: When you make it dark, it is night, when all the beasts of the woods come quietly out of their secret places.
translation: Wanneer dit donker raak, is dit nag, wanneer al die diere van die bos stil uit hul verborge plekke kom.

original: The young lions go thundering after their food; searching for their meat from God.
translation: Die jong leeus jaag na hulle kos; hulle soek vir die vlees wat God voorsien.

original: The sun comes up, and they come together, and go back to their secret places to take their rest.
translation: Die son kom op, en hulle kom saam, dan gaan hulle terug na hulle geheime plekke om te rus.

original: Man goes out to his work, and to his business, till the evening.
translation: Die man gaan uit na sy werk en sy besigheid, tot in die aand.

original: O Lord, how great is the number of your works! in wisdom you have made them all; the earth is full of the things you have made.
translation: O Here, hoe groot is die aantal van U werke! U het hulle almal met wysheid gemaak; die aarde is vol van alles wat U geskep het.

original: There is the great, wide sea, where there are living things, great and small, more than may be numbered.
translation: Daar is die groot, wye see, waar daar lewende dinge is, groot en klein, meer as wat jy kan tel.

original: There go the ships; there is that great beast, which you have made as a plaything.
translation: Kyk hoe vaar die skepe; daar is daardie groot dier wat jy as 'n speelding gemaak het.

original: All of them are waiting for you, to give them their food in its time.
translation: Hulle wag almal vir jou om vir hulle kos te gee wanneer dit tyd is.

original: They take what you give them; they are full of the good things which come from your open hand.
translation: Hulle neem wat jy hulle gee; hulle is vol van die goeie dinge wat uit jou oop hand kom.

original: If your face is veiled, they are troubled; when you take away their breath, they come to an end, and go back to the dust.
translation: As jou gesig bedek is, raak hulle ontsteld; wanneer jy hulle asem wegneem, kom hulle tot 'n einde en gaan terug na die stof.

original: If you send out your spirit, they are given life; you make new the face of the earth.
translation: As jy jou Gees uitstuur, kry hulle lewe; jy maak die aarde weer nuut.

original: Let the glory of the Lord be for ever; let the Lord have joy in his works:
translation: Laat die heerlikheid van die Here altyd daar wees; laat die Here bly wees oor sy werke.

original: At whose look the earth is shaking; at whose touch the mountains send out smoke.
translation: Wanneer Hy kyk, bewe die aarde; wanneer Hy aanraak, stuur die berge rook uit.

original: I will make songs to the Lord all my life; I will make melody to my God while I have my being.
translation: Ek sal my hele lewe liedere vir die Here maak; ek sal melodieë vir my God maak solank ek leef.

original: Let my thoughts be sweet to him: I will be glad in the Lord.
translation: Laat my gedagtes goed vir Hom wees: Ek sal bly wees in die Here.

original: Let sinners be cut off from the earth, and let all evil-doers come to an end. Give praise to the Lord, O my soul. Give praise to the Lord.
translation: Laat die sondenaars van die aarde wegraak, en laat al die slegte mense hul einde bereik. Lof die Here, my siel. Lof die Here.

original: O give praise to the Lord; give honour to his name, talking of his doings among the peoples.
translation: Loof die Here; gee eer aan sy naam en praat oor wat Hy onder die mense gedoen het.

original: Let your voice be sounding in songs and melody; let all your thoughts be of the wonder of his works.
translation: Laat jou stem klink in liedjies en musiek; maak seker jou gedagtes is vol van die wonder van wat Hy doen.

original: Have glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who are searching after the Lord be glad.
translation: Gee eer aan sy heilige naam; laat die harte van almal wat na die Here soek, bly wees.

original: Let your search be for the Lord and for his strength; let your hearts ever be turned to him.
translation: Soek altyd die Here en sy krag; laat julle harte altyd na Hom kyk.

original: Keep in mind the great works which he has done; his wonders, and the decisions of his mouth;
translation: Hou in gedagte die groot dinge wat hy gedoen het; sy wonderwerke, en die dinge wat hy gesê het;

original: O you seed of Abraham, his servant, you children of Jacob, his loved ones.
translation: O julle, nageslag van Abraham, sy dienaar, julle kinders van Jakob, sy geliefdes.

original: He is the Lord our God: he is judge of all the earth.
translation: Hy is die Here, ons God: hy is die regter van alles op aarde.

original: He has kept his agreement in mind for ever, the word which he gave for a thousand generations;
translation: Hy onthou sy ooreenkoms vir altyd, die woord wat Hy gegee het vir duisend geslagte.

original: The agreement which he made with Abraham, and his oath to Isaac;
translation: Die ooreenkoms wat hy met Abraham gemaak het, en sy eed aan Isak;

original: And he gave it to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an eternal agreement;
translation: En hy het dit aan Jakob gegee as 'n wet, en aan Israel as 'n ooreenkoms wat vir altyd geld;

original: Saying, To you will I give the land of Canaan, the measured line of your heritage:
translation: Ek sal jou die land van Kanaan gee, die grens van jou erfenis.

original: When they were still small in number, and strange in the land;
translation: Toe hulle nog min was en vreemdelinge in die land.

original: When they went about from one nation to another, and from one kingdom to another people.
translation: Toe hulle van een nasie na 'n ander gegaan het, en van een koninkryk na 'n ander mense.

original: He would not let anyone do them wrong; he even kept back kings because of them,
translation: Hy sou nie toelaat dat iemand hulle seergemaak het nie; selfs konings het hy keer gehou oor hulle.

original: Saying, Put not your hand on those who have been marked with my holy oil, and do my prophets no wrong.
translation: Moet nie aan dié wat met my heilige olie gemerk is nie, en behandel my profete goed.

original: And he took away all food from the land, so that the people were without bread.
translation: Hy het al die kos uit die land geneem, sodat die mense nie meer brood gehad het nie.

original: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was given as a servant for a price:
translation: Hy het 'n man voor hulle gestuur, naamlik Josef, wat as 'n dienaar vir 'n prys verkoop is.

original: His feet were fixed in chains; his neck was put in iron bands;
translation: Sy voete was met kettings vasgemaak; sy nek was met yster bande vasgemaak;

original: Till the time when his word came true; he was tested by the word of the Lord.
translation: Tot die tyd wanneer sy woord waar geword het; is hy op die proef gestel deur die woord van die Here.

original: The king sent men to take off his chains; even the ruler of the people, who let him go free.
translation: Die koning het mense gestuur om sy kettings af te haal; selfs die leier van die mense, wat hom vrygelaat het.

original: He made him lord of his house, and ruler over everything he had;
translation: Hy het hom die baas van sy huis gemaak, en hy het oor alles wat hy gehad het, regeer.

original: To give his chiefs teaching at his pleasure, and so that his law-givers might get wisdom from him.
translation: Om sy leiers te onderrig soos hy wil, sodat sy wetgewers wysheid van hom kan kry.

original: Then Israel came into Egypt, and Jacob was living in the land of Ham.
translation: Toe het Israel in Egipte gekom, en Jakob het in die land van Ham gebly.

original: And his people were greatly increased, and became stronger than those who were against them.
translation: En sy mense het baie gegroei, en hulle was sterker as diegene wat teen hulle was.

original: Their hearts were turned to hate against his people, so that they made secret designs against them.
translation: Hulle harte het na haat teen sy mense gedraai, so hulle het geheim planne teen hulle gemaak.

original: He sent Moses, his servant, and Aaron, the man of his selection.
translation: Hy het Moses, sy dienaar, en Aäron, die man wat hy gekies het, gestuur.

original: He let his signs be seen among the people, and his wonders in the land of Ham.
translation: Hy het sy tekens aan die mense gewys en sy wonders in die land van Ham gedoen.

original: He sent black night and made it dark; and they did not go against his word.
translation: Hy het 'n swart nag gestuur en dit donker gemaak; en hulle het nie teen sy woordgekyk nie.

original: At his word their waters were turned to blood, and he sent death on all their fish.
translation: Op sy woord het hulle water in bloed verander, en hy het dood op al hulle visse gestuur.

original: Their land was full of frogs, even in the rooms of the king.
translation: Hul land was vol van paddas, selfs in die kamers van die koning.

original: He gave the word, and there came the dog-fly, and insects over all the land.
translation: Hy het die woord gegee, en daar het die vlieg gekom, en insekte oor die hele land.

original: He gave them ice for rain, and flaming fire in their land.
translation: Hy het vir hulle ys gegee in plaas van reën, en brandende vuur in hulle land.

original: He gave their vines and their fig-trees to destruction, and the trees of their land were broken down.
translation: Hy het hulle wingerde en vyebome vernietig, en die bome van hulle grond is omgekap.

original: At his word the locusts came, and young locusts more than might be numbered,
translation: Op sy woord het die sprinkane gekom, en daar was soveel jong sprinkane dat jy hulle nie kon tel nie.

original: And put an end to all the plants of their land, taking all the fruit of the earth for food.
translation: En maak 'n einde aan al die plante in hulle land, terwyl hulle al die vrugte van die aarde vir kos neem.

original: He put to death the first child of every family in the land, the first-fruits of their strength.
translation: Hy het die eerste kind van elke gesin in die land doodgemaak, die eerste vrugte van hul krag.

original: He took his people out with silver and gold: there was not one feeble person among them.
translation: Hy het sy mense uitgebring met silwer en goud: daar was nie een swakkeling tussen hulle nie.

original: Egypt was glad when they went; for the fear of them had come down on them.
translation: Egipte was bly toe hulle gegaan het; want hulle het bang vir hulle geword.

original: A cloud was stretched over them for a cover; and he sent fire to give light in the night.
translation: 'n Wolk het oor hulle gesweef soos 'n kombers; en hy het vuur gestuur om lig te gee in die nag.

original: At the people's request he sent birds, and gave them the bread of heaven for food.
translation: Op die mense se versoek het hy voëls gestuur en vir hulle die brood van die hemel gegee om te eet.

original: His hand made the rock open, and the waters came streaming out; they went down through the dry places like a river.
translation: Sy hand het die klip oopgemaak, en die water het met 'n stroom uitgekom; dit het deur die droë plekke gegaan soos 'n rivier.

original: For he kept in mind his holy word, and Abraham, his servant.
translation: Hy het sy heilige boodskap in gedagte gehou, en Abraham, sy dienaar.

original: And he took his people out with joy, the men of his selection with glad cries:
translation: Hy het sy mense met vreugde uitgelei, die mense wat hy gekies het, met blye geskree.

original: And gave them the lands of the nations; and they took the work of the peoples for a heritage;
translation: En het vir hulle die lande van die nasies gegee; en hulle het die werk van die mense as 'n erfenis geneem.

original: So that they might keep his orders, and be true to his laws. Give praise to the Lord.
translation: So hulle kan sy opdragte hou en getrou wees aan sy wette. Loof die Here.

original: Let the Lord be praised. O give praise to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy is unchanging for ever.
translation: Prys die Here. O, gee prys aan die Here, want Hy is goed: sy genade bly altyd dieselfde.

original: Who is able to give an account of the great acts of the Lord, or to make clear all his praise?
translation: Wie kan vertel van die groot dade van die Here of al sy lof duidelik maak?

original: Happy are they whose decisions are upright, and he who does righteousness at all times.
translation: Gelukkig is hulle wie se besluitings reg is, en hy wat altyd die regte ding doen.

original: Keep me in mind, O Lord, when you are good to your people; O let your salvation come to me;
translation: Onthou my, Here, wanneer U goed is vir U mense; laat U redding my toe.

original: So that I may see the well-being of the people of your selection, and have a part in the joy of your nation, and take pride in your heritage.
translation: Ek wil sien hoe goed dit gaan met die mense wat jy gekies het, deelneem aan die vreugde van jou nasie, en trots wees op jou erfenis.

original: We are sinners like our fathers, we have done wrong, our acts are evil.
translation: Ons maak foute soos ons vaders, ons het verkeerd opgetree, ons dade is sleg.

original: Our fathers did not give thought to your wonders in Egypt; they did not keep in memory the great number of your mercies, but gave you cause for wrath at the sea, even at the Red Sea.
translation: Ons vaders het nie aan jou wonders in Egipte gedink nie; hulle het nie onthou van al die genade wat jy gegee het nie, maar hulle het jou kwaad gemaak by die see, selfs by die Rooi See.

original: But he was their saviour because of his name, so that men might see his great power.
translation: Maar hy was hulle redder omdat sy naam dit moontlik gemaak het, sodat mense sy groot krag kon sien.

original: By his word the Red Sea was made dry: and he took them through the deep waters as through the waste land.
translation: Met sy woord het Hy die Rooi See droog gemaak, en Hy het hulle deur die diep waters gelei soos deur 'n woestyn.

original: And he took them safely out of the hands of their haters, and kept them from the attacks of those who were against them.
translation: En Hy het hulle veilig uit die hande van hulle vyande gehaal en hulle beskerm teen die aanvalle van diegene wat teen hulle was.

original: And the waters went over their haters; all of them came to an end.
translation: En die waters het oor hulle wat haat gegaan, almal het geëindig.

original: Then they had faith in his words; they gave him songs of praise.
translation: Toe het hulle in sy woorde geglo; hulle het vir hom lofliedere gesing.

original: But their memory of his works was short; not waiting to be guided by him,
translation: Maar hulle het gou vergeet van wat hy gedoen het; hulle het nie gewag om deur hom gelei te word nie.

original: They gave way to their evil desires in the waste land, and put God to the test in the dry places.
translation: Hulle het hulle slegte begeertes gevolg in die woestyn en het God uitgedaag in die droë plekke.

original: And he gave them their request, but sent a wasting disease into their souls.
translation: En Hy het hulle versoek in vervulling laat gaan, maar het 'n siekte in hulle siele gestuur.

original: They were full of envy against Moses among the tents, and against Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.
translation: Hulle was vol jaloesie teenoor Moses tussen die tente, en teenoor Aaron, die heilige van die Here.

original: The earth opening put an end to Dathan, covering up Abiram and his band.
translation: Die grond het oopgegaan en Dathan se lewe beëindig, en het Abiram en sy mense bedek.

original: And a fire was lighted among their tents; the sinners were burned up by the flames.
translation: Daar is 'n vuur aangesteek tussen hulle se tente; die sondaars is deur die vlamme verbrand.

original: They made a young ox in Horeb, and gave worship to an image of gold.
translation: Hulle het 'n jong os by Horeb gemaak en 'n beeld van goud aanbid.

original: And their glory was changed into the image of an ox, whose food is grass.
translation: En hulle se glorie het in die beeld van 'n os verander, wat gras eet.

original: They had no memory of God their saviour, who had done great things in Egypt;
translation: Hulle het nie onthou van God, hulle redder, wat groot dinge in Egipte gedoen het nie.

original: Works of wonder in the land of Ham, and things of fear by the Red Sea.
translation: Wonderwerke in die land van Ham, en dinge wat mense bang maak by die Rooi See.

original: And he was purposing to put an end to them if Moses, his special servant, had not gone up before him, between him and his people, turning back his wrath, to keep them from destruction.
translation: En hy het beplan om hulle te vernietig, maar Moses, sy spesiale dienaar, het voor hom gaan staan, tussen hom en sy mense, en sy woede afgebuig om hulle van ondergang te red.

original: They were disgusted with the good land; they had no belief in his word;
translation: Hulle was teleurgesteld in die goeie grond; hulle het nie in sy woord geglo nie;

original: Talking against him secretly in their tents, they did not give ear to the voice of the Lord.
translation: Hulle het stilletjies oor hom in hul tente gepraat en nie na God se stem geluister nie.

original: So he made an oath against them, to put an end to them in the waste land:
translation: So het hy 'n belofte gemaak om hulle in die woestyn uit te wis.

original: That their children might be mixed among the nations, and sent away into other lands.
translation: dat hulle kinders tussen die nasies kan meng en na ander lande gestuur kan word.

original: And they were joined to Baal-peor, and took part in the offerings to the dead.
translation: Hulle het by Baal-peor aangesluit en het deelgeneem aan die offers vir die dooies.

original: So they made him angry by their behaviour; and he sent disease on them.
translation: Hulle het hom kwaad gemaak met hulle gedrag; en hy het siektes oor hulle gestuur.

original: Then Phinehas got up, and made prayer for them; and the disease went no farther.
translation: Toe het Pinhas opgestaan en vir hulle gebid, en die siekte het nie verder versprei nie.

original: And all the generations coming after him kept the memory of his righteousness for ever.
translation: En al die geslagte wat na hom gekom het, het die herinnering aan sy regverdigheid vir altyd gehou.

original: They made God angry again at the waters of Meribah, so that Moses was troubled because of them;
translation: Hulle het weer vir God kwaad gemaak by die waters van Meribah, en dit het Moses ontstel oor hulle.

original: For they made his spirit bitter, and he said unwise things.
translation: Want hulle het sy gees bitter gemaak, en hy het onnozele dinge gesê.

original: They did not put an end to the peoples, as the Lord had said;
translation: Hulle het nie die mense beëindig nie, soos die Here gesê het;

original: But they were joined to the nations, learning their works.
translation: Maar hulle het by die nasies aangesluit en het van hulle dinge geleer.

original: And they gave worship to images; which were a danger to them:
translation: Hulle het aan beelde aanbid; dit was gevaarlik vir hulle:

original: They even made offerings of their sons and their daughters to evil spirits,
translation: Hulle het selfs geskenke van hulle seuns en dogters aan slegte geeste gemaak.

original: And gave the blood of their sons and their daughters who had done no wrong, offering them to the images of Canaan; and the land was made unclean with blood.
translation: En het die bloed van hulle seuns en dogters gegee wat niks verkeerd gedoen het nie, en hulle aan die beelde van Kanaän geoffer; en die land is onrein gemaak met bloed.

original: So they became unclean through their works, going after their evil desires.
translation: Hulle het onrein geword deur wat hulle gedoen het, omdat hulle hulle slegte begeertes nagejaag het.

original: Then the wrath of the Lord was burning against his people, and he was angry with his heritage.
translation: Toe was God se woede teen sy mense aan die brand, en Hy was kwaad vir sy erfdeel.

original: And he gave them into the hands of the nations; and they were ruled by their haters.
translation: Hy het hulle in die hande van die nasies gegee; en hulle is regeer deur diegene wat hulle haat.

original: By them they were crushed, and made low under their hands.
translation: Hulle is gebroke en laag gemaak onder hulle hande.

original: Again and again he made them free; but their hearts were turned against his purpose, and they were overcome by their sins.
translation: Hy het hulle weer en weer vrygemaak; maar hulle harte het teen sy bedoeling gedraai, en hulle is oorwin deur hulle sondes.

original: But when their cry came to his ears, he had pity on their trouble:
translation: Maar toe hulle se kreun by hom aankom, het hy jammer gekry oor hulle moeilikheid.

original: And kept in mind his agreement with them, and in his great mercy gave them forgiveness.
translation: en het onthou van sy ooreenkoms met hulle, en in sy groot genade het hy vir hulle vergewe.

original: He put pity into the hearts of those who made them prisoners.
translation: Hy het medelye in die harte van die mense gesit wat hulle gevangenes gemaak het.

original: Be our saviour, O Lord our God, and let us come back together from among the nations, so that we may give honour to your holy name, and have glory in your praise.
translation: Wees ons verlosser, O Here ons God, en laat ons weer saamkom uit die volke, sodat ons u heilige naam kan eer en u kan prys.

original: Praise be to the Lord God of Israel for ever and for ever; and let all the people say, So be it. Give praise to the Lord.
translation: Laat die Here God van Israel vir ewig geprys word; en laat al die mense sê, So wees dit. Gee prys aan die Here.

original: O give praise to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy is unchanging for ever.
translation: Lof die Here, want Hy is goed: sy genade verander nooit.

original: Let those whose cause the Lord has taken up say so, his people whom he has taken out of the hands of their haters;
translation: Laat die mense vir wie God sorg, dit sê, sy mense wat hy uit die hand van hul hateres gehaal het;

original: Making them come together out of all the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.
translation: Laat hulle saamkom uit al die lande, van die ooste en van die weste, van die noorde en van die suide.

original: They were wandering in the waste places; they saw no way to a resting-place.
translation: Hulle het rondgedwaal in die dor plekke; hulle het nie geweet hoe om rus te vind nie.

original: Their souls became feeble for need of food and drink.
translation: Hul siele het swak geword omdat hulle kos en drink nodig gehad het.

original: Then they sent up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gave them salvation out of all their troubles;
translation: Toe het hulle in hul verdriet na die Here geroep, en Hy het hulle uit al hulle probleme gered.

original: Guiding them in the right way, so that they might come into the town of their resting-place.
translation: Hulpe om die regte pad te volg, sodat hulle in die dorpie van hulle rusplek kan aankom.

original: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!
translation: Laat mense die Here prys vir sy liefde, en vir die wonders wat Hy doen vir die mense.

original: He gives its desire to the unresting soul, so that it is full of good things.
translation: Hy gee wat die siel wat nie rustigheid kry verlang, sodat dit vol goeie dinge is.

original: Those who were in the dark, in the black night, in chains of sorrow and iron;
translation: Die mense wat in die donker was, in die swart nag, in kettings van hartseer en yster;

original: Because they went against the words of God, and gave no thought to the laws of the Most High:
translation: Omdat hulle teen God se woorde opgetree het en nie aan die wette van die Hoogste gedink het nie.

original: So that he made their hearts weighted down with grief; they were falling, and had no helper.
translation: Hy het hulle harte swaar gemaak met hartseer; hulle het val, en hulle het niemand om hulle te help nie.

original: Then they sent up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gave them salvation out of all their troubles.
translation: Toe het hulle in hulle hartseer na die Here geroep, en Hy het hulle uit al hulle probleme gered.

original: He took them out of the dark and the black night, and all their chains were broken.
translation: Hy het hulle uit die donker en die swart nag uitgehaal, en al hulle kettings was gebroke.

original: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!
translation: Laat mense God prys vir sy liefde, en vir die wonderwerke wat Hy doen vir mense!

original: The doors of brass are broken by his arm, and the bands of iron are cut in two.
translation: Die koperdeure word gebroke deur sy arm, en die ysterbande word in twee gesny.

original: Foolish men, because of their sins, and because of their wrongdoing, are troubled;
translation: Dwase mense, omdat hulle sondes en verkeerde dinge doen, is ongemaklik.

original: They are disgusted by all food, and they come near to the doors of death.
translation: Hulle is vies vir al die kos, en hulle kom naby die dood.

original: Then they send up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gives them salvation out of all their troubles.
translation: Hulle roep na die Here in hul verdriet, en Hy red hulle uit al hulle probleme.

original: He sent his word and made them well, and kept them safe from the underworld.
translation: Hy het sy boodskap gestuur en hulle gesond gemaak, en veilig gehou van die onderwereld.

original: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!
translation: Laat mense die Here prys vir sy genade en die wonders wat Hy vir die mense doen!

original: Let them make offerings of praise, giving news of his works with cries of joy.
translation: Laat hulle lof aanbied en vertel van wat Hy gedoen het met blije geskreeu.

original: Those who go down to the sea in ships, who do business in the great waters;
translation: Hulle wat met skepe na die see gaan en besigheid doen in die groot water;

original: They see the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.
translation: Hulle sien wat die Here doen en sy wonders in die dieptes.

original: For at his word comes up the storm-wind, lifting high the waves.
translation: Want met sy woord kom die stormwind op, en hy lig die golwe hoog.

original: The sailors go up to heaven, and down into the deep; their souls are wasted because of their trouble.
translation: Die matrose gaan op na die hemel en af in die verdieping; hulle siels is uitgeput deur al hulle moeilikhede.

original: They are turned here and there, rolling like a man who is full of wine; and all their wisdom comes to nothing.
translation: Hulle draai hier en daar, rol soos 'n man wat vol wyn is; en al hulle wysheid beteken niks.

original: Then they send up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gives them salvation out of all their troubles.
translation: Toe roep hulle na die Here in hulle hartseer, en Hy red hulle uit al hulle probleme.

original: He makes the storm into a calm, so that the waves are at peace.
translation: Hy maak die storms stil, sodat die golwe rustig is.

original: Then they are glad, because the sea is quiet, and he takes them to the harbour of their desire.
translation: Dan is hulle bly, want die see is stil, en hy neem hulle na die hawe waar hulle graag wil wees.

original: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!
translation: Laat mense die Here prys vir sy liefde, en vir die wonders wat Hy doen vir mense se kinders!

original: Let them give glory to him in the meeting of the people, and praise among the chiefs.
translation: Laat hulle hom eer wanneer mense bymekaar is, en prys hom onder die leiers.

original: He makes rivers into waste places, and springs of water into a dry land;
translation: Hy maak riviere tot vuil plekke, en fonteine van water in 'n droë land.

original: He makes a fertile country into a salt waste, because of the sins of those who are living there.
translation: Hy maak 'n vrugbare land in 'n soutwoestyn, omdat die mense wat daar woon se sonde dit so maak.

original: He makes a waste land into a place of water, and a dry land into water-springs.
translation: Hy maak 'n woesteny in 'n plek vol water, en 'n droë grond in waterbronne.

original: And there he gives the poor a resting-place, so that they may make themselves a town;
translation: En daar gee Hy vir die armes 'n plek om te rus, sodat hulle vir hulleself 'n dorp kan maak;

original: And put seed in the fields and make vine-gardens, to give them fruit.
translation: En plant saadjies in die velde en maak wingerde om vrugte te gee.

original: He gives them his blessing so that they are increased greatly, and their cattle do not become less.
translation: Hy gee vir hulle sy seën sodat hulle baie meer kry, en hulle diere raak nie minder nie.

original: And when they are made low, and crushed by trouble and sorrow,
translation: En wanneer hulle onderdruk word en gesukkel en hartseer ervaar,

original: He puts an end to the pride of kings, and sends them wandering in the waste lands where there is no way.
translation: Hy stop die trots van konings en laat hulle rondloop in die woeste plekke waar daar geen paaie is nie.

original: But he puts the poor man on high from his troubles, and gives him families like a flock.
translation: Maar hy help die arme man op om van sy probleme af, en gee vir hom families soos 'n skape.

original: The upright see it and are glad: the mouth of the sinner is stopped.
translation: Die regverdiges sien dit en is bly: die mond van die sondaar is toe.

original: Let the wise give thought to these things, and see the mercies of the Lord.
translation: Laat die slim mense oor hierdie dinge dink en die genade van die Here sien.

original: O God, my heart is fixed; I will make songs and melody, even with my glory.
translation: O God, my hart is reg; ek gaan liedjies en melodieë maak, selfs met my eer.

original: Give out your sounds, O corded instruments: the dawn will be awaking with my song.
translation: Laat jou klanke hoor, O snaarinstrumente: die oggend sal wakker word met my lied.

original: I will give you praise, O Lord, among the peoples; I will make melody to you among the nations.
translation: Ek sal jou prys, Here, tussen die volke; ek sal vir jou sing tussen die nasies.
